Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, hasta que se le presento la oportunidad de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y camisetas. Su mayor sueño es seguir con vida para mantener esta actividad.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Elena is 30 years of age. For work, she sells various products. She has had her business for more than 5 years. She is a street vendor because this is the only way to show her merchandise. She started with very few resources with her own funds but she has a great desire to get ahead as she has to pay the bills for her housing and food. Little by little she has increased her inventory with the little earnings her business generates. It was not until now that she was presented with the opportunity to work with Fundación León 2000. The loan she requests is for business capital for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, and t-shirts. Her greatest dream is to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Leonit Mejail

texts.en:
Leonit is a member of Asociación Arariwa. That is, he is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. His group is called Sacro. He is from Cruz Pata and lives there in Cusco. He is 29 years old and lives with his partner. They would like to have children.

Leonit is a mechanic. With the loan, he and his partner want to open an internet café in Cruz Pata.

Leonit appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: opening an Internet café in Cruz Pata

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. Her group is called Sacro. She is from Cruz Pata and still lives there. She is 57 years old and is married with 8 children and 4 grandchildren. 

Tomasa is a farmer. She grows potatoes, beans and wheat. With the loan, she will buy seeds, fertilizer and dirt for her fields.

Tomasa appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: purchasing seeds, fertilizer and dirt for her fields

loans.name: Augustus

texts.en:
Augustus is a 39 year old businessman. He runs a butchery in Miu area of Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. He has been operating this business for 2 years. He is requesting for a loan of Kes. 20,000, with which he will purchase goats for slaughter in his butchery. Augustus is the father of three children; consequently, hopes to grow his business into a big restaurant and have multiple outlets in order to be able to provide for them. He describes himself as faithful and driven.

About Faulu Kenya:

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing them with financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company. This will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: purchasing goats for slaughter

loans.name: Valeria

texts.en:
Valeria is a member of Asociación Arariwa, a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Sacro. She is from Cruz Pata and still lives there. She is a 55 year old widow with 2 children and 2 grandchildren. 

Valeria splits her time between farming and buying and selling dry goods like potatoes and beans. With the loan, she will buy seeds for her fields.

Valeria appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: puchasing seeds for her fields

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a member of Asociación Arariwa, a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Sacro. Andrea is from Cruz Pata and still lives there. She is 36 years old and is married with 4 children. 

Andrea splits her time between agriculture and making a Peruvian drink called chicha in her house. With the loan, she will buy livestock to raise.

Andrea appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: purchasing livestock

loans.name: Los Fuerte 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Emilia, 24, lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group Los Fuerte (The Strong), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. 

Emilia and the other members of Los Fuerte live in Boca Chica, a small town west of San Pedro. Emilia lives with her sister and her nine-year-old son. Life in Boca Chica can be difficult; despite its proximity to San Pedro as well as the capital, Santo Domingo, Boca Chica lacks any kind of reliable electricity or running water. 

Despite these difficulties, Emilia runs a successful shop selling clothing and hair products to her neighbors and friends. The shop is set up in her home, but one day she would like to have a separate place for her business. With the loan that she is requesting - her second loan with Esperanza - she hopes to begin saving more so that she can send her son to college one day. Thank you for lending to Emilia and the Los Fuerte group!

loans.use: purchasing hair products and more clothing

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Asociación Arariwa, a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Sacro. Victoria is from Cruz Pata and still lives there. She is 51 years old and is married with 4 children and 2 granchildren. 

Victoria is a small farmer. On her land, she grows corn, potatoes and some Peruvian greens. With the loan, she will buy seeds and fertilizer for her fields.

Victoria appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: purchasing seeds and fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Mariano Nieves

texts.en:
Mariano is a member of the Asociación Arariwa, a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Sacro. Mariano is from Cruz Pata and still lives there. He is 57 years old and is married with 4 children and 2 grandchildren. 

Mariano is a small farmer. On his land, he grows potatoes, beans and barley. With the loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizer for his fields.

Mariano appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: purchasing seeds and fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 60 year old businesswoman in Kajiado. She runs a grocery that sells potatoes, onions, sukumawiki (kale), maize, peas, beans and cabbage, among other things. She has been in this business for twenty years and hopes to expand her business and teach her grown up children how to run the business themselves. She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy more stock for her stall. A mother to two adult male children, Monica describes herself as hardworking, intelligent and calm.

About Faulu Kenya:

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing them with financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company. This will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: purchasing stock for her stall

loans.name: Placida

texts.en:
Placida is a member of the Asociación Arariwa, a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Sacro. Placida from Cruz Pata and still lives there. She is 41 years old and is married with 3 children, all of whom study in Cruz Pata.

Placida grows and sells beans and potatoes from her home in Cruz Pata. With the loan, she will pay the wages of the laborers who help her on the farm.

Placida appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: paying the wages of the laborers who help her on her farm

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, “Los Andes” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Rios de agua viva”, con aproximadamente 2 años de vida, cuenta con 12 integrantes que en su mayoría se dedican al tejido de mantas  y venta de comida, pocas se dedican a la elaboración de tarjetas,  confección de chamarras, producción de cotillones y venta de repuesto de auto, ellas indican que necesitan  el préstamo para la compra de materia prima que les permita elaborar sus productos, como lana, tela y otras para comprar mercadería.

Este grupo tiene como líderes a Olga E. como la presidenta, Mery M. es la Tesorera y Guadalupe Q. es la Secretaria de Actas. A todas les gusta participar en las reuniones así como en las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The community bank group "Rios De Agua Viva" ("Rivers of Life Water") is based out of one of the regional offices of Kiva partner Pro Mujer near the Andes. The group has about two years' experience, and the majority of the 12 members make a living weaving blankets and selling food. A few others dedicate themselves to making cards, sewing jackets, producing party favors or selling spare auto parts. The members are in need of the loan so they can purchase the supplies they need to make their products, such as wool and fabric, while other plan to use the loan to purchase merchandise. The leader of this group is president Olga E., Mery M. is the treasurer and Guadalupe Q. is the secretary. All the members enjoy participating in their meetings as well as the training sessions.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Our client is Juan. He is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Sacro. He is from Cruz Pata and lives in Cusco. He is 44 years old and lives with his partners and three children.

Juan is a public employee and works for the Ministry of Transport. He also has a transportation business. With this loan, he will grow his transportation business. He has two employees and for now the business is running smoothly.

Juan appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To grow his transportation business

loans.name: Bc Abejitas Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  BC ABEJITAS  está conformado por DOCE personas de edades variadas que oscilan desde los 20 a los 55 años. La presidenta de la banca es una persona de carácter fuerte, alegre  y proactiva que en conjunto con sus vecinas forman parte de la banca, por otro lado tiene 1 hijo el cual se encuentra en edad escolar , La Sra. Marcela es la tesorera de la banca en una persona muy alegre, determinada y proactiva, que es madres de tres hijos pero uno de ellos ya formo su propio hogar la Sra. Santusa es la secretaria de la banca es una persona con carácter calmado pero proactivo y determinado , las otras personas que conforman la banca tienen personalidades similares. La presidenta  la Sra. Simona se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, la Sra. Marcela se dedica a la venta de ropa de mujer (mandiles polleras) los cuales los comercializa en interior del departamento donde vive. La  Sra. Santusa se dedica a la venta de zapatos deportivos  por mayor lo  cual lo distribuye en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad, otras de las socias se dedican a la venta de comida tanto en su domicilio como en la feria, otro miembro  se dedica a la elaboración de colchones de lana, otra de la socias se dedica a venta de ropa deportiva.  Si bien dentro de los lugares donde se desarrollan sus actividades existen otros similares, la afluencia de  consumidores a los mercados, y el constante crecimiento urbano  hace que las actividades que se desarrollan en el lugar no se vean afectadas por lo contrario muchas de las socias están esperanzadas en hacer crecer sus negocios ampliándolos por lo cual solicitan el crédito. Las socias solicitan  el crédito para realizar la adquisición de mercadería en mayor cantidad, otras para la compra de nueva maquinas para incrementar su producción, otros para compra de materia prima en cantidad con lo cual crecer en cuanto a su capital de trabajo. Este grupo se encuentra en su primer ciclo, pero   la mayoría de ellas ya se conocen entre sí y cuentan con experiencia de trabajo en esta modalidad de crédito.
texts.en:
The BC Abejitas Communal Bank is comprised of 12 people of various ages from 20 to 55. The president of the bank is a person of strong character, happy, and proactive. Together with her neighbors she forms part of the bank. Her only child attends school. Marcela is the treasurer of the bank. She is a very happy, determined, and proactive person. She has three children; one has his own home. Santusa is the secretary of the bank. She is very calm, yet she is also proactive and determined. The other people who comprise the bank have similar personalities. The president, Simona, sells domestic appliances. Marcela sells women’s clothes (aprons and “polleras” traditional Bolivian skirts). She sells in the interior of the department where she lives. Santusa sells wholesale sporting shoes. She distributes them in the different fairs in the city. The other members sell things like food in their homes and at the fairs. Others make quilts from wool or sell sportswear. If there are others in their area doing the same work, the abundance of consumers in the market and the constant urban growth make sure that they are not affected. On the contrary, many of the members are hoping to make their businesses grow by expanding them. That is why they are asking for the loan. The members are asking for the loan to get a greater quantity of merchandise. Others will buy new machines to increase their production. Others will buy raw materials in large quantities, which will increase their working capital. This group is in their first cycle, but the majority of them already know each other and have working experience with this type of loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Nelbi

texts.en:
Nelbi is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco.  The group is called Sacro.  She is from Limatambo and lives in Cusco.  She is 37 years old and lives with her partner and two children who study in Cusco.

Nelbi has a transportation business. With this loan, she will maintain her vehicle and pay for her children’s schooling.

Nelbi appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To maintain the vehicle used in her transportation business and pay for her childrens’ schooling

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco.  The group is called Sacro.  She is 39 years old and lives in Cruz Pata with her husband and and six children.

Margarita splits her time between growing cereal grains and buying and selling products like barley, potatoes, corn, beans, and wheat.  With this loan, she will buy more goods to sell.

Margarita appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy food products to sell

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco.  The group is called Sacro.  He is from Chinchero and lives in Cruz Pata.  He is 46 years old and married.

Alberto has a small farm and unloads merchandise from trucks in Cusco.  With this loan, he will buy supplies for his farm.

Alberto appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his farm

loans.name: Faroles Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  BC FAROLES está conformado por trece personas D. edades variadas que oscilan desD. los 20 a los 50 años. El presidente D. la banca es una persona D. carácter fuerte, alegre  y proactiva que en conjunto con su hermana forma parte D. la banca, por otro lado tiene 1 hijo el cual se encuentra en edad escolar, La Sra. Missel tesorera es una persona determinada y proactiva, que cuenta con un niño menor a un año la Sra. Sandra Elizabeth secretaria D. la banca es una persona con carácter proactivo y determinado, las otras personas que conforman la banca tienen personalidades similares. El  presidente el Sr. Alberto se  dedica a la  confección D. ropa (deportivos), la Sra. Miseel se dedica a la venta D. celulares en la feria D. la cuidad. La Sra. Sandra se dedica a la venta D. material D. escritorio (scotch) por mayor lo  cual lo distribuye en las diferentes ferias D. la ciudad, otra D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. comida en su domicilio, otro miembro  se dedica a la reparación D. celulares como D. computadoras. Si bien dentro D. los lugares donD. se desarrollan sus actividades existen otros similares, la afluencia D.  consumidores a los mercados, y el constante crecimiento urbano  hace que las actividades que se  desarrollan en el lugar no se vean afectadas por lo contrario muchas D. las socias están esperanzadas en hacer crecer sus negocios ampliándolos por lo cual solicitan el crédito. Las socias solicitan  el crédito para realizar la adquisición D. mercadería en mayor cantidad, otras para la compra D. nueva maquinas para incrementar su producción, otros para compra D. materia prima en cantidad con lo cual crecer en cuanto a su capital D. trabajo. Este grupo se encuentra en su primer ciclo, pero   la mayoría D. ellas ya se conocen entre sí y cuentan con experiencia D. trabajo en esta modalidad D. crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank called BC FAROLES consists of 13 people of various ages that range from 20 to 50 years. The president of the bank is a person of strong character, cheerful and proactive who, with his sister, forms part of the bank. He has a son who is school-aged. Senora Missel, treasurer, is a go-getter and a determined person who has a minor child who is a year old. Sandra Elizabeth, secretary of the bank, is a person who is very determined and proactive, and the other members of the bank have similar personalities. The president, Alberto, makes sporting clothes. Senora Missel sells cellular phones in a market in the city. Sandra sells office supplies (scotch tape, etc.) wholesale, which she distributes in the different markets in the city. Other members sell food from their homes and another member repairs cell phones and computers. While there are other similar businesses in the area where they are developing their activities, the affluence of the consumers in the markets and the constant urban growth makes it such that the activities that they are developing are not affected. On the contrary, many of the members are hoping to grow their businesses and for this reason they are requesting this loan. The members are requesting this loan in order to acquire merchandise in greater quantity, others to buy new machines to increase their production, others to buy raw materials in quantity and thus increase their working capital. This group is in its first credit cycle, but the majority of them already know each other and have experience working with this type of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food for livestock and more livestock to raise

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town located 45 minutes from Cusco.  The group is called Sacro.  He lives in Cruz Pata.  He is 39 years old and is married.

Francisco has a transport business and drives a taxi.  With this loan, he will maintain his vehicle.

Francisco appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  MUJERES VENCEDORAS está conformado por trece personas D. edades variadas que oscilan desD. los 20 a los 50 años. La presidenta es madre D. tres hijos uno D. ellos ya conformo su familia y los otros son adolecentes, La Sra. Juana tesorera D. la banca en una persona muy alegre y proactiva, la Sra. Nora secretaria D. la banca es una persona con carácter fuerte y proactivo las otras personas que conforman la banca tienen personalidades similares. La presidenta la Sra. Yolanda se dedica a la administración D. una pequeña tienda D. barrio y a la distribución D. cerveza, la Sra. Juana  se dedica a la artesanía en lana como ser prendas D. vestir y otros productos que los realiza en su domicilio. La Sra. Nora también se dedica a la artesanía en lana como algunas D. las socias que con las cuales comparten esta actividad, otras  socias D. dedican a la venta D. ropa deportiva, para mujeres, para niños, la Sra. Lourdes se dedica a la venta D. muñecos D. peluche, otra D. las socias a la venta sal en las ferias D. la zona, también hay otras socias que se dedica a la elaboración D. joyas tanto en oro como en plata. Si bien dentro D. los lugares donD. se desarrollan sus actividades existen otros similares, la afluencia D.  consumidores a los mercados, y el constante crecimiento urbano  hace que las actividades que se desarrollen en el lugar no se vean afectadas por lo contrario muchas D. las socias están esperanzadas en hacer crecer sus negocios ampliándolos por lo cual solicitan el crédito. Las socias solicitan  el crédito para realizar la adquisición D. mercadería en mayor cantidad, otras para la compra D. materiales D. construcción  para el ampliado D. sus pequeños locales y dar mejor atención a sus clientes otras para la compra D. materia prima y D. esta manera incrementar su capital D. trabajo. Este grupo se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, por lo cual  la mayoría D. ellas ya se conocen entre sí y cuentan con experiencia D. trabajo en esta modalidad D. crédito.
texts.en:
The community bank called Mujeres Vencedoras consists of 13 people of a variety of ages that range from 20 to 50 years old. The president is a mother of 3 children, one of which is already settled with his own family and the others are adolescents. Juana is the treasurer of the bank and is a very cheerful and proactive person. Nora is the secretary of the bank and has a strong and proactive character. The other people that belong to the bank have similar personalities. The president, Yolanda, runs a small neighborhood store and a beer distribution business. Juana works in her home crafting wool garments and other products. Nora also works in the crafting of wool, along with some of the other members who share this activity. Other members work selling sports clothing for women and children. Lourdes works selling stuffed animals. Others work selling salt at the open markets in the area. There are also members who work making jewelry from gold and silver. While there are other similar businesses in the area where the members are developing their businesses, the influx of consumer markets and the continued urban growth make it so that the development of their activities is not adversely affected; on the contrary many members are hoping to grow and extend their businesses which is why they are asking for a loan. The members are asking for credit to be able to buy goods in greater quantities; others to buy materials for construction to enlarge their small shops and to give better service to their customers; other to buy raw materials to increase their working capital. This group is in their second loan cycle and so most of them already know each other and have experience working with this type of loan.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and raw materiales

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  NUEVO PROGRESO está conformado por doce personas de edades variadas que oscilan desde los 20 a los 50 años. La presidenta en conjunto con sus hermanos forma parte de la banca, por otro lado tiene 1 hijo el cual se encuentra en edad escolar, La Sra. Filomena tesorera de la banca en una persona muy alegre, determinada y proactiva, la Sr. David secretario de la banca es una persona con carácter calmado pero proactivo, las otras personas que conforman la banca tienen personalidades similares. La presidenta la Sra. Hilda se dedica a la venta  de ropa (chamaras) en el interior del departamento, la Sra. Filomena S. se dedica a la venta de ropa (abrigos y chamarras) en la feria de la ciudad y también lleva su producto a vender al interior del departamento. Sr. David está iniciando su actividad en negocio de venta de CDs en la feria de la zona. Dentro de este grupo existe  la particularidad de contar un número considerable de socios varones los cuales en su mayoría se dedica a la conducción de  transporte público socias de dedican a la  elaboración de helados los cuales distribuye en gran cantidad. Si bien dentro de los lugares donde se desarrollan sus actividades existen otros similares, la afluencia de  consumidores a los mercados, y el constante crecimiento urbano  hace que las actividades que se  desarrollan en el lugar no se vean afectadas. Las socias están esperanzadas en hacer crecer sus negocios ampliándolos por lo cual solicitan el crédito. Las socias solicitan  el crédito para realizar la adquisición de mercadería en mayor cantidad, otras para la compra de nueva maquinaria para incrementar su producción, otros para compra de repuestos para mejora sus vehículos y dar mejor atención a sus clientes. Este grupo se encuentra en su quinto ciclo, lo cual  la mayoría de ellas ya se conocen entre sí y cuentan con experiencia de trabajo en esta modalidad de crédito.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Progreso" [New Progress] communal bank is made up of twelve people, whose ages vary between 20 and 50 years. The president, Hilda, is a member of the bank along with her siblings, and she also has one child currently of school age. Filomena, the bank's treasurer, is a very cheerful, determined and proactive person. David, the bank's secretary, is a person with a calm but proactive character; the other members of the bank also have similar personalities. Hilda, the president, sells clothing (jackets) within the province. Filomena sells clothing (overcoats and jackets) in the city's marketplace and also takes her products to sell within the province. David has recently started a business selling CDs at the local marketplace. This group is noteworthy in having a considerable number of male members, most of whom work as drivers in public transportation. There are also members who prepare ice cream and distribute it in large quantities. While there are competitors with similar businesses in the places where the bank members carry out their activities, the affluence of the consumers at the markets and the area's constant urban growth have allowed them to continue without negative effects. The partners are hopeful that their businesses will grow and expand, and they are requesting the current loan for that purpose. They are asking for the loan to purchase merchandise in larger quantities; in some cases to purchase new equipment to increase their production levels; and in others to buy spare parts to improve their vehicles and provide better service to their customers. This group is currently in its fifth loan cycle; accordingly, most of them already know each other and have experience working with this type of loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Sajama 1 Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  SAJAMA 1, está conformado por doce señoras que en su mayoría radican en la misma zona de la ciudad; la característica principal de sus casas, es que son de adobe en gran parte de ellas y tienen solo una planta. El banco comunal está conformado por socias responsables y solidarias, también son alegres. Este banco está conformando por una mesa directiva; como presidenta la Sra. Julia, que se dedica a la costura confeccionando centros de pollera para las cholitas, la tesorera es la Sra. Nancy se dedica a la venta de pasteles y masitas y la secretaria es  la Sra. Jimena se dedica a la venta de artefactos varios. Las demás socias se dedican a diferentes actividades, en costura, confección de deportivos, tejidos artesanales de mantas de vicuña y alpaca y chompas,  venta de ropas, tiendas de barrio o de micro consumo, venta de carne, venta de regalos. En todo el sector comercio que las socias se dedican esta en un mercado altamente competitivo pero ellas son dedicadas a su negocio que tienen una antigüedad de más de 10 años  de antigüedad y han logrado encontrar mercado a nivel internacional. Ellas necesitan el crédito para realizar compras de materia prima e insumos como  ser lana de vicuña, alpaca y otros, también otros para comprar carne para su carnicería, compras de tela para confección de deportivo y enaguas con el fin de hacer crecer sus microempresas con un mercado fijo. Las socias están en el segundo ciclo ellas han demostrado ser responsables en esta institución y otras que tienen créditos vigentes en otras entidades financieras, sus antecedentes crediticios son positivos.
texts.en:
The communal bank called SAJAMA 1 consists of twelve women who mainly come from the same part of the city. The main feature of their houses is that they are built largely of adobe and have a single floor. The communal bank is composed of responsible, cheerful members who support one another. The bank is guided by a board of directors: the president is Julia, a seamstress who makes skirts for women; the treasurer is Nancy, who sells cakes and pastries; and the secretary is Jimena, who sells different devices. The rest of the members engage in various activities including sewing, manufacturing sports equipment, weaving handmade blankets and sweaters from vicuña and alpaca wool, selling clothing, running small or neighborhood stores, selling meat, and selling gifts. All in all, the commercial sector that the members work in is a highly competitive market, but they are dedicated to their business, which is over ten years old and for which they have found a market at the international level. They need the loan to buy raw materials and supplies such as wool from vicuñas, alpacas and other animals, meat for their butcher shops, or fabric to make sports equipment and skirts, all with the goal of making their small businesses grow in a fixed market. The members are in their second cycle and have proven themselves to be responsible with this institution; of those who have current loans with other financial institutions, their credit records are positive.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 54-year-old business lady who runs a grocery store as well as a cereal shop in Kajiado. She sells Sukumawiki (kale), cabbage, carrots, potatoes, and fruit among other products. She sells her wares to residents of Kajiado town. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 30,000 to add to her stock of cereals, vegetables and fruit. She hopes to own a big shop selling cereal at wholesale in the future. She describes herself as innovative, hardworking and informed.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add more stock

loans.name: Dalila Raquel

texts.es: Dalila Raquel es una joven de 29 años. Doña Dalila tiene 1 hijo y depende de ella. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella decidió escoger este tipo de trabajo por ser uno de las fuentes de ingresos más accesibles además le gusta mucho este tipo de trabajo. Los propósitos de Dalila con su negocio son de mantener a sus clientes ya que algunos no reciben la atención que se merecen. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de cosméticos, ropa interior, ropa para niños, ropa para damas y caballeros. El deseo de Ella es mejorar su nivel de ella y de su hijo.
texts.en:
Dalila Raquel is a 29 year old young woman. Dalila has one dependent son. Her economic activity is the buying and selling of general merchandise. For more than 6 years she has been involved in this business, she decided to choose this type of work because it’s one of the most accessible sources of income and also because she likes this type of work a lot. Dalila’s goal with her business is to keep her clients because some are not receiving the attention they deserve. The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase cosmetics, undergarments, and clothing for children, women and men. Her wish is to improve the quality of life of herself and her son.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Grupo Esperanza Group

texts.es: Es un grupo de 11 personas el cual viven a 60 kilómetros de la cabecera de Totonicapán Guatemala, cuentan con un grupo con el fin de solicitar un préstamo para aumentar el capital de trabajo, varias de ellas se dedican a la venta de Relojes, como también a la crianza de animales como ganado Bobino, en su mayoría son de familias de escasos recursos económicos y para poder apoyar a  sus esposos económicamente tienen que emprender varias actividades y de esa manera poder vender sus productos a lugares circunvecinos del lugar de Guatemala, para todas las señoras  es importante el apoyo del préstamo que solicitan en la Asociación ASDIR.
texts.en:
This is a group of 11 persons who live 60 kilometers from the municipal capital of Totonicapán Guatemala. This group is requesting a loan to increase their working capital. Several of them sell watches, and members of the group also raise livestock such as cows. The majority have families with few economic resources, and in order to support their husbands economically they have to undertake various activities; they are able to sell their products in surrounding areas within Guatemala. For all of the women, the loan that they are requesting and the support provided by the ASDIR Association is very important.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase business capital

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.en: Senora Maria is 45 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 12. They are both in high school. For three years, she has had a restaurant in the small community of Palo Grande near the city of Chinandega. Maria has worked in El Salvador where she gained valuable work experience and with the money that she earned she opened her business. She serves three meals a day. This loan of C$10,000 will go towards structural improvements to her business. Maria Eugenia has a good credit history with Fundacíon León 2000 and is a very capable client and businesswoman.

loans.use: To make structural improvements to her business

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.en: Senora Rosa Emilia is 31 years old. She is married and has a 14-year-old in high school. An enterprising businesswoman, Rosa Emilia sells clothes during the day and at night she sells meals from a food stand. For the past two years, Rosa has managed these businesses. Her food stand is located in the central park in the city of Somotillo. She is well known for her banana chips, tacos and enchiladas. Her clothing she sells on foot. She hopes to be able to afford a cart to transport and better display her items. This loan of C$ 7,000 will go towards the purchase of supplies for her food cart and items to increase her inventory of clothing.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and more supplies for her food cart

loans.name: Luis Reynaldo

texts.en: Senor Luis has sold shoes for 20 years. He began his business when he wasn’t able to find other work and has continued to maintain his business all these years because it has allowed him to support his family and improve their living conditions. This loan of C$20,000 will go towards the purchase of more shoes for his inventory. Luis has a good credit history with Fundacíon León 2000 and is a very capable client and businessman.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for his inventory

loans.name: Juana Emilia

texts.en: Juana Emilia has a small store called a Pulpería here in Nicaragua. Six years ago, she established the store in the front room of her house because her husband was having difficulty finding a job. Through the assistance of Fundacíon León 2000, she has been able to build up her business and increase her household income. Juana Emilia has high hopes for her business. She dreams of having more products to offer to her clients as well as being able to better support her family. Juana Emilia has a strong credit history with Fundacíon León 2000 and is a very capable client and businesswoman.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Patricia Albertina

texts.en:
For 5 years, Patricia has operated a pharmacy in her home. She is widely known for having fairly-priced items and customers favor her store amongst the other pharmacies for this reason. Her home and business are located in the central part of the city near the banks, so she is assured of good foot traffic.

With this loan of 20,000 gold cordobas (NIO), Patricia will purchase a variety of medicines to restock her inventory.

Patricia’s husband works as an engineer in an agricultural factory. Together, they continue to follow their ambition of improving their economic situation.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of medicines to restock her inventory

loans.name: Kathy Elizabeth

texts.en: Kathy dreams of building up her business so that she can help her son build his own business. She sells a variety of merchandise: mostly clothing, cosmetics and footwear. Senora Kathy is a very capable client and businesswoman; she will use this loan of 7,700 córdobas to increase her inventory for the upcoming holiday season. Kathy is 52 years old, married and has a 15-year-old son in high school. Her association with Fundacíon León 2000 has helped build her business and increase her income.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Las Madres Trabajadoras De San Juan Group

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 46 años, es madre de 3 hijos y aun tiene las energías de una quinceañera, es socia de de la alcancía comunal “Las Madres Trabajadoras de San Juan” grupo que se llama así porque son madres unidas que buscan salir adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo.

Ella apoya a su pareja en su negocio, que consiste en la compra, venta y envío de mercadería de segunda y de primera como herramientas, focos, compresoras, lámparas, etc. a distintas parte de nuestro país, sus clientes están contentos por los productos que les ofrecen, pues a la vez su pareja también es mecánico, por ello puede dar razón que el producto que vende, esta en buenas condiciones.

El préstamo que recibirá lo invertirá en los fletes para los envíos de su mercadería, después de todo no olvida la ocasión ya hace buen tiempo atras, tenia una venta e invirtieron todo en la compra de la mercadería y se quedaron sin dinero para el flete, asi que se retrasaron en el envio, “fue un mal momento, pero por suerte nos prestaron un dinero e hicimos el negocio, al final nos sentimos aliviados y reímos”, ahora ella tiene el sueño que ver a sus hijos profesionales, construir su casa, hacer crecer su negocio, hacerse conocidos en el mercado así tener una seguridad económica, y un futuro asegurado.
texts.en:
Zoila is a 46-year-old mother of three children but still has the energy of a 15-year-old. She is a member of the "Las Madres Trabajadoras de San Juan" ("Hard-working mothers of San Juan") community bank group, which got its name because the members are all mothers looking to make headway thanks to their hard work and dedication to their jobs. Zoila supports her husband with their business, which consists of buying, selling and shipping first- and second-hand merchandise such as tools, lights, compressors, lamps, and other items to and from distinct parts of the country. Their customers are content with the products because Zoila's husband is also a mechanic, so he can assure that the products they sell are in good condition. They plan to use the loan to invest in shipping their products. They have not forgotten a time a while back when they had a sale and used all their funds to purchase merchandise and did not have anything left to pay for the shipping, which had to be delayed. "It was a bad moment, but luckily we borrowed some money and did the business. In the end we felt relieved and we laughed," Zoila said. Now she dreams of seeing her children become professionals, building a home, growing the business and becoming well known in the marketplace in order to ensure economic security and a secure future.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Copacabana Group

texts.es: El grupo “Copacabana” esta representada por la señora Martha y conformada por 15 miembros los cuales tienen la característica D. ser señoras muy trabajadoras les gusta la puntualidad, la unidad y sobre todo la solidaria. Las diferentes actividades a los que se dedica esto grupos es la comercialización D. productos como la yuca, abarrotes que sacan D. sus chacos para su comercialización y venden en la ciudad D. santa Cruz o Cochabamba, otras se dedican a la elaboración y comercialización D. pan, coca, repuestos y otros negocios D. acuerdo a la época D. producción D. los frutos D. sus chacos. El crédito solicitado es directamente para la adquisición D. mercadería y también para Invertir en sus terrenos o en sus medios D. trasporte ínter departamentales. La socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidaR. pero están muy a gusto con el apoyo económico que les brinda la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The Copacabana Group is represented by Martha. It is comprised of 15 members who are characteristically very hard-working women who like punctuality; unity; and, above all, solidarity. The different activities they are engaged in are selling products like yucca and groceries that they take from their farms to sell. They sell in the city of Santa Cruz or Cochambamba. Others make and sell bread, cocoa, and replacement parts. Others grow seasonal fruits. The loan is to buy merchandise and invest in their land or in their method of interdepartmental transportation. The members already have experience with village banks, but they are very content with the economic support the Agrocapital Foundation offers them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza-21 Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Nueva Esperanza 21” esta representada por la señora Rosa Victoria y conformado por trece miembros que en su mayoría radican en la zona 21 D. diciembre  las socias son dedicadas a la comercialización  y venta D. diferentes productos como venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrios, a la elaboración y comercialización D. muebles D. madera en talleres D. carpintería, venta D. coca, venta D. comida, carne D. cerdo,  cosméticos, tiendas D. barrio y  taller D. mecánica.                                                                                                                 Los socios están en un mercado altamente competitivo ellas tienen sus estrategias D. como asegurar la venta D. sus producto además ya son conocidas en el mercado local y pretenden llegar a mercados internacionales mejorando la calidad D. sus productos.                                                                                                            El destino del crédito es para realizar compras D. insumos para sus tiendas y algunos para la compra D. equipos y herramientas para sus talleres otras D. las socias requieren del capital para la adquisición D. mercadería para agrandar mas sus tiendas.
Este grupo esta emprendiendo su sexto ciclo, la mayoría D. ellos ya se conocen entre si y cuentan con experiencia puesto que participaron durante cinco ciclos, es un grupo D. personas responsables, unidas y sobre todo con muchas granas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa Victoria represents the Nueva Esperanza 21 group. It is comprised of 13 members; most of them are from the 21 D. Diciembre region. The members sell different products. Some have neighborhood grocery stores. Some make and sell wood furniture in carpentry shops. Some sell coca, food, pork, and cosmetics. Some have neighborhood stores, and some have mechanic shops. The members are in a market that is highly competitive. They have their strategies for assuring the sale of their products. Also, they are well known in the local market, and they intend to arrive on the international market by improving the quality of their products. The loan is to buy supplies for their stores. Some will use it to buy equipment and tools for their shops. Others need the loan to buy merchandise to expand their stores. This group is undertaking their sixth cycle. Most of them know each other already and have experience, given that they have participated in five cycles. It is a group of united and responsible people. Above all, they have a great desire to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Lucerito Group

texts.es: El grupo " Lucerito " Esta representado por la señora Marleny y conformada por 12 socias muy trabajadoras y que van cumpliendo su tercer ciclo juntas demostrando responsabilidad, unión y sobre todo expectativas D. lograr mejorar mas aun su calidad D. vida y la D. su familias. Las señoras tienen una amistad desD. hace mucho tiempo y son muy dinámicas en su trabajo, sus actividades comerciales son la venta D. pan, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. comida y venta D. cosméticos, algunas atienden en sus domicilios propios y otros son ambulantes.  En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, pero las socias tienen sus clientes que constantemente generan el movimiento económico necesario para un ingreso capaz D. sustentar a sus familias.  El crédito  esta destinado a la compra D. mercadería para surtir sus tiendas e insumos al por mayor como azúcar, harina para la producción D. pan, las promotoras D. cosméticos aprovechan las ofertas  para obtener una mejor ganancia. Sus mayores expectativas es  tener más ingresos y ser más independientes económicamente para poder llegar a tener un mejor capital y un mejor ingreso para el sustento D. sus familias.
texts.en:
Marleny represents the Lucerito group. It is comprised of 12 very hard-working members. They are completing their third cycle together. They demonstrate responsibility; union; and, above all, the expectation to improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. The women have had a friendship for a very long time. They are very dynamic in their work. They sell bread, have a grocery store, sell food, and sell cosmetics. Some work in their own homes, and others are street vendors. As far as competition goes, it does exist in their neighborhood. But, the members have their customers who continually generate enough economic movement to get an income that will support their families. The loan is to buy merchandise to stock their stores and wholesale supplies like sugar and flour to make bread. The cosmetic representatives will take advantage of offers to get better earnings. Their greatest expectation is to have more income and to be more economically independent. They want to have more capital and better income to support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es: El grupo " Las Solidarias " están representadas por la señora Leona y conformada por 13 miembros D. socias  muy trabajadoras que van cursando su tercer con expectativas D. seguir creciendo. Las señoras tienen una amistad desD. hace mucho tiempo y desempeñan diferentes tipos D. actividades comerciales como la venta D. ropa interior, cosméticos por catalogo, comida, empanadas, juguetes y entre los varones al transporte publico D. pasajero. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio los socios siempre saben como salir adelante con más esfuerzo y dedicación a su trabajo. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición D. mercadería e insumos para sus distintas actividades y para la reparación D. sus vehículos como el retapizado D. sus asientos, compra D. repuestos y chaparía que ayudara a generar mejores ingresos para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hijos y esposos.
texts.en:
Leona represents the Las Solidarias group. It is comprised of 13 hard-working members. They are in their third cycle, and their expectation is to keep growing. The women have been friends for a long time. They work in different types of commercial activities like selling underwear, cosmetics by catalog, food, empanadas, and toys. The men work in public transportation of passengers. As far as competition goes, it does exist in the neighborhood. The members always know how to get ahead with more effort and dedication to their work. The loan is to get more merchandise and supplies for their different activities. It is also to repair their vehicles by recovering the seats, buying replacement parts, and auto body repair. This will help generate more income to improve the quality of life for their children and spouses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Apu Salkantay Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “APU SALKANTAY”, es el nombre de una montaña sagrada de la cordillera de Vilcabamba, y está ubicado al sur de la Ciudadela Sagrada de Machu Picchu, en la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestros miembros son 10 socios, todos ellos son muy amigables y emprendedores. Los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco, la mayoría de ellos son comerciantes independientes y tienen actividades similares.   

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades con el comercio minorista. Ellos tienen diferentes negocios como venta de ropa, productos de belleza. Una de las socias su trabajo es el arte culinario, ella hace mesecillos, bizcochuelos, etc. Otra socia es enfermera y hace servicio a domicilio de rehabilitación, a niños autistas, parapléjicos. etc. La mayoría de las socios se dedica a comprar y vender madera, compran de la ciudad de “Puerto Maldonado” y lo distribuyen a pequeñas carpinterías en la ciudad del Cusco de otro socio su trabajo laboral es de transportar la madera de ciudad a ciudad.           


Todos los miembros del banco comunal son nuevos socios y están deseosos de invertir el préstamo en sus nuevos negocios y de este modo hacerlos crecer, esto ayudará a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hogares y les dará mayor producción y mayor ganancia.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(El socio CESAR no esta en la foto por que estaba de viaje estaba trabajando como guía de turistas,  en el “Valle sagrado de los Inkas”)
texts.en:
Our members belong to the communal bank “APU SALKANTAY”, which is the name of a sacred mountain in the Vilcabamba mountain range. It is located south of Ciudadela Sagrada of Machu Picchu, in Cusco. There are ten members in the bank and they are all very friendly and entrepreneurial. They live in the city of Cusco. The majority of the members are independent retailers and have similar businesses.
Our members alternate between retail businesses. They have different businesses, such as, selling clothes and beauty products. One of the members is a cook and she makes traditional pastries (mesecillos, bizcochuelos). Another member is a nurse and provides home therapy visits to handicap and autistic kids. Most of the members buy and sell lumber. They buy in the city of “Puerto Maldonado” and sell to small woodshops in the city of Cusco. Another member transports the wood across the different cities.
All the members of the communal bank are new and are looking forward to invest the loan in growing their businesses. This loan will help them improve the quality of life at home and will provide better production and profits. The members are very thankful for the loan they will obtain through Kiva and are committed to repaying the loan within the established terms.
(The member CESAR is not in the picture because he was away working as a tourist guide at the “Valle sagrado de los Inkas”)

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell lumber and beauty products.

loans.name: El Cedrillo Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Cedrillo” esta representado por el señor Narciso y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales diferentes tipos D. negocios como la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, moto taxista, venta D. ropa, venta D. comida, construcción, venta D. refrigerios o comida al paso y venta D. bebidas. En algunas actividades a las que se dedican los socios hay mucha competencia pero ellos saben como salir adelante ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. su familia. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición D. herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a generar mejores ingresos así como para la adquisición D. mercadería e insumos para agrandar su negocio ya que del ingreso que generan depenD. toda su familia.  El grupo ya va cursando su segundo ciclo como grupo por lo que conocen muy bien la modalidad D. trabajo y saben como administrar bien sus fondos para generar mayores ingresos con el apoyo D. la Fundación  Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The group "El Cedrillo" is represented by the Señor Narciso, and is maD. up of 12 members who have a variety of businesses, including the sale of cosmetics through a catalog, motor taxi service, clothing sales, food sales, construction, sales of snacks or food (street vendors), and drink sales. In some of these areas there is a lot of competition, but they know how to advance their businesses, since the sustenance of their families depends on it. This loan will be used to acquire tools of the traD. that will help them to generate better incomes, such as the acquisition of merchandise and supplies to enlarge their businesses, since their families depend on the incomes that they generate. The group is pursuing its second loan cycle; the members of the group know their businesses very well and know how to administer the funds so as to generate increased incomes with the support of the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital for operations

loans.name: Arcoiris Group

texts.es: El grupo “Arco Iris II” esta representado por la señora Durvin Gabriela y conformada por 17 miembros los cuales realizan diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. arena, cosméticos y perfume, pulpería, rebobinado D. balatas, comida, carpintería, ropa y calzado, abarrote, modista y a la atención en taller mantenimiento D. motos. Dentro del mercado hay mucha competencia pero ellas saben que si existe mucha oferta D. productos o deben diversificar su mercadería o mover sus puestos a otro lugar como ferias vecinales. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. D. mercadería para diversificar sus productos, la compra D. insumos para realizar sus productos al por mayor y la adquisición D. herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a generar un mejor ingreso D. productos y mayor calidad en el acabado. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios ya trabajaron bajo la modalidad D. bancos comunales por lo que saben como administrar sus fondos para obtener un mayor beneficio y así poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida.
texts.en:
The “Arco Iris II” group is led by Durvin Gabriela and is maD. up of 17 members who engage in a variety of commercial activities like the sale of sand, cosmetics and perfumes, general stores, brake relining, food preparation, carpentry, clothing and footwear, grocery store, seamstress, and a motorcycle repair shop. There is a great deal of competition in the market but they are aware that if supply is great then they either have to diversify their product offerings or move their stands to other places like the neighborhood flea markets. The funds requested will be used to buy merchandise that will allow for diversification, to buy raw materials so that they can sell wholesale, and to buy work tools which will help them generate higher profits and better product quality. As far as their credit history goes, the members of this group have experience working with communal banks and know the operational methodologies so they are able to administer their funds well to get the greatest benefits from them thereby providing their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Señor de los Milagros II” esta representado por la señora Ana Karen y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales tienen diferentes actividades de comercialización como la venta de comida, ropa, producto de belleza y joyas, Servicio de peluquería y estilismo, confección de prendas de vestir, comida al paso, abarrote, servicio de chapería y servicio de moto taxista. A pesar de la competencia los socios saben como hacer llevadera cada una de las competencias ofreciendo productos a menor precio o diversificando su mercadería, es por esta razón que las socias necesitan el financiamiento para contar con una mayor cantidad de capital para obtener mercadería al por mayor a un menor costo y abaratar los precios, también para la reparación de sus herramientas y puestos de trabajo. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias ya cuenta con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital pero el apoyo brindado por la Fundación es los que los alienta para seguir adelante y seguir buscando el progreso de sus negocios y el mejoramiento de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The “El Señor de los Milagros II” group is represented by Ana Karen and made up of 12 members who engage in various commercial activities such as: sales of prepared meals, clothing, beauty products, jewelry, barber shop and hair styling, clothing manufacture, street food stands, grocery stores, auto detailing, mototaxi services. Despite market competition, the members know how to get ahead by offering products at lower cost or diversifying their merchandise. For this reason, the members need financing in order to have a larger amount of working capital to acquire merchandise at lower wholesale prices so that they can offer their wares to their customers for a lower price as well. They also need to repair their work tools and improve their sales stalls. The members of this group already have experience with these types of loans having received financing from institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital but the help offered by the Fundación is what encourages them to continue forward seeking progress in their commercial activities and bettering the lives of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.en:
Carmen sells clothing and gold and silver jewelry on foot. A good business woman, Carmen has established clients to whom she offers credit lines and she collects weekly payments. This loan of 10,000 gold cordobas (NIO) will be used to buy more merchandise.

Carmen reports that the microfinance services of Fundación Leon 2000 have greatly helped her to improve her business and allowed her to better her living situation. She is 47 years old, married, and has an 8 year old.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Vive junto a su esposa y un nieto de 5 años de edad en el caserío La Pava, distrito de Mochumí, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años se dedica a comercializar sacos de polvillo (un derivado del arroz utilizado como alimento para animales), adquiere su mercancía en los molinos de arroz de la ciudad de Chiclayo y la comercializa principalmente en las bodegas de Mochumí y entre sus vecinos que crían animales. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con el que sostiene a su familia.

El nos comenta que trabajaba en un molino antes de empezar con su actual negocio. Luego debido a su edad tuvo que dejar el trabajo y esto lo motivó a buscar nuevas opciones con las que pueda seguir manteniendo a los suyos.

La constante demanda por parte de sus clientes ha hecho que Manuel piense en comprar más sacos de polvillo con los que pueda ampliar su negocio. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los que piensa lograr su objetivo.

Manuel es trabajador y muy responsable. Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como comerciante y brindarle a su familia la calidad de vida que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
Manuel, 59, is married and has three children. He lives with his wife and his 5-year-old grandson in the La Pava farming community, Mochumí district, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 6 years he has sold sacks of polvillo (a type of animal feed derived from rice). He acquires his merchandise in Chiclayo's rice mills and sells it primarily to stores in Mochumí and among his neighbors who raise animals. This is his only source of income with which he supports his family. He has told us that he used to work in a mill before starting his current business but, due to his age, had to leave his job in the mill and seek new options with which to continue supporting his loved ones. His customers' constant demands have motivated Manuel to buy more sacks of polvilo with which to enlarge his business. For this reason, he is asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 new soles to reach his goal. Manuel is hard-working and responsible. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a merchant and to provide his family with the quality of life they need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase polvillo (an animal feed derived from rice).

loans.name: Los Tusequis Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Los Tusequis” esta representado por la señora Nelly  y conformada por 13 miembros que van cursando ya su segundo ciclo en la cual han demostrado responsabilidad, compromiso y organización como por ejemplo recalcar que ellas se reúnen media hora antes D. la hora fijada norma que ellas mismas impusieron para que cuando llegue el asesor en caso D. cualquier contingencia se haya dado solución a cualquier contingencia y se tenga todo listo para cuando el asesor llegue. La mayoría D. los integrantes del grupos se dedican a la venta D. diferentes productos como cosméticos, dos en particular hacen dulces D. leche, pan para vender, otras en cambio tienen una pequeña tienda ( snack ) D. barrio donD. se venD. soda, asaditos, cortinas y ropa en general. La competencia es regular en lo que respecta a la venta D. comidas, a lo que se refiere a la venta D. cosméticos es fuerte ya que no son las únicas y tienen que esforzarse mucho para poder tener un pedido D. productos que les permita obtener una ganancia para el sustento D. sus familias, es por esta razón que requieren D. un nuevo financiamiento para hacer frente a la competencia y tener un capital D. trabajo que ayuD. a generar mejores ganancias ampliando su mercadería.
texts.en:
The “Los Tusequis” communal bank is represented by Nelly and maD. up of 13 members, who are in their second loan cycle, having demonstrated responsibility, commitment and organization; an example of which is that they themselves decided to meet half an hour prior to the set time so that when the technical advisor for any contingency arrives they have already come up with a solution and have it ready for the advisor when he arrives. Most of the members are involved in sales of various kinds like cosmetics. Two of the members make milk-based sweets to sell, others have small neighborhood snack stores where they sell soft drinks, grilled meats, curtains and clothing in general. Competition in the food sales area is standard but in the cosmetics area it's pretty intense since they aren't the only ones and they need to try so much harder to get orders that produce enough profits to support their families. For this reason they need new financing to face their competition and to have working capital to help generate increased profits by offering a wider variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Israel De Jesus

texts.en:
For six years Senor Israel has maintained a business of selling seafood as well as providing taxi services using his bicycle-taxi. The two businesses are complimentary as Israel uses the bicycle to transport his products. He reports that the two parts of his business have greatly helped him to support his family.

Israel is married and has two children, ages 7 and 5. He dreams of having his own cart in the market from which he can sell his products. Israel will use this loan of 9,300 gold cordobas (NIO) to buy seafood for resale.

loans.use: To buy seafood for resale

loans.name: Cielito Lindo Group

texts.es: El grupo “Cielito Lindo” esta representado por la señora Rita uy conformado por 12 miembros que van cumpliendo ya su tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad, honestidad y ganas D. trabajar para seguir creciendo. Entre las actividades que desempeñan las socias esta la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, venta y producción D. artesanías en arcilla lana y vidrio, jugo D. naranja al paso, servicio D. peluquería, empanadas y al servicio domestico, lavandería y limpieza. En cuanto a la competencia el grupo esta conciente D. el alto nivel D. competencia en el mercado es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento para poder capitalizarse y mover sus puestos D. trabajo a lugares mas comerciales, también para la adquisición D. materia prima y herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a generar una mayor ganancia para el sustento D. sus familias.
texts.en:
Rita is the representative of the "Cielito Lindo" group, which is maD. up of 12 members, who are in their third lending cycle, having demonstrated punctuality, honesty and the will to work to continue growing. Among the activities the members are engaged in is the sale of cosmetics by catalogue, production and sales of handicrafts in clay, wool and glass, orange juice sales street stands, barber shop services, turnovers, and domestic help, laundry and cleaning. With regard to competition in these areas, the group is aware of the high level of market competition and this is the reason they require financing to be able to increase their capitalization and move their sales stalls to better locations and to acquire raw materials and work tools that will help them generate larger profits to support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ligia Cumanda

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tres Marías se encuentra a unos 15 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad del mismo nombre en el sur de la ciudad, esta localidad goza de una belleza natural y biodiversidad por su lugar de ubicación, su gente adulta se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería mientras que los jóvenes trabajan en la ciudad o han migrado al extranjero para darles una mejor vida a su familia.
 
Ligia V. es socia del banco comunal 3 Marías, vive por el sector la autopista vía a Punta Corral;  tiene 34 años de edad es casada y madre de cuatro hijos de 16, 14, 12, 10 años, su primer hijo estudia  en el colegio Unedid, el segundo en el colegio Miguel Merchán, su hija en el colegio Herlinda Toral y su último hijo en el centro Educativo Yanuncay, su esposo es ebanista(carpintero) y viajó al exterior desde hace muchos años en busca de un presente y futuro mejor para su familia, aún  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su madre.

Ligia trabaja en su taller de costura desde  hace  quince años,  arregla toda clase de ropa confecciona blusas, faldas, pantalones pero lo que más elabora es bolsicones (vestimenta tradicional de las cuencanas);  también se dedica a la  cría de pollos, chanchos, tanto para el consumo en su hogar como para la venta cuando lo solicitan sus vecinas de la comunidad  o por alguna emergencia económica.

Lleva tres años trabajando con la fundación y nos comenta que los créditos obtenidos le han  permitido  terminar sus obras y para educar  a sus hijos, con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  va  a comprar tela para elaborar los bolsicones, blusas, faldas, pantalones para sus clientes frecuentes.

Su meta es incrementar su negocio y llegar a construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
The "3 Marías" communal bank is located some 15 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca, in the community of the same name to the south of the city. Thanks to its location, the area enjoys great natural beauty and biodiversity. Its adult population works in agriculture and ranching, while the young people work in the city or have migrated abroad to provide a better life for their families. Ligia V., a member of the "3 Marías" communal bank, lives near the highway to Punta Corral. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of four children, aged 16, 14, 12 and 10. Her oldest son studies at Unedid School, her second son at Miguel Merchán School, her daughter at Herlinda Toral School, and her youngest child at the Yanuncay Educational Center. Her husband is a carpenter who traveled abroad many years ago to strive for a better present and future for his family. They do not yet have their own home, so they live at her mother's house. Ligia has worked as a seamstress in her own shop for the past fifteen years. She offers alterations to every type of clothing, and she also sews blouses, skirts, and pants; but the garment she makes most often is the "bolsicon," a traditional skirt worn by the women of Cuenca. She also raises chickens and pigs, both for her own household needs and to sell when her neighbors in the community ask for them, or when an economic emergency arises. She has worked with the foundation for the past three years, and she tells us that the loans she has obtained have allowed her to carry out her work and to educate her children. With the loan provided to her by the Espoir Foundation, she will buy fabric to make bolsicones, blouses, skirts and pants for her regular customers. Her goal is to expand her business and eventually to build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric to make skirts, blouses, pants and traditional garments

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Pedro está ubicado en la parroquia Victoria del Portete  al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, la parroquia lleva este nombre en honor a la batalla ocurrida en sus campos, sus fiestas patronales se celebran en el mes de Octubre donde se  realizan diferentes actividades como la quema de castillos, juegos pirotécnicos, concursos de danza y música folklórica, su gente es alegre y siempre piensa en surgir personal y económicamente con sus familias.

La señora María  D. vive en Zhizho una comunidad que pertenece  a la Parroquia Victoria del Portete; ella  tiene 45 años de edad se encuentra casada y tiene siete  hijos de 24, 18, 17, 14, 12, 9, 6 años, sus hijos primero, tercero y cuarto  trabajan y le ayudan económicamente con los gastos de la  casa, su segunda hija estudia en el colegio Miguel Moreno, mientras que sus últimos hijos estudian en la escuela San Joaquín y su esposo trabaja como carpintero;  la casa en la que habitan es propia gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo de toda la familia.

María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y comparte con otras actividades como la costura y bordados desde hace diez meses y también a la cría de pollos y cuyes  que son tanto para  el consumo de su hogar  y para la venta cuando se presenta una  necesidad  económica.

Nuestra socia lleva un año y medio trabajando con la fundación y nos asegura que los créditos le han ayudado para mantener su hogar y negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de más animalitos como pollos y cuyes para incrementar su criadero.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos estar estable emocional y económicamente.
texts.en:
The San Pedro communal bank is located in the parish of Victoria del Portete south of the city of Cuenca. The parish has this name in honor of the battle that occurred on its countryside. Its patron celebrations are held in October, with fireworks displays, dance competitions, and folklore music. The people are very happy and always think about moving ahead personally and economically with their families. Mrs. María D. lives in Zhizho, a community that belongs to Victoria del Portete Parish. María is 45 years-old, married, and has seven children, ages 6, 9, 12, 14, 17, 18, and 24. Her first three sons work and help her out with the household costs. Her daughter, the second oldest, studies in Miguel Moreno high school, while her youngest children study at San Joaquín elementary school and her husband works as a carpenter. They own the house they live in, thanks to the effort and work of the whole family. María takes care of household chores and began with other activities such as sewing and embroidery ten months ago. She also works raising chickens and guinea pigs, which are enough to provide for her home and can also be sold in times of economic need. Our member has been working for a year and a half for the foundation and she assures us that previous loans have helped her maintain her home and business. With the new loan funds from ESPOIR she will invest in the purchase of more young animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs, to increase her stock. Her dream is to see her children emotionally and economically stable.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and guinea pigs to increase livestock

loans.name: Julia Narcisa

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Pedro está ubicado en la parroquia Victoria del Portete  al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, la parroquia lleva este nombre en honor a la batalla ocurrida en sus campos, sus fiestas patronales se celebran en el mes de Octubre donde se  realizan diferentes actividades como la quema de castillos, juegos pirotécnicos, concursos de danza y música folklórica, su gente es alegre y siempre piensa en surgir personal y económicamente con sus familias.

La señora Julia P. vive en San Vicente de Arrayan en la  parroquia Victoria del Portete, tiene 39 años de edad, es divorciada hace 12 años por la  falta de comprensión con su esposo, es madre  de tres  hijos de 18, 14, 11 años, sus dos hijos mayores trabajan y le ayudan un poco económicamente con los gastos del hogar, su último hijo estudia en la escuela de San Vicente, de momento no tiene casa propia y viven en la casa de sus padres.

Julia es costurera y  hace bordados, lleva 18 años trabajando en esta profesión, su taller es propio y lo tiene en su casa, nos comenta que hasta el momento le va muy bien, lleva dos años trabajando con su banco comunal y los créditos los ha invertido en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a comprar  una máquina de coser  y telas para incrementar sus confecciones y bordados.

Su meta es seguir incrementado su  negocio que es el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The San Pedro communal bank is located in the parish of Victoria del Portete, south of the city of Cuenca. The parish has this name in honor of the battle that occurred in its countryside. Its patron celebrations take place in October, celebrated with fireworks displays, dance competitions, and folklore music. The people are happy and always think about moving ahead personally and economically with their families. Mrs. Julia P. lives in San Vicente de Arrayan, in the parish of Victoria del Portete. She is 39 years old, has been divorced for 12 years, because of her husband's lack of understanding, and is the mother of three children ages 11, 14, and 18. Her two oldest children work and help out with the household costs. Her youngest child studies in San Vicente elementary school. At the moment she does not have her own house: her and her family live with her parents. Julia is a seamstress and sews embroideries, and has been in the business for 18 years. She has her own workshop in her house. She tells us that now everything is going very well. She has been working with this communal bank for two years and she has invested her loans in her business. With the new loan funds from FUNDACION ESPOIR she will buy a sewing machine and fabrics to make more embroideries and other sewn products. Her goal is to keep expanding her business, which is the means of support of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine and fabrics to sew

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tres Marías se encuentra a unos 15 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad del mismo nombre en el sur de la ciudad, esta localidad goza de una belleza natural y biodiversidad por su lugar de ubicación, su gente adulta se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería mientras que los jóvenes trabajan en la ciudad o han migrado al extranjero para darles una mejor vida a su familia.
 
La señora Mariana L. es socia activa del banco comunal Tres Marías, ella  vive por el sector de la autopista a unos 15 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña  de siete años,  no tiene casa vive  en casa de sus padres.

Mariana trabaja en su  tienda de abarrotes desde hace diez años pero también se dedica a la cría de animales como pollos, cuyes, chanchos,  los alimenta y cuando ya se encuentran gorditos los vende en las ferias.

Lleva dos años trabajando con su banco comunal y está contenta porque los créditos recibidos los ha invertido en sus negocios,  con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR va a  comprar otras líneas de productos de aseo personal, productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, pastas, etc. para abastecer mejor su tienda y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, también va a comprar más pollos porque son de crianza rápida máximo en un mes y medio.

Su sueño es llegar a convertir a su tienda en un micro mercado y construir su casa.
texts.en:
