Tres Marías communal bank is located about 15 minutes outside the city of Cuenca, in the community of the same name south of the city. This town boasts natural beauty and biodiversity, due to its location. The adult population work in agriculture and the raising of livestock, while the young citizens work in the city or have moved abroad to earn a better life for their families. Mrs. Mariana L. is an active member of Tres Marías communal bank. She lives near the highway about 15 minutes outside Cuenca. She is 44 years-old and a single mother of a 7 year-old daughter. She does not have her own house, she lives with parents. Mariana has worked in her grocery store for ten years, but also works raising animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. She feeds them and then sells them in the markets when they are large enough. She has been working with the communal bank for two years and is happy with the loans she has received and invested in her business. With the new loans from FUNDACION ESPOIR, Mariana will buy other brands of personal hygiene products, basic items such as rice, sugar, oil, pasta, etc, in order to better supply her business and provide better service to her customers. She will also buy more chickens that will grow rapidly, in under a month and a half. Her dreams are to succeed in making her store into a small market and to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, oil, pasta, personal hygiene products to stock her store, and for the purchase of more chickens.

loans.name: Maria Hortensia

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tres Marías se encuentra a unos 15 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad del mismo nombre en el sur de la ciudad, esta localidad goza de una belleza natural y biodiversidad por su lugar de ubicación, su gente adulta se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería mientras que los jóvenes trabajan en la ciudad o han migrado al extranjero para darles una mejor vida a su familia.
 
La señora  María León es socia del banco comunal Tres Marías, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre con su esposo y su madre de 88 años,  nuestra socia tiene 50 años de edad y no tiene hijos ya que se casó a una edad madura (46 años)  mantiene  una buena relación conyugal con su esposo que trabaja como albañil, no tienen casa  propia porque viven en casa de su madre ya que ella se encarga del cuidado de ella debido a su avanzada edad y problemas de presión alta.

 María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y también cría  pollos y cuyes, nos cuenta que le va muy bien ya que todos sus pollos vende en la comunidad y los cuyes es para su consumo o cuando hay alguna necesidad los vende.

Lleva dos años trabajando con los prestamos que otorga la  fundación y con ellos montó un criadero de pollos y también le capacitaron en el sistema de ahorro;  con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra de alimento y vitaminas  para sus pollos y cuyes, y una parte  para las necesidades de su hogar.

Su mayor sueño es que su madre se recupere de su enfermedad.
texts.en:
Tres Marías communal bank is located about 15 minutes south of the city of Cuenca in the community of the same name. This town boasts natural beauty and biodiversity because of its location. The adult population works in farming and the raising of livestock, while the young citizens work in the city or have moved abroad to earn better lives for their families. Mrs. María León is a member of Tres Marías communal bank, and lives in the community of the same name. She lives with her husband and her 88-year-old mother. María is 50 years old and has no children, as she married at a mature age (46). She has a good relationship with her husband who works as a mason. They do not have their own house, since they live in the home of María's mother, but María takes care of the house due to her mother's advanced age and high blood pressure. María takes care of the household chores and also raises chickens and guinea pigs. She tells us everything is going very well, as she can sell all the chickens in the community, and the guinea pigs provide food for the family, or can be sold if necessary. She has been receiving loans from the foundation for two years and with the funds she has built up a stock of chickens and also begun saving money. With the new loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR, María will invest in food and vitamins for her chickens and guinea pigs, and some money will be used for household needs. María's biggest dream is that her mother will recover from her illness.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed and vitamins for chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en:
Mr. B., 31, is a local teacher from Battambang Province. In addition to teaching, Mr. B. also assists his wife with selling groceries when he has free time. Mr. B. has been married a number of years, but doesn't have any children.  

Since selling groceries is the main source of the family's income, Mr. B. is applying for a loan to expand the quantity of inventory items.

Note: Mr. B.'s wife appears in the picture above.

loans.use: expand their inventory

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga S. is 50 years old. She is married to Mr. Byron S. and they are blessed with five children. Despite their economic situation, they aim to give their children a better future by providing the best education possible. They have helped each other earn a living and finance the education of their children. As a result, two of the children have finished a vocational course, while the others are still studying.

Farming is the common source of their living; they plant rice and vegetables twice a year. Aside from this, Dominga is engaged in rice retailing to earn additional income since harvesting takes a long time. She wants to sell more rice, but she has inadequate capital to do so.  

She would like to borrow 9,000 PHP to acquire more rice to be sold in their village since it is one of the basic commodities. She hopes that she can improve her small business and continue to support the schooling of their children.

loans.use: additional capital for her rice retailing business

loans.name: Eunice Wanjiru

texts.en:
Eunice Wanjiru is a single businesswoman who runs a textile shop known as Eunique Textile shop. She sells threads, ribbons, cotton, buttons and trims to tailors in the local Jericho market.  

Her business challenges consist of customers delaying their payments, and lack of capital to expand her business.  She wants to use her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more threads and trims.  In the future, she wants to have a big shop.  Eunice describes herself as intelligent and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more threads and trims.

loans.name: Caroline Ambwere

texts.en:
Caroline Ambwere O. owns the Cajo Enterprises and School of Dressing and sells skirt suits, dresses, trousers and school uniforms. She sells to schools, walk-in customers and couples in Kariobangi market. Her main business challenges are customers delaying their payments and few customers buying from her during April.

She is using her loan of 50,000 KES to buy material for making clothes. Her dream is to own a stall, employ more people and build a house for her family. Caroline is married with two children and describes herself as hardworking and honest. She is the treasurer of the TSS group.

loans.use: To buy materials for making skirts, trousers, dresses and school uniforms

loans.name: Jennifer Amunga

texts.en:
Jennifer Amunga A. is married with three children and describes herself as hardworking, friendly and intelligent. She is a tailor and sells trousers, shirts and dresses to schools and walk-in customers. She has one employee. Her main business challenge is customers delaying their payments.

Jennifer is using her 20,000 KES loan to buy material to make trousers, shirts and dresses. In the future, she wants to expand her business and employ more people.

loans.use: To buy material to make trousers, shirts and dresses

loans.name: Hellen Kwamboka's Group

texts.en: Hellen Kwamboka M. is single with a 7 year old son and describes herself as patient and hardworking. Hellen sells personal and household products(malimali) as a roadside seller in Kisii town. She is also a subsistence farmer. Her main business challenge is low stock that cannot meet the current market demand. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more enamel and plastic plates, combs, hairbands, etc. In future, Mary would like to own a boutique for her family and build on a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more malimali stock for roadside stand

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria B. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for the food she makes for vending. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her family's daily needs.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making baked goods

loans.name: Mosi

texts.en: Mosi S. is married and has one child who is in primary school. She is a small businesswoman who makes and sells traditional clothes (batik) at Tandika ward in Dar es Salaam. Her business materials, including colors, are purchased at Kariakoo shops. Mosi has been in business for four years and uses her business income to meet her family's daily needs and put capital into her business. She needs a loan of 600,000 TZS to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Lenyvel

texts.en: Lenyvel C. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lenyvel owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lenyvel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for daily needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Masumba

texts.en:
Masumba K. is married and is an entrepreneur: a Tanzanian businesswoman. She runs a business keeping poultry, both broilers and layers, at Yombo Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam.

Masumba has one thousand layers in her poultry cages from which fifteen tray of eggs are collected daily and are sold wholesale and retail. The business income is used to meet her daily family needs and for capitalizing the business.

Masumba needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes I. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Mercedes owns and operates a business offering pedicure and manicure and she is also involved in selling dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mercedes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for family daily needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Gilfonida

texts.en: Gilfonida C. is from the village of Unidos, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Gilfonida owns and operates a business selling charcoal. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Gilfonida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital to purchase coconut shells (used to make charcoal). Gilfonida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P. is from the village of Calaran, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children.

Myrna owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling baked products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional equipment for food processing. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for food processing

loans.name: Vivilina

texts.en: Vivilina B. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Vivilina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Vivilina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine B. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Josephine owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed for her pigs. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Germán

texts.es:
Germán es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas de 9 y 3 años de edad en el sector Los Angeles, ubicado en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica al periodismo. Empezó trabajando como locutor en una pequeña emisora radial de la zona. Luego trabajó junto a un compañero que se desempeñaba como reportero radial y desde ese entonces ha ido haciendo carrera periodistica en algunas radios locales.

El comenta orgulloso que ahora ya logró ascender al cargo de coordinador en una pequeña emisora radial del distrito de Mórrope. Debido a que no había tenido ningún tipo de formación teórica en los inicios de su carrera ha empezado a estudiar a distancia la carrera de periodismo.

Germán es muy trabajador y está sacando adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo. Antes de empezar a trabajar como locutor se ganaba el sustento como mototaxista; actualmente sigue trabajando en su vehículo durante su tiempo libre. 

Los ingresos que percibe le permiten mantener a los suyos y construir poco a poco su vivienda. Germán desea seguir especializándose en su profesión y poder trabajar con sus propios instrumentos. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para comprarse una grabadora de voz y una cámara fotográfica de segunda mano que faciliten su trabajo.

Su más grande anhelo es poder obtener su grado académico para obtener un mejor puesto y terminar de construir su casa así como brindarle a sus hijos la educación que necesitan. En la fotografía aparece con el chaleco que lo identifica como periodista y junto a la mototaxi con la que trabaja en sus tiempos libres.
texts.en:
German is a 38 year old father of two daughters, ages 3 and 9. He lives with his wife in the Los Angeles sector of the city of Lambayeque about 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For two years he has worked in journalism. He began working as an announcer at a small local radio station. Then he worked with a companion who operated as a radio reporter and since then he has been building a career as a journalist on several local radio stations. He comments proudly that now he has been able to advance to the position of coordinator at a small radio station in the district of Morrope. Since he has not had any type of formal education at the beginning of his career, he has started to study the career of journalism by correspondence. German is very hard working and is getting ahead for his family with a great effort. Before beginning to work as an announcer he made his living as a moto taxi driver. Now he continues to work using his vehicle during his free time. The income that he receives allows him to maintain his family and build his house little by little. German wants to continue specializing in his profession and to be able to work with his own tools of the trade. For this reason he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, a credit of 500 new soles to buy a voice recorder and a second hand photograph camera to help with his work. His greatest wish is to be able to obtain his academic degree in order to find a better position and finish building his house as well as provide his children the education they need. In the photo he appears with the vest that identifies him as a journalist, next to his moto taxi with which he works in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a voice recorder and a camera for his journalism work

loans.name: Justiniano Fernando

texts.es: Justiniano tiene 41 años, es separado , y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia la cual es de adobe. Anteriormente se dedicó a brindar el servicio de taxi. Luego vendió su automóvil, y se dedicó a la minería informa comprando sus herramientas de trabajo con el dinero obtenido por la venta de su auto y con las ganancias obtenidas.  Se compró su mototaxi, la cual en la actualidad está laborando, trasladando a los pasajeros a distintos lugares en la ciudad de Ica, atendiéndolos de manera muy amable y brindando un buen servicio. Justiniano vive en Pueblo Joven con sus hijos Leydi y Aldair a los cuales los cuida y les brinda todo su cariño. Justiniano solicita el crédito para reforzar su mototaxi, colocarle puertas, y así poder tener mayor seguridad al momento de realizar su actividad.  Los sueños de Justiniano es seguirles dando una buena educación a sus pequeños hijos y que puedan estudiar la Universidad.
texts.en:
Justiniano is 41 years-old, separated, and lives with his two children in their own adobe house. Previously he worked offering taxi services. Then Justianiano sold his car and began mining independently, purchasing the necessary tools with the money obtained from the sale of the car and saved earnings. Then he bought his motorcycle taxi, which he is now using to take passengers from different places in the city of Ica, attending to them in a friendly manner and providing good service. Justiniano lives in Pueblo Joven with his two children Leydi and Aldair, who he takes care of and gives all his affection. Justiniano is asking for this loan to reinforce his motorcycle taxi by adding doors, thus making the vehicle and business safer. His dream is to keep providing his young children a good education and to see them study in the University.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To reinforce his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es un padre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el sector Las Dunas, ubicado en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 24 años se dedica al comercio de pescado fresco y salado en el mercado central de la ciudad. El nos cuenta que antes trabajaba como estibador en Bayóvar (Piura) y observando la intensa actividad de los comerciantes pesqueros de la zona aprendió lo que necesitaba y empezó a trabajar en este negocio.

El adquiere su mercadería de lunes a viernes en el terminal pesquero de la región (ubicado en el distrito de Santa Rosa), los sábados la compra en el terminal de Piura. El pescado que compra los días sábado lo procesa en el mismo mercado para venderlo como pescado seco – salado los domingos. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso familiar.

Carmen está solicitanto por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería para mantener su negocio durante esta época en que el pescado se pone escaso y sube de precio.

El es un padre honrado y trabajador. Es muy conocido y estimado por sus compañeros de trabajo. Su más grande anhelo es seguir trabajando y comprarse una movilidad propia para poder transportar su mercancía con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 49 year old father who lives with his wife and three children in the Las Dunas district, located in the city of Lambayeque, which is 15 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For 24 years, Carmen has been selling both fresh and salted fish from the central city market. Prior to being a fish vendor, he worked as a longshoreman in Bayóvar (Piura). While at that job, he noticed the intense activity of the local fish traders. He was determined to learn about the business, which led to where he is today.

Carmen acquires his inventory Monday through Friday at the local fishing terminals in the district of Santa Rosa. On Saturday, he buys additional inventory at the terminal in Piura. He then returns to his market stall to process the fish from Piura for drying. The dried fish is salted the following day. Carmen's vending business is the only source of income for his family.

He is requesting his first loan from Edypme Alternativa in the amount of 500 soles. The money will be used to buy more fish because the available supply during this time of the year is lower, so prices are more expensive.

Carmen is an honest and hardworking father. He is well-known and respected among his colleagues. He hopes to continue working as well as purchase a vehicle so that he can transport his goods more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish for processing & selling

loans.name: Mercedes Magali

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo, sus hijos y una hermana que tiene a su cargo en el sector Punto Cuatro, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de tres años maneja una pequeña botica en la casa en donde vive. Empezó vendiendo artículos de primeros auxilios y ahora ofrece diversas medicinas genéricas a sus vecinos. Ella nos cuenta que decidió instalar el negocio porque por la zona no había ninguno de ese tipo y tenían que ir hasta el pueblo para adquirirlos. 

Su esposo es trabajador eventual, se dedica ocasionalmente a la pesca o a la agricultura, con el esfuerzo de ambos pudieron comprar hace cuatro meses una máquina fotocopiadora con la que piensan ampliar su negocio.

Mercedes planea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más medicinas e implementarlo con la venta de artículos de oficina por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de sus objetivos.

Ella es una madre responsable y trabajadora, su negocio es conocido por la zona por lo que sus vecinos le tienen mucha estima. Su más grande anhelo es poder construir su propia casa  ya que actualmente vive en una vivienda alquilada.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 28 years old; she is married and has two children, aged 6 and 3. She lives with her husband, her children and a sister who is in her care, in the Punto Cuatro sector of Mochumí District, 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than three years, Mercedes has operated a small pharmacy in the house where she lives. She began by selling first aid supplies, and she now offers a range of generic medicines to her neighbors. She tells us that she decided to open this business because there had previously been no drugstore in the area, and people had to go into town to purchase supplies. Her husband is an occasional laborer who fills temporary jobs in fishing and agriculture. Thanks to both of their efforts, they were able to purchase a photocopier four months ago, which they intend to use to broaden their current business. Mercedes plans to expand her business by purchasing more medicines and selling office supplies. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 Peruvian soles, which she will use to achieve her business objectives. Mercedes is a responsible and hardworking mother; her business is well-known in the area, and her neighbors have great respect for her. Her greatest desire is to be able to build her own home, since she currently lives in rented housing.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing medicines to expand her business

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
La señora Rosalba G. está muy agradecida por su gran cooperación en el anterior préstamo en cual les pudo pagar a sus hijos las colegiaturas y exámenes y así sus niños pudieron terminar ese ciclo escolar. 
Nueva mente está solicitando su cooperación para un nuevo crédito ya que tiene que pagar la colegiatura y comprar los libros de su hijo, que esta estudiando la universidad y ella desea que tenga una carrera profesional para su futura. 
Planea pagar el crédito con sus ingresos como empleada de una fabrica, ya que los gastos familiares se cubren con la pensión alimenticia que les reciben sus hijos de su papa.
texts.en:
Señora Rosalba G. is very grateful for the tremendous cooperation from her previous loan, which enabled her to pay for her children's school tuition and exams so that they were able to complete the school year. Currently she is requesting your cooperation for a new loan, since she has to pay tuition and buy books for her son, who is studying at the university. She hopes that he will have a professional career in the future. She plans to pay off this loan with income from her work at a factory, since the household expenses are met with child support that her sons receive from their father.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for tuition and to buy books

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: El señor Juan Manuel Martínez es casado con su esposa la señora Lorena Patricia Aguinaga, el labora para una empresa como mecánico desde hace 9 años, su esposa se encarga de atender el negocio que acaban de iniciar de nombre “Abarrotes La Hacienda” con apenas 6 meses de inauguración, pero como son una familia muy unida y constante están luchando por salir adelante y por tal motivo solicitan este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mas mercancía por mayoreo para percibir mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Manuel Martínez is married to the Señora Lorena Patricia Aguinaga. He has worked for a firm as a mechanic for 9 years. His wife takes care of running a business that they are just starting called "La Hacienda Grocery"; it has been open for only 6 months. They are a family that is very united and they are striving to get ahead economically. For this reason they are requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise at wholesale, so that they can earn greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: María Guadalupe es una señora muy trabajadora y emprendedora ella ha sacado a sus hijos sola ya que hace unos años quedo viuda. Ella como todo ser humano lucha por darle un mejor calidad de vida a su familia ya sus hijos mayores se casaron solo le queda una la cual estudia la preparatoria con el fin de estudiar una carrera universitaria. María ya ha tenido crédito y esta agradecida por el apoyo que se le ha brindado, para así  realizar sus proyectos como mejoras al su vivienda. Ahora ella esta requiriendo un préstamo para hacer un cuarto en la parte frontal de su casa para en un futuro hacer un negocio.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She has gotten her children ahead by herself; she was widowed years ago. Like all human beings, she fights to give her family a better quality of life. Her oldest children are married. Only one remains at home. She goes to high school and will study a career in the university. María has already had a loan, and she is grateful for the support that was given to her. The loan was to work on her projects like making improvements on her house. She now needs a loan to make a room in the front of the house. She will do this in order to establish a business there in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Siriam Leonor

texts.es: Siriam Leonor es una señora que ha salido adelante a pesar de la situación económica en que se vive en la actualidad nunca a parado de trabajar por que es madre soltera de dos hijos; ellos ya están grandes y se valen de si mismos. Para obtener una vivienda que fuera de ella tuvo que trabajar mucho esta es de interés social  por lo que ella quiere hacerle mejoras para que se vea bonita, su proyecto es comprar vitro para ponerlo en la sala de su casa y así dejarles un buen patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Siriam Leonor is a woman who has gotten ahead in spite of the current economic situation. She has never stopped working because she is a single mother with two children. They are now grown and take care of themselves. In order to have her own home she had to work a lot. The house is in a public housing project, and she wants to make improvements so that it looks nice. Her project is to buy tile to put down in the living room of her house. That way she will leave a nice inheritance for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put down tile

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
En la foto aparece la señora Bertha Abelia Rodriguez esposa del señor Efrain L..

Efraín López E.  desde hace 13 años se dedica a la compra y venta de fierro viejo para el sostén de la familia, su esposa para ayudarle con los gastos familiares es vendedora de ropa usada en un pulga muy conocida en la ciudad. Ellos siempre han salido adelante a pesar de la crisis ellos quieren seguir esforzando para darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ahora el señor quiere reparar el techo de su casa ya que por dentro hay abertura por donde se filtra el agua cuando llueve y no quiere que sus mubles se deterioren pero sobre todo para dejarles a su familia una casa en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Bertha Abelia Rodríguez, wife of Efraín L., appears in the photo. For 13 years Efraín López E. has been buying and selling old iron to support his family. In order to help him with the family expenses, his wife sells used clothes at a well known flea market in the city. They have always gotten ahead in spite of the crisis. They want to continue putting forth great effort in order to give their children a better quality of life. Now he would like to repair the roof of his house. There is a crack inside where water leaks when it rains. He does not want his furniture to be ruined. Above all, he wants to give his family a house that is in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es: “Clavel” es el nombre de la asociación perteneciente al Centro Focal Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto, este grupo cuenta con diez socias, con mucha dedicación ya llevan un año en la organización, dedicándose además de ser amas de casa, también a diferentes actividades generadoras de recursos para el sustento de sus familias.  Justa es la presidente del grupo, ella al igual que la mayoría de sus compañeras se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos, una vez realizados los venden a mayoristas para su comercialización en la ciudad de El Alto.Todas si excepción precisan incrementar su capital para comprar materia prima, solo de ésta forma podrán incrementar  la rentabilidad de sus emprendimientos y mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas y de sus familias.
texts.en:
Clavel is the name of the association that belongs to the Exaltación Community Center in the city of El Alto. This group has ten members. They have one year of much dedication with the organization. Besides being devoted housewives, they also have different businesses, which generate resources for the support of their families. Justa is the president of the group. She, like most of her colleagues, makes bricks. Once they are made, they are sold to wholesalers to be marketed in the city of El Alto. All of them need to increase their capital to buy raw material. This is the only way they can increase the profitability of their enterprises and improve the quality of life for themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Deny

texts.es:
La señora Deny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mariscalense”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 52 años, 03 hijos, 01 que aun estudia y depenD. D. ella.

Denny, es una mujer trabajador, que se siente capaz D. cumplir sus metas y sueños, hace varios años, que se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, siempre contando con el apoyo D. su esposo. Y con su primer préstamo que Manuela Ramos, le brindo; implemento mucho más su negocio, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado. Hoy en la actualidad ya cuenta con  mucha experiencia en este tipo D. actividad, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuD. a su tienda a comprar donD. cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama D. casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, utensilios D. aseo para el hogar y D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Denny, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Deny is a member of the Mariscalense Communal Bank, which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children. One of her children is still a dependent and attends school.

Deny is a hardworking woman who feels capable of attaining her dreams and goals. For several years, she has been selling groceries with the constant support of her husband. Her first loan enabled her to continue her home-based business, which is in a suitable location. Today she has accumulated considerable experience and is well-known and respected among her customers. She has a loyal clientele who come by her store, which has all the necessities one could ever need. Deny welcomes each customer with her charming personality.

With this loan of 2500 soles, she will buy bags of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, milk, various brands of canned fish, household cleaning utensils, and personal hygiene products. This additional inventory will allow her to proviD. better service to her customers.

Denny feels she is an accomplished woman today. She is eager to move forward in pursuit of her dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting many more women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Click HERE and HERE to view Sra. Denny’s previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mariscalense”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 24 años y 01 hijo que aun dependen de ella y esta estudiando.

Liliana, es una mujer que desde muy joven, aprendió a trabajar sola e independiente, se dedicaba a la venta de mercadería de ropas, trasladándose por diferentes pueblos aledaños, fue ahorrando poco a poco y gracias a esto actualmente, con el apoyo y enseñanza de su suegra, se dedica a la venta de cerdos, ubicada en un fundo fuera de la Ciudad, donde diariamente a partir de las 6:00 am. se dirige a su fundo, para alimentar a sus animales. 
Además cuenta con un apoyo constante de su esposo, los dos trabajan mutuamente y Liliana se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará cerdos bebes, para criarlos y alimentarlos y luego ofrecer a sus clientes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando alimento balanceado, vitaminas y ampollas, para mejorar el crecimiento de sus animales. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer realizada e independiente, con ganas de seguir luchando y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Liliana is a member of the Mariscalense Communal Bank, which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 24 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one dependent child who attends school.

From a very young age, Liliana learned how to work by herself and become independent. She previously traveled to neighboring villages selling clothes, which enabled her to accumulate a little bit of savings. Now with the help and expertise of her mother-in-law, she sells pigs from a farm located outside of the city. Her daily routine begins at 6am when she has to feed the animals. Liliana has the constant support of her husband, since the two of them work together. She is very pleased with the work she has accomplished.

With her loan of 2000 soles, Liliana will buy piglets to raise and feed for later resale to her customers. Part of the money will also be used to buy pig feed, vitamins, and medicines to improve the growth and development of her animals.

Today Liliana feels she is an accomplished and independent woman. She continues to strive for her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting many more women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy piglets, feed, vitamins, and medicines

loans.name: Licet Marina

texts.es:
Licet Marina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mariscalense”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 06 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida y hace dos años que por iniciativa propia Licet se dedica a la venta de leña, en sus inicios nos cuenta que le fue un poco bajo en sus ventas, pero con el tiempo ya sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, conocieron su negocio y sus ventas empezaron a aumentar progresivamente. 

Se inicio con S/. 300.00 y poco  a poco  fue ahorrando, luego acondicionó un lugar en su casa para almacenar la leña y así poder mostrar a sus clientes y moradores de la Ciudad.
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará 180 tercios de leña. Parte del dinero utilizará para construir un pequeño tambo y así evitar que la lluvia le siga afectando su negocio. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Licet Marina is a member of the Mariscalense Communal Bank, which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 44 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 6 children of whom 2 are still dependents.

She previously sold food, but two years ago, she decided to sell firewood instead. Sales were slow at first. Over time her friends, neighbors, and relatives learned about her business and her sales began to increase steadily. Licet started her business with initial capital of 300 soles. She was able to accumulate a bit of savings so that she could remodel a space in her house to store wood that she could supply to her customers and other residents of the city.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy 180 bundles of firewood. Part of the money will be used to build a small storage shed since rain can have a negative impact on her business.

Today Licet feels she is a very accomplished woman. She has even more desire to accomplish her dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting many more women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bundles of firewood & build a storage shed

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 35 years old and married to Teody P.. The couple is blessed with five children: Rafael, 21; Teoderick, 19; Cherry Mae, 19; Jay Mark, 12; Veronica, 7. They live in the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. The couple's main sources of income are from farming. They earn 30,000 PHP every cropping, and 2,000 PHP from hog-raising. Teody also cultivates their parcel of rice farm.

Rebecca has a store in their village, which brings her a net weekly income of 700 PHP. She is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to 14,000 PHP as additional capital to maintain the store. According to Rebecca, the principle of her life is "We must do our very best and God will do the rest."

loans.use: As additional capital to maintain her store

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
La señora Jenny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mariscalense”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 61 años y 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando, y es el orgullo, para seguir trabajando.

Jenny, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer productos de belleza de la línea Avon,  de un familiar. Poco a poco, fue ahorrando y generando  su propio capital, así de esta manera decidió implementar su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos, con el que en la actualidad continua, pero ya siendo de ella misma y contando con un local propio muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, que día a día van a su local.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo seguirá formando su propia red de representantes de la línea Avon.

Jenny, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Jenny is a member of the Mariscalense Communal Bank, which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 61 years old, single, and the mother of one dependent child who is attending school. She is proud that she is able to continue working.

Jenny is a woman who has overcome many difficulties throughout her life. She offers beauty products from the Avon line, a well-known brand. Little by little, she generated and saved her own capital, and eventually decided to open her own business selling cosmetics. Jenny continues to manage her business to this day, but now she has her own location that is suited for welcoming customers who come by her shop day after day to shop.

With her loan of 2500 soles, Jenny will buy beauty products to add to her inventory such as perfumes for women and men, crèmes, pressed powders, lipsticks, and nail polishes. She also continues to provide support to her own network of Avon representatives.

Jenny has become a mature role model for other women who want to start a business. With perseverance, she was able to achieve her dreams. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to add to her inventory

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana es cliente D. Emprender desD. el año 2002, ella trabajo con el grupo solidario Wilacota en 9 secuencias, posteriormente se individualizó siendo esta su 5ta secuencia, como individual, la señora tiene un negocio D. cultivo y venta D. verduras por mayor y por menor, ella es productora, tiene tierras D. cultivo en su pueblo Cohoni por el lado D. Palca, en el departamento D. La Paz; la señora tiene hijos que ya son independientes, ella solo se hace cargo D. una nieta que le dejó su hijo, el esposo es jardinero , en todos estos años que trabajo con Emprender demostró puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana has been a client of Emprender since 2002. She previously worked with the Wilacota Solidarity Group for 9 loan cycles. Now she is on her 5th individual loan.

Sra. Juana has a produce business selling vegetables wholesale and retail. She is also a farmer with cultivated land in the village of Cohoni, which is near Palca in the department of La Paz. She has three adult children. Her only dependent is a granddaughter that was left by her son. Juana’s husband works as a gardener. In all the years of working with Emprender, she has been on time with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seed to begin planting on her farmland

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha se encuentra en su tercera secuencia, ella vino a la institución debido a una promoción, ella tiene como actividad principal la atención D. la tienda por las tardes, en las mañanas esta trabajando D. empleada del hogar en un domicilio particular, el esposo es portero en un edificio en la  zona D. Cota Cota, la señora tiene tres hijos que aún estudian, los que le colaboran en la tienda, es una señora muy activa y tiene buenas referencias por la zona, en sus anteriores créditos no tuvo atrasos.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is now on her third loan. She came to Emprender upon seeing an advertisement. Martha manages a small grocery store in the afternoons. In the mornings, she works as a housekeeper at a private home. Her husband is a doorman at a building in the Cota Cota district. Martha has three school-aged children who help look after the store. She is a very active woman with good references. Her credit history does not show any delinquencies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
La señora Rogelia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mariscalense”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesionales a sus hijos, y teniendo su propio capital para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa, la cual lleva 05 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad y con su carácter emprendedor que siempre le ha caracterizado, decidió implementar su negocio de ventas de menú, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Rogelia, vende sus comidas a partir de las 11:30 am y nos cuenta que sus ventas diarias de abarrotes y comidas, le van muy bien.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,800.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para preparar sus alimentos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Rogelia, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir administrando y ejerciendo sus negocios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Rogelia is a member of the communal bank “Mariscalense”, located in the district of Juanjui, in the Mariscal Cáceres province, department of San Martín. She is 56 years old, married with two children (one of them still depends on her financially).
She hopes for her children to become professionals. Having the necessary income, she decided to establish her own grocery store inside her home. She’s had this business for five years. Her entrepreneurial spirit also led her to open a restaurant inside her home. The restaurant is well conditioned to serve her clients. Rogelia sells food starting at 11:30 am. She tells us that both her businesses (grocery store and restaurant) are going well.
With the loan of S/ 2,800.00 she will buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, boxed fish preserves in a variety of brands, eggs and personal hygiene products. She will use part of the money to buy ingredients and utensils for her cooking and be able to provide quality service to her clients.
Rogelia still feels strong to continue to manage and run her businesses. She is thankful to the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” (Kiva partner) for making her dreams and goals come true.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La Sra. Gregoria ,es cliente de Emprender desde el año 2002, tiene un buen historial, ella se dedica al tejido de mantas de vicuña y alpaca, se provee de materia prima en las Ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, ella tiene 4 hijos pequeños que estudian, el esposo trabaja de albañil en construcciones por la zona sur, ellos viven en domicilio propio. Ella trabaja  en su decima secuencia, es cliente es muy responsable y tiene buenas referencias por la zona.
texts.en:
Gregoria has been a client of Emprender since 2002 and has good credit history. She weaves blankets from vicuña and alpaca wool, buying the raw materials from the markets in El Alto city. She has 4 small children who are in school; her husband works as a construction worker in la zona sur (the southern zone of the city). They own their home. Gregoria is on her tenth loan cycle; she is a very responsible client and has good references throughout the area.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vicuña and alpaca wool

loans.name: Khan Mohammad

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is K. Mohammad. He lives in Jalalabad. He is married with six children. He is the only one at home that is responsible for paying the house expenses.

He is a farmer and has been involved in this business for more than 15 years. He is very experienced in the field of farming. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to buy more seeds and the required tools for farming.

He really wants to progress and advance his business. He is confident that with the loan he will be able to work in a better way and support all his family members.

Finally, he would like to extend his gratitude to the Kiva lenders that support the entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: To buy more seeds for his farming

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Dolores, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mariscalense”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Casada, tiene 46 años y 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee ella decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de gallinas, con un capital de S/. 500.00, donde comenzó vendiendo poco a poco y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes, que ya conocen de la actividad que realiza. Para esto Dolores, se levanta muy temprano, para acudir a su chacra y alimentar a sus gallinas. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, comprará mas aves de corral como gallinas, pavos, patos, que son animales que tienen mayor acogida sobretodo en los restaurantes, donde venden comida de la región. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres de cualquier enfermedad.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dolores belongs to the Mariscalense Communal Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 46 and has three children. Two of the children are still dependent upon her and attend school. Thanks to her spirit, entrepreneurial energy, and the need to get her children ahead, she decided to start her own chicken selling business. She started with the amount of S/.500.00. She started selling little by little, and she began making herself known among her customers. Now they know about her business. Dolores gets up very early to take care of her farm and feed her chickens. She will use this loan for S/. 1000.00 to buy more poultry like chickens, turkeys, and ducks. These are the animals in most demand, above all, in restaurants where they sell regional food. She will use part of the money to buy balanced food and vitamins to keep her animals healthy and free from disease. She feels very satisfied with the work she does even though it is hard work and she has to get up early. She believes that it is worth the sacrifice to make her dreams come true and to meet the goals she has outlined for her life. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering support to her and other women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baby chickens and balanced food

loans.name: Ahmad Khan

texts.en:
This is Ahmad Khan. He lives in the city of Jalalabad. He is a young man and he is the one responsible for his family members. He lives in a family of seven, which includes his father and mother. He is the oldest son in his family. 

Ahmad Khan owns a retail shop, where he sells different kinds of things. He is asking for an individual loan of 50,000 AFN for the purpose of purchasing more and better quality materials for his shop. His main purpose is to attract more clients and to purchase the things that are most in demand in his market. He hopes to grow his business and bring about new changes to it by taking the loan. He is confident that he can repay his loan on time. He would like to extend his gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more and better stock

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Esperanza”, Distrito Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Conviviente, tiene 39 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella. 

Las ganas de salir adelante y hacer profesionales a sus hijos le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio la venta de abarrotes, con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico de su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Se inicio con S/.  1,000.00 y poco a poco fue ahorrando y diferenciando el dinero de su negocio con el dinero personal, donde obtuvo ganancias y así creció cada día.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y también  una refrigeradora para poder conservar los diferentes tipos de carnes para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

María Luisa, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. María Luisa is a member of the Hope Communal Bank, which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 39 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 dependent children.

Her desire to succeed and dream of seeing her children become professionals motivated her to start her own grocery business. The proceeds from her business have enabled her to financially support her household. She has been gaining customers from the very beginning. Today she has a fixed clientele who come to her store to shop because she has all the necessities one could ever need. María Luisa welcomes each customer with her charming personality.

She started her business with initial capital of 1000 soles and built up her savings gradually over time. María Luisa keeps separate accounts to differentiate her business expenses from her personal expenses. The income from her savings continues to grow every day.

María Luisa is now requesting a loan of 3000 soles to buy rice, sugar, cookies, packaged noodles, salt, and milk. She also plans to acquire a refrigerator to store different meats so that she can continue providing good service to her customers.

María Luisa looks forward to continue working with Manuela Ramos. She thanks the organization for helping women like her and providing them with opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory & a refrigerator for storing meats

loans.name: Francisca Zoila

texts.es:
La señora Francisca Zoila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Esperanza”, Distrito Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 46 años y 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Lleva  24 años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad y fue por iniciativa propia quien decidió desarrollarse en este tipo de actividad y contando con un pequeño capital y el conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender cordialmente a sus clientes que día a día, acuden a su taller para ser atendidos y es Francisca, quien  les espera  amablemente y con el carisma que siempre le ha caracterizado. 

En la actualidad, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente, nos cuenta que le va muy bien. Una de sus metas por lograr es tener un taller  de alta costura e implementarlo con maquinas industriales modernas. Es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad y el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará una maquina y una remalladora por que la que tiene ya no funciona bien, además si sobra el dinero comprará alfileres tijera y papel molde. 

Francisca, hoy en día se siente una mujer realizada, con  ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca Zoila is a member of the Hope Communal Bank, which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old, single, and the mother of 3 children of whom 2 are still dependents.

Francisca has been engaged in sewing for 24 years. With the help of a little capital, she took the initiative to utilize her sewing skills by opening a dressmaking shop out of her house. Her business is well suited for welcoming customers, whom she greets with her friendly and charming personality.

Francisca informs us that her business is doing well. Her customers place their orders in advance. One of her goals is to open a boutique selling couture fashions and manufacture the garments using modern industrial equipment. With her loan of 1500 soles, she will purchase a sewing machine and an overlock stitcher because her current equipment is in disrepair. In addition, Francisca will use any leftover money to buy pins, scissors, and paper molds.

Today Francisca feels she is an accomplished woman and continues to strive for her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting many more women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing equipment & materials

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda M. is from the city of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Imelda owns and operates a business providing dressmaking services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Imelda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from GDMPC. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 44 years old and she is still very determined in managing her retail store that she has operated for almost a year. Her daily net income is Php 200 and, according to her, together with her husband she's covering their family's expenditures. They want their children to have a better education and that's why she's working with patience for her family.

Lydia and her husband are blessed with four children, they are: Diana, 22, a housewife; Sammy, 20, a delivery boy; Mario, 17, a farmer; and Jonalyn, 14, who stopped his schooling due to financial constraints.

Lydia is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from Kiva lenders to strengthen her business in order to improve her family's life. She hopes that she will obtain the desired loan so as to be able to buy more products for her store.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store

loans.name: Patrocenia

texts.en:
"Strong determination is important in handling a business," according to Patrocenia N., 44 years old. She is married to Zandy, a construction worker, who is currently working in Palawan, Philippines. The couple is blessed with three loving children and they are: Zoren, 14, a second-year college student; Ceasar, 11, a grade six student; and Sherly, ten years old. They are presently living in the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela.

Patrocenia has been engaged in a hog-raising business for almost three years now and her net income is Php 3,000. Aside from that, she also provides beauty services such as pedicure and manicure.

Patrocenia is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 to obtain her desired profits. Her requested loan will be used to purchase some young piglets to raise. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma T. is from the city of Gango Ozmaiz City. She is 34 years old. Gemma is married and has 5 school-aged children. Gemma owns & operates a business providing rug or doormat making services in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Gemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 39 years old and she has managed a retail store in the village of Alinam, Cauayan City for almost ten years now. In addition, she has extra income from retail sales of rice and also electronic cellphone cards. She desires to increase her income, which has motivated her to request a loan of PHP 15,000.00 from the KIVA lenders. She will use the loan to buy additional items to sell in her store. She hopes that generous lenders will approve her requested loan, so that she will be able to help her husband pay for the education of their children.

Her husband is Ferdinand. He works as a farmer and also a tricycle driver. They have been blessed with four children: Diane, 17, Christian, 15, Jason, 11, and their youngest is Jesa Marie, three years old. The family resides in the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela, a rural area near the national highway.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
In order to survive in the midst of crisis, Mary Jane G. and her husband are working hard to earn a living and to finance the schooling of their three children. They want the children to have a bright future and not to follow their parents’ steps. This couple sacrifices their time and endure hardships and difficulties to earn a living that will finance the children’s studies.

They earn income through farming. Mary Jane’s husband cultivates their farm for two, tending the crops while Mary Jane is engaged in selling ice cream in their village. Every day, she sells ice cream in the street and also at the school campus. Through her patience and sacrifice, she is able to earn an income of not less than PHP 4,000 a month. This income is used to satisfy the family’s basic needs and for the schooling of their children. Since her business is beneficial to them, she wants to continue and improve it. Because she has inadequate capital, she is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 to increase her capital to improve her small business.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her food production business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en:
Eudricelo L. is from the city of Labo Ozamiz City. He is 44 years old. Eudricelo is married and has 3 school-aged children. Eudricelo owns & operates a "sari-sari" retail store where he sells a variety of different products in the local community. Eudricelo has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eudricelo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to engage in business activities. Eudricelo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Eudricelo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Severo
loans.use: Additional capital for his hog raising business.
