loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Sewing dresses and curtains is the business of Anselma M.. Aside from sewing, she also sells cosmetic products within their village. Anselma is married to Rome and the have six children: Ryan Richard, 25 years old; Roderick, 23 years old; Efren, 20 years old; Rose, 16 years old. All of the eldest children are high school graduates; Romeo Jr., 14 years old, is now in 3rd year high school; and the youngest is Angelica, 5 years old. 

This couple would like to have a better living. They are doing their best to provide for all the needs of their children. Anselma says that, through her sacrifices in selling cosmetic products and her patience in sewing curtains and dresses, she is able to provide for the needs of her family. But due to the high cost of commodities, she can’t continue to meet all the needs of her children. Due to insufficient income, she would like to borrow additional capital, amounting to PHP 5,000, for business improvement. In order to purchase additional products, this loan will serve as a big help to her family.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald G., together with his wife Jennifer, has managed a food vending business for almost one year now. They earn a weekly net income of PHP 250. Aside from that, they are also engaged in a hog-raising business. With these businesses, Ronald is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 5,000. He will put the funds towards buying additional pigs as well as investing in their food vending business.

Married for almost one year, the couple is still childless but they are earnestly waiting for their little angel to come into their life. They are living peacefully at barangay Del Corpuz, Cabatuan Isabela. Aside from their businesses Ronald also works as a security guard on a night shift. He believes that, with determination and perseverance, he will succeed in life.

loans.use: Additional hogs to raise and additional capital in the food vending business.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Patience and industriousness are the guiding values of Laila N.. She is already 38 years of age. She manages a mini food vending business, located along the highway of Sillawit,Cauayan, Isabela. She operates her business before lunchtime and until 4:00 in the afternoon. Her weekly net income is PHP 3,000. Many villagers or passengers of mini buses buy her cooked food. She sells also vegetables and sometimes fruit to have additional income.

Laila budgets their income, but still it is not enough to cover the school tuition for her two children, at the primary level. She decided to request a loan, amounting to PHP 5,000, from KIVA lenders. She will use the loan towards preparing additional food to cook and to purchase some fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes that this loan will be granted.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria V. is busy maintaining her hog raising business. She makes sure that her pigpen is always clean so that it will not produce a bad odor. But, due to financial constraints, she can't purchase enough feed for her raised animals. She wants to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 in order to buy stock of feed. Being a positive thinker, Maria believes that her loan will be granted.

She is happily married to Lorito, a carpenter. They are blessed with four children: Mylene, 25 years old; Rose Ann, 23 years old; Jennifer, 18 years old; and Juliet, 14 years old, a high school student. Their family happily lives at the village of Quezon, San Isidro.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy stock of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios A. is from the village of Sinara Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Remedios is widowed and has 2 adult children. Remedios owns & operates a business cultivating, buying and selling vegetables in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Remedios joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds for vegetables. This will be the third loan taken out by Remedios from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables seeds.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 43 years old, married, and blessed with six children, namely: Temilyn, 26 years of age, a college graduate who is now working at a private company; Joel, 24 years of age, a college graduate; Jocelyn, 22 years of age, a college graduate; Mary-Ann, 19 years of age, a college student;  Antonette, 15 years of age, a junior high school student; and Simone, 8 years of age, a grade three pupil. They are happily living in the village of Baculud, Iguig, Cagayan.

Josefina has operated a sari-sari store business (community-based store) in their village for five years now. She wishes her business to grow for it is a great help in meeting the needs of their family. With her income, she is able to assist her husband in providing for the family.

In this regard Josefina wants to borrow additional capital for her business since she needs more stock for the improvement of her store. She is now in need of Php 25,000 and this will be used to buy more stock to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her business

loans.name: Nisa

texts.en: Nisa D. is from the village of Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old and is married. Nisa owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling daily-used products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and canned goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nisa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Germelina

texts.en: Germelina P. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Germelina owns and operates a business harvesting and selling rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Germelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her rice field. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth G., from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is 48 years old, married, and has four grown children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a business venture whose income comes mainly from selling baked food in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her enterprise for over 25 years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients. This loan will be Elizabeth's third from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:

Analyn owns & operates a business selling clothing in the local community. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Analyn is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Analyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her family’s daily needs.

Marilou owns & operates a "sari-sari" retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Marilou from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional products for her manicure set.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es: La señora tiene una caseta en el Mercado Villa Sebastian Pagador, venD. variedad D. lanas y chinelas (zapatillas para el calor) desD. hace 10 años, el puesto D. venta es D. su propiedad, sus clientes son generalmente D. la zona, ella es muy trabajadora y la gente que la conoce le tienen mucha estima. Su esposo es albañil, viven en anticrético, tiene un hijo que depenD. directamente D. ellos, sus otros dos hijos ya son mayores y tienen sus propias familias.
texts.en:
Eleuteria has a booth in the Villa Sebastian Pagador Market. She sells a variety of wool and slippers (to keep your feet warm). For 10 years, she has been operating her trading post. Her customers are mostly from the area. She is a very hard worker and the people she knows hold her in high regard. Her husband works as a bricklayer. The couple lives in a rental property and has three children. One child is still a dependent, while the other two are adults and have their own families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool & slippers

loans.name: Amistad Por Siempre Group

texts.es: Es un grupo muy responsables en sus pagos que se pudo recuperar despues D. 3 meses viven en diferentes zonas,pero que sus negocios estan en un mismo lugar que es el Mercado D. Santa Barbara D. la zona sud D. Cochabamba sin embargo las señoras  se conocen bien ya que son compañeras D. venta durante muchos años; actualmente el mercado donD. ellas realizan su actividad comercial se encuentra a medio construir y no cuentan con muchas necesidades por ejemplo D. alcantarillados, agua potable, etc. Su grupo se llama "AMISTAD POR SIEMPRE", donD., el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 4º Ciclo.La  mesa directiva esta conformada la siguiente manera: como presidenta, la señora Rosa ,ella es muy responsable y lider D. su grupo, tiene 3 hijos, pero que actualmente esta viviendo solo con uno ya que los otros 2 son independientes,  es casada ella venD. chinelas en el mercado ya mencionado y su esposo es mecanico. Como tesorera esta la socia Juana, quien es muy responsable y conocedora del manejo del efectivo tiene 1 hijo es casada, ella venD. comida en su propio domicilio como tambien en el mercado Santa Barbara, el credito lo utiliza para  aumento D. capital. Como secretaria esta la socia Karina  es soltera no tiene hijos,trabaja vendiendo desayunos en el mismo mercado que venden sus compañeras , el credito lo utiliza para capital.
texts.en:
This is a group that is very responsible about their payments, which they were able to repay in three months. They live in different regions, but their businesses are in the same place, the Santa Barbara Market in the area south of Cochambamba. Nevertheless, the women know each other well because they have been sales colleagues for many years. Currently the market where they sell is half built, and it does not have a lot of the necessities like sewers or portable water, etc. Their group is called Amistad Por Siempre. Their Communal Bank is in their fourth cycle. Their executive board is maD. up of the following: Rosa is the president. She is very responsible and the leader of the group. She has three children, but she currently only lives with one as the other two are independent. She is married. She sells slippers in the above mentioned market. Her husband is a mechanic. Juana is the treasurer. She is very responsible and knows how to handle money. She is married and has one child. She sells food in her own home as well as in the Santa Barbara market. The loan is to increase capital. Karina is the secretary. She is single, and does not have children. She sells breakfast in the same market where her colleagues sell. The loan is for capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim, age 32, is a responsible father of 5 children who has always watched over his family’s financial security. Ibrahim breeds cattle and sells them at market. He would like to increase his herd. With this goal in mind, brahim is requesting a loan of $ 2100 that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve the living conditions for his household and also to make some investments.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Sol Y Luna Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Sol y Luna está formado por 10 clientes, pertenecen a L. Zona D. Pampahasi,  las socias se dedican a L. venta D. Viveres, pan, Cerveza, Abarrotes, refresco, venta D. comida, venta D. papa, venta D. medicamentos, Cosméticos Durante su permanencia en Emprender, que son 5 ciclos se reestructuro en un 30% D. las socias
Angelica  es L. representante, líder fundadora del banco D. emprendimiento y presidenta del banco desD. hace 3 ciclos teniendo en cuenta que el banco ya tiene como antigüedad 5 ciclos, L. socia tiene una  tienda D. abarrotes. En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona dinámica, alegre muy determinada al momento D. manejar a su grupo es una líder responsable con sus compañeras, exigente con sus cuotas D. sus compañeras a L. hora D. pago, el préstamo que se le ha otorgado a podido aumentar su capital en L. tienda y generar mayores ingresos económicos familiares.
Patricia, es L. tesorera del banco es una D. las socias dinámicas ya trabaja con L. institución 2 ciclos actualmente tiene una tienda D. barrio, durante su permanencia L. señora no presento problemas, el préstamo lo invertirá en el aumento D. capital para L. tienda, y generar mayor ingreso para L. tienda.
Yuly,  Socia bastante dinámica, alegre, es L. secretaria del Banco, durante su permanencia en el banco siempre se encuentra animando a sus compañeras, a seguir adelante, actualmente se dedica a L. venta D. Cosméticos el crédito solicitado, lo requiere para el aumento D. capital.
Durante su permanencia no presento problemas, en el pago D. sus cuotas mas lo contrario responsabilidad durante L. permanencia D. su crédito.
texts.en:
The Sol y Luna Communal Bank is comprised of ten members from the Pampahasi area. The members sell supplies, bread, beer, groceries, soft drinks, food, potatoes, medicine, and cosmetics. During the five cycles that they have been with Emprender, they have restructured 30% of their membership. Angelica is the representative. She is the founding leader of their entrepreneurial bank. She has been the president of the bank for three of their five cycles. She has a grocery store. She has stood out in her communal bank as a dynamic person. She is happy and is now very determined to manage her group. She is a leader who is responsible with her colleagues and fastidious about her colleagues’ payments when they are due. With the loan she was able to increase capital in her store and generate greater family income. Patricia is the treasurer of the bank. She is one of the dynamic members. She has worked with the institution for two cycles. She currently has a neighborhood store. She has presented no problems during her membership. With the loan she will increase the capital in her store and generate more income for the store. Yuly is a dynamic and happy member. She is the secretary of the bank. During her membership in the bank she has always been encouraging her colleagues to get ahead. She currently sells cosmetics. She needs the loan they are asking for to increase her capital. She has not presented problems with her payments during her membership. To the contrary, throughout her membership she has shown responsibility with her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es: El señor Jose se dedica a la venta y arreglo de bicicletas, en la cual ya lleva mas de 6 años en el oficio de la misma. El vive en casa de sus padres, tiene su taller por la Av. capitan Victor Ustariz Km. 8, el destino del credito es para poder comprar mas repuestos, y accesorios de bicicletas. El Sr. esta casado, tiene dos hijos pequeños, la esposa le colabora en el negocio de las bicicletas, adicamente trabaja  que esporadicamente trabaja como empleada domestica.
texts.en:
Jose sells and repairs bicycles. He has been doing this for over six years. He lives in his parents’ house. His shop is on Av. Capitan Victor Ustariz Km. 8. The loan is to be able to buy more spare parts and accessories for the bicycles. He is married and has two small children. His wife works with him in the bicycle business. Additionally, she works sporadically as a domestic employee.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts and accessories for bicycles

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es: Es un grupo responsable en sus pagos, todos, se conocen bien, no cuentan con muchas necesidades basicas en su barrio por ejemplo de alcantarillados, agua potable, etc. Su grupo se llama "CRISTO REY", donde, el Banco de Emprendimiento esta en su 2º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada la siguiente manera,  como presidenta esta  la señora Aida, ella es muy responsable, tiene 2 hijos es casada ella elabora masitas y su esposo es chofer. Como tesorera esta la socia Pamela quien es muy responsable y conocedora del manejo del efectivo tiene 2 hijos es casada, es confeccionista de ropa  y da al credito lo utiliza para  aumento de capital. Como secretaria esta la socia Elizabeth es soltera no tiene hijos,su actividad es la vnta de ropa a domicilio, requiere el credito para aumentar su capital de trabajo
texts.en:
This group is responsible in their payments. They know each other well. Their neighborhood does not have many of the basic necessities like sewers and potable water, etc. The name of the group is Cristo Rey, and this entrepreneurial bank is in their second cycle. The executive board is formed in the following manner: Aida is the president. She is very responsible. She is married and has two children. She makes “masitas” (small pastries that are quite delicious), and her husband is a driver. Pamela is the treasurer. She is very responsible and knows how to manage money. She is married and has two children. She makes clothes, and sells on credit. She will use the loan to increase capital. Elizabeth is the secretary. She is single and does not have children. She sells clothing door-to-door. She needs the loan to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: El Porvenir Group

texts.es: Es un grupo muy responsables en sus pagos,  ya que se conocen bien, son muy solidarios entre los mienbros del grupo. Su grupo se llama "EL PORVENIR", donD., el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 2º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada D. la siguiente manera,  como presidenta esta  la señora  Lidia  ,ella es muy responsable y lider D. su grupo, tiene 2 hijas  pero que actualmente vive sola es separada D. su esposo,  su actividad es la venta D. sal, el cual reparte a todas las zonas D. Cochabamba. Como tesorera esta la socia Irma   quien es muy responsable, es soltera no tiene hijos, trabaja vendiendio lenceria en las diferentes ferias,  el credito lo utiliza para  aumento D. capital. Como secretaria  esta la  socia  Alejandrina  quien tiene el negocio D. venta D. comida en la puerta D. su casa ya que es la parada D. los Taxi trufis a pueblos cercanos, ella es divorciada y tiene 1 hijo,  el credito lo utiliza para capital.
texts.en:
This is a group that is very responsible for their payments, is already well-known, and which has much solidarity among the members. The group is called “El Porvenir “ (The Future) and is in their second loan cycle with the “Banco D. Empredimiento” (Bank of Entrepreneurship). The board is maD. up as follows: as president, Lidia, who is very responsible and is the leader of the group. She has 2 daughters, but she currently lives alone as she is separated from her husband. Her business activity is the selling of salt, which covers all areas of Cochabamba. As treasurer is Irma, who is very responsible and is single with no children. She works selling lingerie at different markets. As secretary is Alejandrina, who has a business selling food from her house, which is near the stop for collective taxis (taxis in which several persons share the fare) to nearby villages. She is divorced and has one son. The loan will used to increase capital.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase capital

loans.name: Chicas Superpoderosas Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Chicas Super Poderosas está formado por 11 clientes, pertenecen a la Zona D. Alto San Isidro, que están ubicados por la parada minibús línea 211 las socias se dedican a la repostería, costurera, venta D. ropa, salteñas empanadas venta D. comida, venta D. papa. Durante su permanencia en Emprender, que son 2 ciclos se reestructuro en un 40% D. las socias, socias cumplidas, responsables, y muy dinámicas 
Gabriela,  es la representante, líder, actualmente toma el cargo D. la presidenta del banco esta en su segundo ciclo, durante el tiempo anterior D. su crédito demostró responsabilidad, en el pago D. créditos, fundadora del banco D. emprendimiento desD. hace 2 ciclos teniendo en cuenta que el banco ya tiene como antigüedad 3 ciclos, la socia se dedica a la venta D. ropa nueva. En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable, brindando su apoyo a todas sus compañeras ya sea moralmente o económicamente al momento D. manejar a su grupo es una líder responsable con sus compañeras, exigente con sus cuotas D. sus compañeras a la hora D. pago, el préstamo otorgado lo invirtió en la compra D. mercadería aumentando su capital y generar mayores ingresos económicos.
Flora,  Socia que en este ciclo asumió el cargo D. tesorera del banco, es una D. las representantes en su banco comunal, socia que se integra en este ciclo,   es su primer ciclo, es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito, actualmente tiene una tienda D. fotocopias, el préstamo lo invertirá en el aumento D. capital para la tienda.
Fidel, es uno D. los socios fundadores del banco, es el único varón dentro el banco comunal durante su permanencia que son 2 ciclos demostró puntualidad en los pagos estricto con las señoras. del banco a hora D. pagar los pagos, el crédito solicitado es para invertir en herramientas D. albañil,
texts.en:
The Chicas Superpoderosas community bank consists of 11 member-clients who belong to the Alto San Isidro area, located at stop 211 on the minibus line. The members work in baking, sewing, selling clothes, and selling food such as saltenas, empanadas (types of stuffed pastries with meat and vegetables) and potatoes. During the group’s tenure at Emprender they have restructured 2 loan cycles in 40% of the members. The members are responsible and accomplished. Gabriela is the representative, leader, and founder of the venture bank. She has been in charge as president for 2 of the 3 loan cycles that the bank has had. Before her time with the bank she showed responsibility in the payment of her loans. She works selling new clothes. In the communal bank she has emerged as a responsible person to proviD. support to all the members either morally or economically, demanding their share of the payments at the due date. The loan is invested in the purchase of goods so as to increase capital and generate more income. Flora, a partner in this cycle, took over as treasurer of the bank. She is one of the representatives for the bank who joined this cycle. This is her first cycle and the first time she has obtained a loan. Currently she has a photocopy shop. The loan will be invested in the increase of capital for the store. Fidel is one of the founders of the bank and is the only male. During his tenure of 2 loan cycles he demonstrated strict punctuality in his loan payments with the other female partners. The loan is sought to invest in masonry tools.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase capital

loans.name: Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Roca Fuerte esta integrado por tres personas, dos de llas tienen su puesto de abarrotes en el mercado Los Pinos de la calle 25 y la otra integrante tiene su tienda en la calle 23 de Calacoto, ellas son clientes desde el año 2005, se encuentran en su 16ava secuencia, la Señora Josefina  vende abarrotes y cereales remojados, ella tiene una hija joven que trabaja, y la Sra. Josefina es quien cuida de su nieta, la otra integrante Maria Elena  vende abarrotes en el mismo mercado, ella tiene dos hijos pequeños que van a la ecuela, el esposo generalmente se encuentra de viaje, y finalmente la otra integrante, la Sra. Magaly  tiene el negocio de la tienda ella tiene un  hijo joven , el esposo es profesor y viaja a provincia, todas ellas se conocen y se colaboran, es un  grupo muy bonito y puntual.
texts.en:
The supportive group Roca Fuerte (Strong Rock) is made up of three people, Two have grocery stands in the Los Pinos market on Calle 25, while the last member has her store on Calle 23 in Calacoto. They have all been clients since 2005, and are in their 16th loan cycle. Mrs. Josefina sells groceries and soaked cereals. She has a young daughter that also works, so Josefina takes care of her granddaughter. María Elena sells groceries in the same market as Josefina. She has two young children who go to elementary school, and her husband usually travels a lot. Finally, the last member is Mrs. Magaly, who owns the store. She has a young child, and her husband is a professor who travels around the province. The three women all know each other and collaborate together. They work well together and are always punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise/groceries for resale.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal EMPRENDEDORAS está formado por 11 clientes, pertenecen a la Zona D. Villa Copacabana, están ubicados por el cruce D. villas. Se dedican a la venta D. tucumanas, atencion D. tiendas D. barrio, almacén D. abarrotes azúcar, harina, arroz, fideo, etc, venta D. cosmeticos, venta D. ropa, salteñas empanadas venta D. comida. Durante su permanencia en Emprender, que son 6 ciclos, se reestructuro en un 50% D. las socias, en las cuales solo se quedaron las mas responsables cumplidas,  con sus pagos 
La Sra.Gaby,  es la representante, y una D. las fundadoras del banco, líder y representante actualmente toma el cargo D. la presidenta del banco esta en su sexto ciclo, durante el tiempo anterior D. su crédito demostró responsabilidad, en el pago D. créditos, estricta con sus compañeras lleva adelante las reglas D. funcionamiento del banco, es una D. las socias que mas se destaca en su puntualidad demostrando a todas que es muy importante seguir reglas internas se ha destacado como una persona responsable, brindando su apoyo a todas sus compañeras ya sea moralmente o económicamente al momento D. manejar a su grupo demuestra liderazgo, exigente con sus cuotas D. sus compañeras a la hora D. pago, el préstamo otorgado lo invirtió en la compra D. mercadería aumentando su capital y generar mayores ingresos económicos; ella reparte viveres al credito.
La Sra. Gertrudis, socia que en este ciclo asumió el cargo D. tesorera del banco, es una D. las fundadoras del banco, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. empanadas D. pollo, durante su permanencia en el banco demostró responsabilidad, y puntualidad en el banco, el préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. materia prima.  Siendo una D. las responsables en la organización del banco y su manejo siguiendo su reglamento interno.
La Sra.Mariela es una D. las socias que se integra al grupo, siendo su primer ciclo en la banca, que actualmente asume el cargo D. secretaria durante su entrevista y participación demostró puntualidad y dinamismo con sus compañeras, se dedica a la venta D. ropa y sabanas al credito,  su crédito obtenido lo invertirá para traer mayor mercadería D. la ciudad D. Oruro.
texts.en:
The EMPRENDEDORAS Village Bank is composed of 11 clientes who are from the Villa Copacabana area and live by the crossroads. They sell several types of traditional meat-filled pastries, run neighborhood stores, sell groceries such as sugar, flour, rice and noodles, sell cosmetics, clothes and food. During the 6 loan cycles with Emprender, the bank has reorganized the partnership, leaving 50% of the partners that are the most responsible and timely with their payments. Mrs. Gaby is the representative and is one of the founding members of the bank. As a leader, she currently has the role of president of the bank which is in its sixth loan cycle. In the period before her loans, she demonstrated responsibility. She is strict with her colleagues and enforces the operating rules of the bank. She is one of the partners who stands out the most in the punctuality of her payments demonstrating to all that it is very important to follow the internal rules. She stands out as a responsible person, offering her support to all of her fellow partners be it morally or economically . When it comes to running her group, she demonstrates leadership and is insistent in collecting the loan repayments from her colleagues when it is time. She is using the new loan to add to her capital and to generate more income. She distributes groceries on a credit basis. Mrs. Gertrudis, a member who in this cycle took on the role of treasurer of the bank, is one of the founders of the bank. Currently, she sells chicken empanadas. During her time with the bank, she has demonstrated responsibility and timeliness with her payments. She is using the loan to purchase raw materials. As one of the members in a responsible position with the bank, she follows the internal rules. Mrs. Mariela is one of the members that has joined the group and this is her first loan cycle with the bank. She currently has the position of secretary for the bank. During her interview and her interactions with the group, she has demonstrated punctuality and dynamism with her fellow members. She sells clothing and bedding on a credit basis. She is using the loan to purchase more merchandise in the city of Oruro.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Addition to capital

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El señor se dedica al transporte publico(Taxi) por toda la ciudad de Cochabamba, el vehiculo es propio se dedica como chofer hace cuatro años, con vehiculo propio hace dos años, tambien ayuda a sus padres con una tienda de barrio en su domicilio, el señor es soltero. Es su segunda secuencia en la Institucion y a demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur works in the field of public transportation (taxi) throughout the city of Cochabamba. He owns his vehicle and has worked as a driver for four years, with his own vehicle for the past two years. He is single and helps his parents with a neighborhood store that they operate within their home. This is his second loan sequence with the institution, and he has shown himself to be highly responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing tires, a new battery, accessories and other equipment

loans.name: Villa Paraiso Group

texts.es: Es un grupo antiguo responsables en sus pagos, donD. se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "VILLA PARAISO", el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 9º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada por socias responsable y unidos entre ellos, como presidenta esta  la señora Eulogia, ella es lider D. su grupo, muy responsable, se dedica a la fabricacion D. balones D. futbol, tiene 1 hijo, su esposo es comerciante D. balones; el credito lo utilizara para  aumento D. capital. Como tesorero esta Deybi  quien es fundador del grupo, muy responsable tiene 1 hijo trabaja con taxi y tiene internet en su casa el credito lo utiliza para mantenimiento D. su auto y D. sus computadoras. Como secretaria esta la socia Mirian, quien es una socia responsable ,venD. refrigerios y masitas ambulando por el barrio tiene 2 hijos su esposo es comerciante D. gorras el credito lo usa para aumento D. capital.
texts.en:
This is a long-standing group, called "VILLA PARAISO", which is in its 9th loan cycle with the Banco D. Emprendimiento. They have always been very responsible with their repayments and the group members know each other well. The board is maD. up of responsible, united members. Their president is Eulogia and she is a responsible group leader. She manufactures footballs, has one son, and her husband sells the footballs. She will use these funds to increase her operating capital. Deybi is the group treasurer and the founder of the group. He is very responsible, has one son, is a taxi driver and runs an Internet service in his home; he will use the funds for car and computer maintenance. Miriam is the group secretary. She is a very responsible member and she sells refreshments and little cakes around her neighborhood. She has two children and her husband sells caps. She will use the funds to increase working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital increase.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela tiene 35 años, vive con sus 2 pequeños hijos y su pareja, en su casa propia. Ella es una mujer muy hogareña y trabajadora.

Desde muy joven se ha desempeñado en variedad de oficios y siempre los ha realizado con muchas ganas porque sabe que todo trabajo bien realizado obtiene buenas recompensas.
Es así que en unión con su hermana se dedica a vender comida en un pequeño puesto en un paradero de transporte público de mucha afluencia cerca de su casa. De esta manera puede trabajar velar por sus pequeños que necesitan de muchos cuidados ya que están en una etapa de crecimiento, además de apoyarse mutuamente con su hermana para generarse una fuente de ingresos económicos.
Ellas siempre piensan en grande y ya están haciendo planes de expandir su negocio, pero saben que el camino es largo y aun tienen mucho por recorrer, aun así están muy optimistas de lograr un futuro mejor.

Este es el segundo préstamo que realiza con MFP y siempre ha sido muy responsable con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes y utensilios de cocina para obtener mayor clientela y brindarles un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Adela, 35, lives in her own home with her partner and her two small children. She is a hard-working, home-lovng woman. From a very early age she has worked at various jobs and has always done them with enthusiasm because she knows that all work well done brings good rewards. Together with her sister she sells prepared meals from a small stand at a busy public transportation stop near her house. This allows her to work while still watching over her small children who need a lot of attention since they are in a growing stage and to provide mutual help to her sister thus earning income. They have big plans and are looking to expand their business but know that the road is long and they have a long way still to go but, even so, are optimistic that they will attain a better future. This is her second loan with MFP and she has always been responsible with her repayments. The funds she is requesting on this occasion will be used to buy a larger amount of ingredients and cooking utensils so that she can serve more customers and offer improved service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and cooking utensils for her meal preparation.

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
Etelvina tiene 31 años, vive con sus 2 hijos: Fredy de 5 y Leyla de 2 añitos de edad, en su casa propia. 

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que le gusta mucho realizar, ya que tiene muy buenas cualidades para la cocina. Ella ofrece sus ricos platillos de forma ambulatoria en uno de los paraderos de transporte público más concurridos de su zona. Etelvina ofrece pollo a la parrilla, caldo de mote, caldo de gallina, anticuchos, entre otros platillos regionales, los cuales son el deleite de todos sus clientes.
Lo único que le resulta complicado a Etelvina es realizar las compras para poder cocinar los paltillos, ya que la zona en la que vive es alejada de la ciudad y tiene que ir cargando sus bolsas por largos trechos, pero ha sabido sobrellevar esto con la idea de mejorar y brindarle un futuro mejor a su familia.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y ella menciona ser una persona muy responsable y se ha comprometido a no fallar en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará un toldo (cobertizo) para su puesto de venta y así brindar una mayor comodidad a su clientela.
texts.en:
Etelvina, 31, lives in her own home with her two children: Fredy, 5, and Leyla, 2. For the past 3 years she has sold prepared meals, an activity which she enjoys very much since she has good cooking skills. She offers her delicious meals from a food stand at one of the busiest public transportation hubs in her area. She offers grilled chicken, caldo de mote (a kind of lamb stew), chicken soup, anticuchos (meat kebabs), among other dishes typical of the area, which are a delight for all her customers. The only thing that is a bit complicated for Etelvina is the shopping for her ingredients for her dishes because the area where she lives is far from the city and she has to carry her shopping bags long distances. However, she has managed to overcome this keeping in mind her desire to improve and offer a better future for her family. This is her first loan with MFP and she states that she is a very responsible person and has committed not to fail in her repayments. With the funds she will buy a tarp-like awning or cover for her food stand in order to offer improved comfort for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a tarp-like cover for her food stand.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, de 39 años, es una madre muy amorosa. Vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres junto a su hija Nancy de 22 años y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para salir adelante.

Ella se dedica es la venta de locería (artículos de loza), aprovechando el alto movimiento comercial que existe en la ciudad de Tacna, ella viaja todos los fines a traer su mercadería, la cual luego vende en las ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca. Ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de llevarse algo.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es demostrar a sus clientes la fina loza que vende, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar la mercadería en bus, ya que para que no se rompa tiene que llevar muy bien envuelta en periódicos y en lugares cómodos. 
Para más adelante, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender su locería con más tranquilidad, ya que actualmente vende en forma ambulatoria.

Este es el primer préstamo de Nancy con MFP y está muy feliz por la oportunidad de crédito, el cual espera pagarlo a tiempo. E su banco comunal  es una socia muy querida por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más locería para aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Nancy, 39, is a very loving mother. She lives with her 22 year old daughter, Nancy, in the house that she inherited from her parents. She is prepared to work very hard to get ahead. She sells crockery (earthenware), and she is taking advantage of the large amount of commercial activity that exists in the city of Tacna. Every week end she travels with her merchandise, which she then sells at the fairs in the city of Juliaca. She is a very persuasive sales person. She always convinces her customers to take something. What she likes most about her work is showing her customers the fine crockery that she sells. She has been doing this for 12 years. The most difficult part is taking the merchandise on the bus. In order for it to not break, she has to take it very well wrapped in newspapers and in places with enough space. Later, she hopes to have a store where she can sell her crockery more peacefully. She currently sells as a street vendor. This is Nancy’s first loan with MFP. She is very happy for the opportunity of a loan, which she expects to repay on time. She is a much loved member of her communal bank because of the responsibility that she demonstrates. She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy more crockery to increase the amount of merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Wily

texts.es:
Wily, de 36 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable. Vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres junto a su querida madre (Juana) de 52 años, a quien desea dar una vejez tranquila.

El negocio de Wily es muy concurrido, sobre todo por los niños, él tiene un local de videojuegos, el cual le ha dado buenos resultados, ya que le deja el dinero necesario para mantenerse y ayudar a su madre. Juegos en Play Station, Nintendo 64, Pimball, etc., son los que ofrece a sus pequeños clientes, quienes prefieren ir a su local por los novedosos juegos que tiene.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver la alegría que sienten los niños al jugar, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es controlar que los niños no malogren sus máquinas de videojuego. 
Para el futuro de su negocio espera incrementar el número de máquinas que tiene actualmente.

Este es el primer préstamo de Wily con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy respetuoso con el resto de sus socias. Con los mil soles solicitados hará arreglar sus máquinas de pimball, puesto que por el uso se han ido malogrando.
texts.en:
Wily, 36, is a very hard-working and responsible man. He lives with his beloved 52 year old mother (Juana) in the house his parents inherited. He wants to give his mother a peaceful old age. Wily’s business is very popular, especially with the children. He has a place with video games, which has given him good results. The business gives him the money he needs to support himself and to help his mother. The games he offers to his small customers are Play Station, Nintendo 64, and Pinball, etc. The children prefer to go to his place for the novel games that he has. What he likes most about his work is seeing how happy the children are when they are playing. He has been doing this for five years. The most difficult part is controlling the children so that they do not ruin his video game machines. In the future he hopes to increase the number of machines that he currently has. This is Wily’s first loan with MFP. He knows that he has to make his payments on time, and he is prepared to do so. He is very respected by the other members in his communal bank. He will use the 1,000 PEN that he is asking for to fix his Pinball machines. They has stopped working from so much use.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his video game machines

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, tiene 35 años, vive con su pareja (Andrés) de 42 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Michael de 16, Yubitza de 13 y Didier de 2 añitos de edad. Todos ellos comparten sus días muy contentos en su casa propia.

Desde muy temprana edad ha trabajado en varios oficios ayudando a doña Clara, su madre, que fue quien le enseñó a ser empeñosa, ya que en su juventud también fue tan dinámica como Liliana, vendía comida y también era comerciante para generar ingresos extras al sueldo de su esposo, y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
En la actualidad Liliana tiene un negocio más estable, una bodega, a la cual se dedica toda la semana de 6 de la mañana a 9 de la noche, siendo un trabajo muy agotador, pues debe dividirse entre el trabajo de su hogar y el de su negocio, ya que teniendo hijos en edad escolar debe preparar los alimentos antes de mandarlos al colegio.
Pero a pesar de todo, Liliana se encuentra contenta, ya que puede dedicarse a ellos y también a su negocio, por lo cual piensa seguir haciéndolo crecer para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.  

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad productos para implementar su tienda, y en esta temporada comprará panetones (especie de bizcochos con pasas y frutas confitadas) típicos de las fiestas navideñas.
texts.en:
Liliana is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She is 35, and she lives with her 42 year old life partner (Andrés) and their three children. Michael is 16, Yubitza is 13, and Didier is 2. They all share their days very happily in their own house. From a very early age she has worked at various jobs helping her mother, Clara. Her mother is the one that taught her to be hard-working. In her youth, her mother was as dynamic as Liliana. She sold food and was also a business person in order to generate extra income to add to her husband’s salary. That way she improved the family’s quality of life. Liliana currently has a more stable business, a mini market. She works there the whole week from six in the morning until nine at night. As it is a very tiring job, she must divide herself between her chores at home and her business. Because she has school aged children, she must prepare their food before sending them to school. In spite of everything, Liliana is very happy. She can devote herself to them and also to her business. She plans to keep growing the business to improve her income. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual in all of her payments. She will use the money that she is now asking for to buy a larger quantity of products to put in her store. This season she will buy “panetones” (a type of biscuit with raisins and candied fruit), a typical item for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rza

texts.en: Rza Q. is 41 years old. He is married and has two sons. Rza has opted to make his living off the land and to work hard and grow with it. He has decided to raise cows and to dedicate himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for the last 10 years because he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background. He is now in charge of handing down all his background experience to his children. Today, Rza wishes to increase the number of his cattle. He would like to buy calves with the hope of increasing his income and, in turn, improving the well-being of his home. This is why he is requesting a loan of 1204 AZN. Extend your solidarity to Rza so that he can move forward successfully and accomplish all of his goals.

loans.use: To purchase three cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fifteen sheep and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cattle.

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en: lqar N. is 40 years old. He is married and has two adorable daughters. Ilqar has always opted to make his living off his land and to work hard and grow with it. He decided to rear sheep and to dedicate himself to farming. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time, as he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background. He has been working independently for 9 years. Today, Ilqar wishes to increase the number of his sheep. For this reason, he would like to buy more sheep with the hope of increasing his income and improving the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide for him. This is why he is requesting a loan of 1606 AZN. Extend your solidarity to Ilqar so that he can move forward to successfully and accomplish all of his goals.

loans.use: To purchase twenty sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Mais

texts.en: Mais N. is a 34-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and two sons in the Southern part of Azerbaijan, in Sabirabad. Mais raises cattle and sells them for meat product to the local traders. He has 11 years of experience in raising and selling cattle. Mais 's cattle are in very high demand in his village; however two calves is not enough to meet the demand. Mais is, therefore, applying for a loan of 1606 AZN to purchase additional cattle and fodder. Mais is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his standard of living through this loan.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Sahil

texts.en: Sahil S. raises animals and his cows are the most profitable. He is 34 years old and lives with his wife and one daughter. Sahil has been in this business for seven years. Early every morning, he goes to the various grazing fields near where he lives to feed his stock of cattle and sheep. He takes them to rivers, or nearby lagoons, so they can drink water and to the fields where they can graze. This activity takes all day. He returns home at sunset, tired from the constant daytime sun and the terrible cold during the afternoon. But he likes his work. Sahil knows he must feed and care for his animals very well. He would like to invest in the purchase of cattle. He would like to increase the stock of cattle that he takes to the market to sell. Sahil is counting on your help. With your support, he can improve his family's life.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and ten sheep.

loans.name: Qudrat

texts.en:
Qudrat Q. is 57 years old, married and has two sons. Qudrat works in agriculture and has always been efficient in his labors. He has grown seasonal fruits for more than twenty years. Qudrat dreams that all of his children will be well educated and have a bright future – that is why he works from early morning till late at night.

Qudrat wants to borrow 1606 AZN to buy fertilizer and necessary supplies to preserve his products because he wants to sell them later when the price for them increases. This loan request is to make Qudrat's dream come true, and he is asking for help from your generous heart.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and supplies for saving his products

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz A. is 52 years old. He is married and has three children. Aziz sells different kinds of detergents like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, shaving cream, washing powder and different food goods in his own store. Aziz is not alone in this business, his wife actively helps him with sales.

Aziz requests a loan of 1606 AZN to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and to push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Aziz 's main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday his son will become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To increase the number of products he sells.

loans.name: Rakhman

texts.en: Rakhman H. is a 41-year-old married man who raises sheep. He is a hardworking man who has fought to provide for his family and to educate his three children. Rakhman has been running a business raising and selling sheep. He has 20 years of experience in this field. Since sheep raising and selling is a profitable business, Rakhman has become a very successful businessman in a very short period. He works very hard and spends all of his time with his animals, cleaning them, feeding them, and pasturing them. Now, Rakhman wants to expand his business and to buy more sheep. He has applied for a loan of 1606 AZN. Rakhman thanks all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase fifteen sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase special materials for saving his products.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet E.'s main source of income comes from selling herbal food supplements in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Bagontaas, Valencia City. Juliet has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leilita

texts.en:
Leilita E. is from the village of Colonia in Valencia City. She is 37 years old. Leilita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Leilita sells snacks and other delicacies, such as fruit salad, banana cake, and cassava cake in the local community. Leilita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Leilita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leilita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that she will use to purchase the raw ingredients that she needs to make products to sell. This will be Leilita's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia acaba de cumplir 33 años, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, con los que vive en una habitación alquilada.

Por más de 12 años se dedica al tejido de tapices y mantas con lanas de carnero en su telar pequeño, especialmente fabricado para ella. De tener muchos pedidos, Delia y su esposo, inician sus labores a las 2 de la mañana, cada quien en sus respectivos telares, al compas y la melodía de huaynos serranos. Elaborar tapices es muy placentero para Delia, ya que no le causa ninguna dificultad, sólo que trabajar de madrugad es muy frío, pero la responsabilidad de la entrega de los pedidos son su mayor motivación, por lo cual viene ganando fama de ser puntual en la entrega de sus tejidos. Por tal motivo, ella espera ser reconocida por los comerciantes de tejidos mayoristas, para de ese modo dinamizar su economía.

Es su noveno crédito con MFP, de lo que está muy agradecida, y a la vez, se siente muy comprometida con los pagos y las reuniones de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará para la compra de lanas, hilos y demás insumos textiles.
texts.en:
Delia just turned 33; she is married and has 5 children, with whom she lives in a rented room. For more than 12 years, she has worked as a weaver, creating tapestries and tablecloths from sheep's wool on a small loom which was specially made for her. Since she has many orders, Delia and her husband begin their work at 2 in the morning, each on a separate loom, to the melodic rhythm of the "huaynos" [traditional songs] of the highlands. Creating tapestries is very enjoyable for Delia, since the work comes easily to her; it is cold working early in the morning, but the responsibility to fill her orders is her main motivation, and accordingly she has gained a reputation for being punctual in delivering her weavings. For this reason, she hopes to be recognized by the wholesale textile merchants and thus to make her business more dynamic. This is her ninth loan with MFP, which she appreciates very much, and in turn, she feels highly committed to the payment schedule and the meetings of her communal bank. She will use the funds that she is currently requesting to purchase wool, thread and other supplies for her textiles.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing textile supplies

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora D. G. runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 49 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Mailag, Valencia City. Leonora has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie D. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has 2 grown children. She is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. Josie has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Josie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Josie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 50 años, está casada con el padre D. sus 4 hijos, D. los cuales 2 D. ellos viven en su casa.

DesD. muy joven ha tejido a telar mantas y frazadas, y últimamente se ha dedicado al tejido D. telas especiales para mochilas y bolsos, como el que nos muestra en la foto.
Para cada tejido trata D. armonizar los colores, D. acuerdo al gusto D. sus clientes, ya que gracias a su preferencia los tejidos jamás se quedan mucho tiempo con ella y eso la llena D. mucha alegría. 
Por el momento, está un poco triste porque sus pies le duelen debido al frio excesivo que absorbe mientras teje, ya que su pueblo está en una zona muy fría, pero igual trabaja arduamente con su esposo, pues se han propuesto tener el dinero para brindarles a sus hijos estudios profesionales.

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo (4 años) viene liderando su banco comunal como la presidenta D. la junta directiva. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. insumos para sus tejidos D. artesanías.
texts.en:
Elvira is 50 years old, and is married to the father of her four children, two of whom still live at home with her. Since she was very young she has used a loom to weave blankets and cloaks, and ultimately has found work weaving speciality fabrics for backpacks and purses, like those shown in the photo. For each fabric, she tries to harmonize the colors according to the tastes of her clients. However, thanks to her preferences it doesn't take much time for the fabrics to be sold and this makes her very happy. For the moment, she is a little sad because her feet hurt because of the excessive cold that they absorb while she weaves. Her town is in a zone that is very cold, but she works equally as hard as her husband, and they have therefore been able to put forward the money to be able to offer their children professional studies. This is her ninth loan with MFP, an affiliate of Kiva, and after all this time (4 years), she has come to lead her communal bank as the president of the board of directors. The money that she is requesting now will be invested in the purchase of supplies for her artisan weavings.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma tiene 44 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías tejidas en las galerías de un centro comercial ubicado al costado de la plaza central de su pueblo. Allí vende chalinas, gorras, escarpines, guantes y tapices de todos los tamaños y modelos, elaboradas por ella o compradas. Asimismo, cada quince días, viaja a la ciudad de Lima, llevando las prendas elaboradas por ella misma, y durante la siguiente quincena del mes viaja a otra ciudad llevando los tejidos de su esposo.
Por cada frazada o manta de pura lana de cordero le pagan aproximadamente 120 soles, y es así que con sus tejidos a telar ó a palitos, Enma quiere conseguir el dinero suficiente para comprar su terreno y construir su casa propia.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo (un año) demostró ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de la mercadería de su negocio.
texts.en:
Enma is 44 years old and lives in her parents' house with her partner and father of her two children. She sells textile handicrafts in the galleries of a commercial center located in the central plaza of her town. She sells scarves, hats, shoes, gloves, and tapestries of all styles and sizes; some made by her and some that she has purchased. On the fifteenth of each month she travels to the city of Lima, bringing garments she has made. During the next fortnight of the month she travels to another city with textiles made by her husband. Each blanket made from pure lamb wool sells for approximately 120 soles. Enma would like to save enough money to purchase land and build her own house. This is her third loan with MFP and during this time (1 year) she has been very punctual with her payments. She will use the money from the loan to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou A.'s main source of income comes from selling food and daily use products in a sari-sari (variety) retail shop in her community. She is 51 years old, married and has two adult children. They are from the village of Mailag, Valencia City. Marilou has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 54 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, D. los cuales, 2 D. ellos viven en su casa. Con mucha destreza y habilidad en sus manos, Gladys elabora mantas, frazadas D. lanas y hermosas mantas con matices muy atractivos y D. colores joviales. Realizar este trabajo no le causa dificultad, puesto que lo aprendió D. pequeña; aparentemente no le presta atención a lo que hace, pues mientras va conversando sus manos van trabajando. 
Gladys prefiere tejer desD. las 3 hasta la 5 D. la mañana, y el resto del día lo dedica a las labores domesticas; y por las tardes cose las mochilas D. artesanía con las telas D. bonitos colores.
Posteriormente, cada domingo tiene que entregar los pedidos en la ciudad, mientras que su esposo es quien lleva las frazadas a otra ciudad aledaña. D. este modo es la vida D. una artesana como Gladys.  

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, durante el tiempo D. permanencia en su banco comunal ha demostrado compromiso y puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo va invertir en la compra D. lana D. cordero y otras lanas sintéticas para matizar sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 54 years old, married, and has 3 children of whom 2 still live at home. With great skill and manual dexterity, Gladys makes brightly colored blankets and shawls. She does not find the work difficult since she learned this skill at a young age. Gladys can have a conversation without paying attention to what she is doing because her hands automatically do all the work. She likes to weave between 3-5am so that she can devote the rest of the day to her household chores. In the evenings, she makes satchels in beautiful colors. Subsequently, she travels to the city every Sunday to deliver her orders. Meanwhile her husband travels to another nearby city to deliver blankets. For Gladys, this is the life of an artisan.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. As a member of her Communal Bank, she has demonstrated commitment and punctuality with her payments. Gladys will use the money she requested to buy natural and synthetic wool for producing various items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 45 años, está casada y es madre de 5 hijos con los que vive en su casa.

Desde muy joven se dedica al tejido; tanto a palitos, como con aguja de crochet. Anteriormente, una vez que tenía varias prendas elaboradas las vendía a los mayoristas, pero ellos no le pagaban el precio real. Por esa razón buscaba tener un puesto en un centro comercial de artesanías muy conocido en la ciudad, pero no lo pudo conseguir.
Sin embargo, su perseverancia la llevó a encontrar una tienda frente al parque principal de su pueblo; desde entonces, hace 2 años, vende todos sus tejidos en su tienda, lo cual le resulta muy rentable, ya que puede cubrir el alquiler del local y otros gastos de su hogar. 
Adicionalmente, Hilda tiene unas tierras donde siembra avena (foto), la cual guarda para venderla posteriormente en tiempos de sequía. De ese modo Hilda alterna sus actividades, buscando el bienestar de su familia.

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, donde todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en el incremento de materiales para elaborar sus tejidos, así como en semillas de avena.
texts.en:
Hilda is a very hardworking woman. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children who live with her at home.

Since she was a young woman, Hilda has been making hand-woven fabrics. Previously she tried selling her handmade clothing to wholesale vendors, but they refused to pay her a good price. For this reason, she tried to secure a vending post at a well-known craft market in the city but was unable. However, her perseverance led her to find a shop across from the main city park. Hilda has been selling her products from that location for the past two years. Her business has proven to be very profitable, since she is able to cover her shop rent and her household expenses.

In addition, Hilda has farmland in which she grows oats (as seen in the photograph). She stores whatever she harvests so that she can sell in times of drought. Hilda successfully divides her time between both businesses in order to provide for her family’s welfare.

This is Hilda’s ninth loan with MFP. As a client, she has always made her payments on time. The money she is requesting will be used to buy materials for making her hand-woven products. She will also purchase seeds for her next crop of oats.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for weaving & seeds for her oat crop

loans.name: Jhanet

texts.es:
Jhanet tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos.Sus años de infancia están marcado por los telares y los tejidos; pero desde que formó su propia familia, apoyada por su esposo, se dedica al negocio de la venta de comestibles de primera necesidad, en su casa implementó un espacio muy acogedor para que será su bodega.
Todos los días, a las 5 de la mañana, acude a la panadería para comprar los panes calientes al gusto de sus clientes, pues a las 6 ya se le encuentra laboriosamente limpiando y atendiendo  su negocio. De ese modo tiene muy contentos a sus clientes, a los que aprecia mucho, pues comprendió tempranamente  que “son la razón de su negocio”,  por ello, se esmera en atenderles bien, ya que gracias a ellos, capta el dinero para su casa.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde le agrade mucho trabajar en la modalidad del banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería para su bodega.
texts.en:
Jhanet is 29 years and lives with her partner, who is the father of their 3 children. She learned how to weave as a child. Now that she has her own family and is supported by her husband, Jhanet sells basic food necessities out of a cramped space inside of her house.

Every morning at 5am, she goes to the bakery to purchase warm bread that her customers enjoy. By 6am she is feverishly cleaning her store and preparing it to open for business. This delights her customers, who appreciate her efforts. Jhanet learned early on that her customers are the reason for her business. Therefore she tries to keep them happy because they allow her to earn household income.

This is Jhanet’s second loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her Communal Bank. They money she is requesting will be used to purchase more merchandise for her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 36 años, madre de 2 adolescentes. Actualmente viven en casa ajena que le dejaron a su cuidado.

Desde las 3 de la madrugada hasta las 6 de la mañana María se dedica a tejer tapices de diversos tamaños y colores, plasmando paisajes hermosos en ellos, los cuales son la atracción de todo turista. A partir de las 8 de la mañana atiende su negocio de venta de lanas sintéticas, el cual tiene desde hace 3 años en la casa donde vive. En su tienda, María aprovecha en exhibir  sus tapices, ya que no falta algún visitante que se los compra. 
Adicionalmente, trabaja como peón para algunos agricultores (en la foto aparece con su herramienta de trabajo) donde le pagan 19 soles el día, y esas ganancias las invierte en el incremento de la mercadería de su negocio.
Su deseo es contar con el dinero suficiente para comprar su propio terreno donde construya su casa.

Desde las 3 de la madrugada hasta las 6 de la mañana María se dedica a tejer tapices de diversos tamaños y colores, plasmando paisajes hermosos en ellos, los cuales son la atracción de todo turista. A partir de las 8 de la mañana atiende su negocio de venta de lanas sintéticas, el cual tiene desde hace 3 años en la casa donde vive. En su tienda, María aprovecha en exhibir  sus tapices, ya que no falta algún visitante que se los compra. 
Adicionalmente, trabaja como peón para algunos agricultores donde le pagan 19 soles el día, y esas ganancias las invierte en el incremento de la mercadería de su negocio.
Su deseo es contar con el dinero suficiente para comprar su propio terreno donde construya su casa.

Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, institución a la que le tiene mucho aprecio por la confianza en su trabajo y los créditos reiterados, menciona. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de más lanas sintéticas para su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a 36 year old woman with two adolescent children. They currently live in someone else’s house that was left in her care. From three in the morning until six in the morning María weaves different sizes and different colored tapestries. She captures beautiful scenery in her tapestries, which attract all the tourists. Starting at eight in the morning she tends her business of selling synthetic wool. She has been doing this in the house where she lives for three years. María takes advantage of the opportunity to display her tapestries in her store. Now she does not lack visitors who buy them. Additionally, she works as a hired worker on some farms (she appears in the photo with her work tool), where they pay 19 PEN a day. She invests these earnings to increase the merchandise in her business. Her wish is to have enough money to buy her own land where she could build a house. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She is very grateful to the institution for having confidence in her work and for the repeated loans. The money she is now asking for is to buy more synthetic wool for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy synthetic wool

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 37 años, está casada y es madre de 3 hijos. Actualmente, toda su familia vive en la casa de su madre.

Desde pequeña apoyó a sus padres en el hilado de tramas de diversos grosores para los tejidos que su padre realizaba. Ahora Maribel es quien teje las mantas, frazadas, tapices y demás pedidos que le hacen. 
Realizar este trabajo le es muy placentero, solo que a veces tiene dificultades por falta de material, por ello a veces espera con la trama armada en su telar por varios días, como nos muestra en la foto; perdiendo así muchos clientes, pues la combinación de colores es muy importante en los tejidos, por más sencillos que sean. 
Las ganas de trabajar sobran en Maribel, solo que necesitan un poco de apoyo económico.

Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, donde está muy agradecida por la confianza que le brinda su banco comunal y por lo que se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará hilos de diversos colores para poder elaborar sus tejidos.
texts.en:
Maribel, 37, is married and has three children. Currently, all of her family lives in her mother’s house. Since she was little she helped her parents spin the threads of different thicknesses for the weavings her father made.
