Now Maribel is the one who weaves the shawls, blankets, tapestries, and other orders she receives. Doing this work is very pleasant. Only sometimes does she have difficulties because of the lack of material. At times she waits for days ready with her loom, as can be seen in the photos. She looses a lot of customers this way. The combination of basic colors is very important in the weavings. Maribel has more than enough desire to work. She only needs a little bit of economic help. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the confidence her communal bank gives her. She promises to be very punctual with her payments. She will use the money she is asking for to buy different colors of thread to be able to make her weavings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material for her weaving

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 36 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, con los que vive felizmente en su casa. Con mucha imaginación y creatividad se dedica al pintado de pequeños cuadros, los cuales envía a sus compradores de la ciudad de Lima. A la semana llega a elaborar entre 24 a 25 pinturas, pero en caso de ser cuadros más grandes, como de 1m por 90 cm se demora una semana en cada uno. Estas pinturas sólo las hace a pedido y las vende hasta en 60 dólares, por el tamaño y el trabajo. 
En el caso de no tener pedidos, apoya a su esposo en su telar para el tejido de mantas y frazadas, para que posteriormente ella las venda en los diversos mercados de su localidad. 
Para Miriam, el arte es muy hermoso, pues haciendo su trabajo pierde la noción del tiempo, pero lo malo es que hay temporadas, donde no hay mucha demanda de sus pinturas.

Miriam es la eficiente secretaria de su banco comunal y este es su noveno crédito con MFP, donde la han reelegido para el cargo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo planea invertir en la compra de pinturas y oleo para dar rienda suelta a su arte. Asimismo, comprará lanas y madejas para los tejidos que realiza su esposo.
texts.en:
Miriam, 36, is married and has two children with whom she lives happily in her house. With much imagination and creativity she devotes herself to painting small pictures. She sends them to her buyers in the city of Lima. She makes between 24 and 25 paintings a week. But, when the pictures are much larger, 1 meter by 90 cm, it takes her a week for each one. She only makes these paintings by order. She sells them for up to $60, depending on size and the amount of work. When she does not have orders, she helps her husband weave shawls and blankets on his loom. Later she sells them at the various markets in her area. To Miriam, art is very beautiful. She loses the notion of time when she is working. The bad part is that there are times when she does not have much demand for her paintings. Miriam is the efficient secretary in her communal bank. This is her ninth loan with MFP, where she has been reelected for this duty. The money she is now asking for is to buy paints and oils to let her art have free reign. She will also buy wool and skeins for the weavings her husband makes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material for her paintings and weavings

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora tiene 44 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos con los que vive en su casa. Desde hace 7 años viene dedicándose a la venta de artesanías en su puesto alquilado, en un centro comercial llamado “La casa del artesano”, situado en la plaza de armas de su ciudad.
Nora vende tapices, gorras, chompas, guantes y chalinas de lana de cordero, y a partir de las 9 de la mañana se le encuentra conversando con sus vecinas de venta o clientes y la vez  tejiendo a palitos las prendas, de las cuales muchos de sus clientes se enamoran.  
A veces, algunas personas optan por solicitarle que les elabore el modelo y el color de su preferencia y este servicio tiene un mayor costo. De este modo Nora gana el propio dinero con el que atiende su hogar. 
Sus planes a futuro son que sus hijos sean profesionales, y para lograrlo piensa seguir trabajando arduamente.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, a la cual le tienen mucho aprecio, porque le permite seguir trabajando. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de lanas por kilos en la ciudad, ya que en su pueblo tiene un precio muy elevado.
texts.en:
Nora, 44, is married and lives with her two children in her house. For seven years she has been selling handicrafts. She sells from a rented place in the La Casa del Artesano, a commercial center located in the Plaza de Armas in her city. Nora sells tapestries, hats, sweaters, gloves and scarves made from lambs’ wool. From nine in the morning on you can find her talking with her neighboring sales people or customers while she knits the items. Many of her customers fall in love with her work. Sometimes people ask her to make a certain type and color that they prefer. This service is more expensive. This way Nora earns her own money to take care of her home. Her future plan is for her children to become professionals. In order to do so, she plans to keep working arduously. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is very grateful because it allows her to keep working. The money she is now asking for is to buy kilos of wool in the city. In her town the price is very high.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Sivutha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sivutha S. lives in Preak Ta En village in Kandal province. She is a teacher in the local school. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are sellers while another is attending the local school and the others are too young to work or study.

Mrs. Sivutha S.’s husband, Mr. Cheng Mao, is a fisherman and he is also a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. He is on the right in the photo.

For his plantation, Mr. Cheng Mao needs some money to buy rice seed, pesticides, and to pay for plowing the rice field. Thus, Mrs. Sivutha S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pesticides for her husband's rice field and to pay for plowing it

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhon P. lives in Boeng village in Takeo province. She is 55 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are farmers.

Mrs. Sokhon P. and her husband, Mr. Den Sa Em, are farmers who own a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) field of land on which they cultivate rice. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support their family’s living expenses. Thus, Mrs. Sokhon P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she would use the rest of money to buy fertilizers to support the rice field.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and fertilizers for the rice field

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat A. lives in Spha village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ton Vantha, are farmers who own a piece of land that they use to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, they have a problem because their field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Sophat A. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a machine to pump water to support their rice field.

Aside from the plantation, Mrs. Sophat A.’s husband is also a construction worker. This couple has three children, one of whom is attending the local school and the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a machine to irrigate their rice field

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sina N. lives in Roung village in Takeo province. She is 44 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a farmer and the other is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Banh Tha, owns a rice mill which is hired by villagers.

Mrs. Sina N. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed, pesticides, and fertilizers to support her rice production. Therefore, she has decided to request a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, pesticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en: Maricris A. is from the village of Bagontaas, Valencia City. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Maricris owns and operates a specialized retail business selling herbal food supplements in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Maricris joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy P. is a villager in Chhrey village in Takeo province. She is 45 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, two of whom are construction workers, and two of whom are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

Savy P. and her husband, Mr. P. Phon, are pig middlemen. Since their business is going well, they want to expand it by purchasing ten more pigs to support their business. They hope to increase their income and improve their family's standard of living with this loan.

loans.use: To buy ten more pigs to support their business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pey

texts.en:
Mrs. Pey A. lives in Chhrey village in Takeo province. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children of whom three are enrolled in the local school and the other is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Pey A. is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation she raises pigs. Since her pig-raising business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing four more piglets. She would use the rest of money to buy a cow for breeding.

Mrs. Pey A. hopes to increase her income and improve the family’s living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Um Rim, is a construction worker and is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy four more piglets and to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey L. lives in Krang Thlang village in Takeo province. She is a 46-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a construction worker while another is a monk and the remaining child is attending the local school.

Srey L. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In addition to her work on the plantation, she is a weaver. Now Mrs. Srey L. is requesting a loan to add to her savings so that she can buy a motorbike for her eldest child to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her eldest child to drive to work

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny K. lives in Kampong Chhrey village in Takeo province. She is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Chhou Nat, is a farmer who owns a plot of land he uses to cultivate rice. He is on the right in the photo.

Mrs. Vanny K. is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fresh fruit to resell to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fruit to resell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55 years old but still very focused and hardworking in her business. She is married to Lorenzo, 56 years old, who works as a farmer in their village. They are blessed with nine children: six of them are married while the others are still studying in a public school in their village.

Myrna has a strong determination to succeed in life. She is now managing her village store business as her way of supporting her husband in meeting the needs of their family while her husband is managing their rice fields. She came up with this kind of business because their income from their farm is seasonal. Together they are helping one another for the welfare of their family.

For the continuous improvement of her business, Myrna is now requesting to borrow PHP 8,000. She plans to use the loan to purchase more grocery items for her store to earn a bigger income. She is hoping that the lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom C. lives in Roung village in Takeo province. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

Mom C. is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Art Reth, is a farmer who earns a living by cultivating rice on his plot of land. He faces a difficulty because he does not have enough money to expand his rice production. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Mom C. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides, and hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn A. is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Evelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting "saging" (bananas) for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to use for daily needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok U. lives in Trapaing Sdouk village in Takeo province. She is 34 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school and the youngest is too yoU. to work or study She is a weaver.

Her husband, Mr. Suon Chea, on the right in the photo, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from working this plantation, he is a construction worker.

Although this couple tries to work hard they still earn little income to support their family.

Now Mrs. Sok U. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and to add another cow for plowing the rice field.

loans.use: To buy one cow to breed and another to plow the rice field.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, 38, manages a variety store which is situated in her house. Though she is busy managing her business, she is very proud because her family has a harmonious relationship. She is happily married to Bernardo and they are blessed with two loving children. Jun-Jun, 18, is a college student and Jay Mark, 15, is a fourth-year high school student.

Wanting to support the education of her children, Juliana wants to make her variety store more productive; thus, she is requesting a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders for the expansion of her business. If the loan will be granted, she will purchase more merchandise such as soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chok

texts.en:
Mrs. Chok C. is a villager in Trapaing Sdok village in Takeo province. She is 50 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a seller while the others attend the local school. She is a snack seller.

Her husband, Mr. C. Han, on the right in the photo, is a farmer who owns 1.2-hectar field of land to cultivate rice.

Although this couple tries to work hard they still earn little income to provide a better living for their family.

Thus, Mrs. Chok C. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her family

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
To earn an income to provide for her family's needs, Evelyn H. started selling fish in her village. She buys her products at the Solano Public Market. Being an industrious businesswoman, she is able to earn 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month which she uses for their daily needs as well as to finance the education of her children. Evelyn shared that, being a widow, she needs to be even stronger and more determined to overcome all the challenges that she may encounter.

Evelyn wants to sell more products but she has inadequate capital; therefore, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders for business progress. She knows that there are people who are kindhearted and willing to help the needy.

loans.use: Additional capital for buying and selling fish

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda T. is from the village of Biray Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old. Rosenda is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Rosenda harvests vegetables for sale in the local community. Rosenda has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Rosenda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and save for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Rorn N. is 43 years old and she lives in Russey Srok village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectar field of land to cultivate rice.

Her husband, Mr. Un Doeun, on the right in the photo, is a construction worker.

Mrs. Rorn N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and plowing on the rice field.

The couple has 5 children -- one is employed and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow to breed and to plow the rice field.

loans.name: Heherson

texts.en:
According to his neighbors, Heherson G. is a responsible father of three kids and a loving husband to his wife. Their family lives in the small village of Del Corpuz Cabatuan, Isabela which is one kilometer away from the national highway. 


Heherson has been a tricycle operator for almost a year now.  He usually earns PHP300 a day, which he uses for their daily needs and for the education of his children. Aside from that, his wife is engaged in the beauty service. Wanting to earn more income, Heherson decided to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders of PHP4,000 for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle. He hopes that lenders will grant his requested loan.

loans.use: To repair and maintain his motorcycle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry L. is a villager in Roung village in Takeo province. She is 52 years old and the mother of 4 children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school

Mrs. Ry L. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.

She faces an obstacle with her plantation because she does not have enough money to buy a water machine, fertilizers, or pesticides to support her productivity.

Her husband, Mr. Chhil Ren, is a laborer who is hired by the villagers to work on their rice fields.

loans.use: To buy a water machine, fertilizers, and pesticides to support her productivity.

loans.name: Creselda

texts.en:
Creselda R. is from the village of Lucsoon Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Creselda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Creselda raises pigs for sale. Creselda has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Creselda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Creselda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Creselda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Creselda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra H. lives in Russey Srouk village in Takeo province. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children who attend the local school. She is a Khmer cake seller.

Her husband, Mr. Chey Kakada, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a pig breeder. Since his pig breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it.

In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Ra H. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase three more piglets and a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family’s living with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
“Do your best to succeed” is a word of encouragement shared by Mrs. Jona J., a loving wife of Mr. Edgar J. Sr. They live happily with their three children at Brgy. Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. Being a parent, they have a great ambition for their children; they want them to become successful someday so that they will be the ones to help them when they get older. Despite the hardships and difficulties in life, they are striving hard to earn a living and support the children's education.

Due to lack of job opportunities, they help each other cultivate their farm lots by planting rice, vegetables and fruit. Furthermore, Mrs. Jona sells groceries, fruits and vegetables in their village. Since she has a small amount of capital, she can only acquire a few items and can only earn a small income. Due to high cost of commodities and school expenditures, she needs to earn more income to meet their daily needs. Hence, she wants to borrow PHP5,000 additional capital from KIVA lenders to acquire additional items for her business.  She hopes that with this financial assistance, she can improve her business and increase her income to support the schooling of their children.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Rozel

texts.en:
“If you have patience, you will survive” is an inspiring quotation shared by Rozel from the village of Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Anthony and they are blessed with two children. As parents, they want their children to finish their college education and find a good job someday. They endure hardships and difficulties to earn income and provide for the needs of their children and family.  

As a way of gaining income, her husband cultivates their farm twice a year by planting rice and vegetables. Aside from that, they also buy and sell animals like carabaos, cows, goats, pigs and others. They want to continue this business since it is beneficial to them but they need business capital.  Therefore, they decided to seek financial assistance from the KIVA lenders with a loan of PHP9,000.00.  This amount will help them buy additional animals that they can sell later on.  They hope that with this financial assistance, they can improve their business.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun K. is a fish seller in the local market. She is 37 years old and the mother of three children: one is into sales while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Mel Krounh, is a cow middleman. They live in Russey Srouk village in Takeo province. Since the cattle business is doing well, they want to expand it. In order to improve this business, Mrs. Yun K. decided to request a loan to buy two more cows. She hopes to increase their income and provide a better life for her family. 
Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two more cows for her husband’s business

loans.name: Jeramy

texts.en: Jeramy is a hog raiser. She lives with her husband and three children namely: Joshua (seven years old, elementary pupil), Jonard (two years old), and Jose III (one year old). Jeramy is married to Jose Jr. who is busy cultivating their rice fields while Jeramy is busy with her hog raising business. Aside from raising hogs, she is also a manicurist. So far, she is working hard to earn more income for feed for her pigs. But due to the high cost of feed, she would like to borrow additional capital of 4,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed for her pigs. Some of it will also be used to buy materials needed for her pedicure and manicure business.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising and manicure businesses

loans.name: Enemecia

texts.en: Selling vegetables is the business of Enemecia A.. She is married to Pablito and they have three children, namely: Jomar (19 years old, high school graduate), Jayvin (16 years old, in high school), and Jordan (9 years old, elementary pupil). Enemecia is a very generous mother to her three children. Though she wasn’t able to send her children to tertiary level, somehow she managed to send them to secondary level of education. Enemecia would like to improve her business so that she can continue meeting the needs of her children, with financial assistance from Kiva lenders. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos for business development. She plans to buy more vegetables to sell so that her income will increase.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheap N. is 42 years old and lives in Russey Srouk village in the Takeo province. She is employed. Her husband, Mr. Phan Ly, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to better support their family. 

Mrs. Pheap N. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has five children who are attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a tricycle (motorcycle taxi) driver within the village of Sto. Niño,  San Agustin. He is married to Lailanie and they are blessed with four children namely: Glocel, a 17-year-old college undergraduate; Cricon Bryan, a 16-year-old who college student; Napol, a 14-year-old high school student; and Waren Keith, an 11-year-old elementary pupil.

Ernesto would like his children to finish their schooling, thus he strives hard for to earn a bigger income. He wants a Kiva-funded loan to amounting to Php4,000 in order to purchase new sprocket for his passenger motorcycle.  Ernesto says his guiding principles include “being humble and industrious.”

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira has eight children with her husband Eduardo.  Three of her children attend college, two are in high school, and the other three are elementary school students.   It is not easy to satisfy their needs, especially when all of them are in school and taking their studies.  However, Elvira does not take this as a hindrance and complies with the duties and responsibilities of her family. She takes it as a challenge as to how best handle and improve her family's living conditions.
 
Elvira and her husband work hard to be able to continue sending their children in school. In addition, two of her children work to help support the family.  Elvira runs a small general store, and she and her husband also makes improvised stoves and sell them in their village.

She wants to continue her business while her children are taking their studies. She plans to use this loan of Php 15,000 as additional capital to help maintain her businesses. She has high hopes of achieving her dreams for the future of her children.

loans.use: Working capital for a general store and stove construction business.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothea O. lives in Trapaing Dang Toek village in Takeo province. She is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school.

Her husband, Mr. Muy Nun, on the right in the photo, is a rice miller and he uses the rice to make wine to sell.

Mrs. Sothea O. is a farmer who owns 2-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. She is also a pig breeder. Since her pig breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing seven piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.use: To buy seven piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Yoem Bit Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoem B. is group leader for a group of four members who all live in Boeng Satong village in Takeo province.

She and her husband, Mr. Sou Sorn, are farmers who own a four-hectar field of land to cultivate rice to earn their living. This couple has 5 children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

Although this family tries to work hard, they still earn little income to support their living.

Thus, Mrs. Yoem B. has decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Vending rice and at the same time operating a tricycle are the main sources of income for Editha and her family. Editha would like to develop her business to generate better income. She is able to generate a good income from her passenger tricycle and her rice businesses, but she still needs more capital to maintain her businesses.

Editha says that through her sacrifices and patience in her business, she is able to support her one child, who is named is Jam Matiecon and is four years old. She wanted to apply for a loan from Kiva lenders in order to develop and maintain the businesses that she manages. Editha is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 PHP and she is hoping that it will be granted.

loans.use: Additional capital to develop and maintain her business

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Un E. is a villager in Krang Ta Yang village in Takeo province. She is 45 years old and a widow with 4 children, two of whom are construction workers while the others attend the local school.

Mrs. Un E. is a grocer and now she wants to expand.

Thus she has decided to request a loan to buy more grocery products to resell to earn more profits.

She hopes to improve her business and provide a better living for her children.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Ching

texts.en:
Ching M. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 65 years old. Ching is married. To make a living, Ching operates a specialized "sari-sari" retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Ching has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ching joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ching has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Ching is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ching from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthou P. is a farmer in Chan Teb village in Takeo province. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children. One child attends the local school and the youngest is too young to work or study

Her husband, Mr. Uch Chim, on the right in the photo, is a teacher in the local school.

Mrs. Chanthou P. owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a beautician who is hired by the people for make up for wedding ceremonies.

Now she is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics to support her business.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Meng Chou

texts.en:
Mrs. Meng Chou T. lives in Ank Svay Chek village in Takeo province. She is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a pig middleman who helps the father’s business while the others attend the local school.

Mrs. Meng Chou T. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sok Saroeun, on the right in the photo, is a pig middleman. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it.

Thus, Mrs. Meng Chou T. decided to ask for a loan to buy sixteen more piglets to resell to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy sixteen more piglets to resell.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mr. Sen S. lives in Ta Daul II village in Kandal province. He is 62 years old and a widower with a child, a rice miller who owns a rice mill which is hired by the villagers.

Mr. Sen S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a rice middleman.

Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to resell to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Gina

The main source of income for the business comes from selling Hypo in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena B. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Nena is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Nena operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as glasses and watches in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the eight member group. They all live in Prey Lieb village in Takeo province. 

She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a fish seller because of her husband, Mr. Loem Thun, who is a fisherman. Additionally, he is a laborer and earns a small salary.  Mrs. Phalla S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for the rice field which will make the crops more productive. 

She is 28 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is attending the local school and the other three are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her rice crops more productive.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Hog raising is the main source of income for Marilyn's family. She is married to Angelito, who is a farmer and a tricycle driver. They have two children: Cristine Joy, a five-year-old elementary pupil; and their youngest, Kim Saira, who is one year old. They are happily living in the beautiful environment of Sto. Tomas, Saguday, Quirino. Marilyn would like to improve their standard of living through her hog raising business. According to her, she is in need of additional funds amounting to 4,000 PHP for the maintenance of her pigs and for her to purchase feed supplies for her raised animals. With that loan, she believes that her business will become more progressive.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising business

texts.en:
Geogracias B., from the village of Coca St.SWP, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, is 53 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Geogracias owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from handicraft business and whose main income comes directly from selling his handmade work product and he is actively a band member of the church and actively serving the church. Engaged in the business for over a year and he earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

He is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional materials for the business. This will be his first loan from GDMPC, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
