loans.name: Kumushay's Group

texts.ru:
Акматалиева Кумушай – лидер данной группы. Ей сорок семь лет. Кумушай  вместе с семьёй живёт в г. Токмок. Муж Кумушай работает электриком. Вместе они вырастили троих дочерей. Старшей и средней дочерям по двадцать девять и двадцать шесть соответственно. Обе замужем. Младшая двадцатилетняя дочь живёт с родителями. Кумушай, как может, помогает мужу содержать семью. Еще, будучи молодой, родственники посоветовали ей заниматься животноводством. Ведь заниматься этим делом удобнее всего находясь дома. Выйдя замуж, Кумушай не пренебрегла этим советом, и потихоньку приобрела кое – какую живность. Теперь Кумушай содержит две коровы и двоих телят и продает молоко. Все эти годы Кумушай имела возможность зарабатывать существенные средства от продажи молока, а также постепенно увеличивала поголовье скота  и продавала по необходимости. Младшая дочь и муж после работы всегда помогают Кумушай ухаживать за скотом. Таким образом Кумушай не испытывает никаких трудностей в своём хозяйстве. Кумушай очень заботит будущее младшей дочери. Младшая дочь сейчас учится в университете. И надо оплачивать контракт за обучение. Одному мужу Кумушай было бы не по силам осилить и текущие расходы семьи и контракт одновременно. Поэтому Кумушай решила обратиться за кредитом. Но Кумушай не хочет брать кредит и сразу отдавать за обучение. Для начала, она хочет вложить кредитные средства на приобретение телёнка; откормить его, а затем продать. А с полученной прибыли оплатить контракт. Это позволит сэкономить значительную сумму денег. Кумушай в будущем хочет купить дом в этом же городе.

Партнёры Кумушай по группе:   Зууракан, Нурбек и Жылдыз.

Зууракан сорок четыре. Супруг работает таксистом. Сама же Зууракан домохозяйка и держит коров, продаёт молоко. У них четверо детей. Зууракан обратилась за кредитом с целью купить дойную корову. 

Нурбеку сорок три года. Жена Нурбека реализует продукты питания в магазине. Сам же Нурбек держит скот, продаёт молоко. У них четверо детей. Младшей дочери всего четыре годика. Нурбек надеется получить кредит и вложить деньги на приобретение телят. 

Жылдыз всего двадцать лет. Но она уже занимается большим делом. Рано выйдя замуж, Жылдыз разделила занятие мужа – фермерство. Сейчас она ежедневно доит восемнадцать коров и сдаёт 50л. Молока. Жылдыз надеется получить кредит и вложить деньги в перепродажу крупнорогатого скота.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Kumushay A. is a leader of this group. She is forty seven years old. Kumushay lives together with her family in the town of Tokmok. Kumushay's husband works as an electrician. Together they have raised three daughters. Their oldest and middle daughters are twenty nine and twenty six respectfully. They are both married. The youngest nineteen year old daughter lives with parents. Kumushay helps her husband to support the family the best she can. When she was still young, the relatives advised her to start doing animal husbandry. It's very convenient to run this business from home. When she got married Kumushay did not ignore this advice and had slowly bought some livestock. Right now Kumushay has two cows and two calves and sells the milk. All these years Kumushay had the opportunity to have a good income from milk sales and had also gradually increased the head count of cattle and sold it as was needed. Her youngest daughter and husband also help Kumushay to take care of the cattle after work. This is why Kumushay does not have any difficulties with her business. Kumushay is very worried about her youngest daughter's future. She is now studying at the university. She needs to pay the tuition fees. Kumushay and her husband alone cannot afford to pay the tuition and family's expenses at the same time. This is why Kumushay has decided to apply for a loan. But she does not want to take the loan and spend it all on the tuition. For the start, she wants to invest the loan money to buy a calf; after feeding it she will sell it and use the income to pay the tuition fees. This will allow her to save a great deal of money. Kumushay wants to buy a house in the same town in the future. Kumushay's group partners are: Zuurakan, Nurbek and Jyldyz. Zuurakan is forty four. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Zuurakan is a housewife, she keeps cows and sells milk. They have four children. Zuurakan has come for a loan to buy a milk cow. Nurbek is forty three years old. Nurbek's wife sells food in the store. Nurbek himself keeps cattle and sells milk. They have four children. The youngest daughter is only four years old. Nurbek hopes to receive the loan and invest the money to buy calves. Jyldyz is only twenty. But she is already running a big business. She has married early and took part in her husband's business – farming. At this time she milks eighteen cows daily and sells 50 litters of milk. Jyldyz hopes to receive the loan and invest the money in resale of large cattle. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and raise a calf and later sell it on the market in order to pay for daughter's university education

loans.name: Ermek's Group

texts.ru:
Ишимбекова Эрмек  - лидер данной группы. Эрмек шестдесят лет. Она вдова и мать троих детей. Эрмек и её покойный муж могут вполне могли бы гордиться воспитанием, которое они дали своим сыновьям. Все уже определились в жизни и усердно трудятся на своих поприщах. Старший сын уехал в Россию и стал военным. Ему тридцать шесть лет, женат. Среднему сыну тридцать один. Он также женат и работает в налоговой инспекции. Младшему сыну двадцать семь. Он ещё не женился, работает сварщиком. Эрмек живёт с младшим сыном и занимается домашним хозяйством.  Младший сын всегда ей помогает. Эрмек держит коров и реализует молоко. Эрмек никогда не занималась этим. Однако дети хорошо знали свою мать. Они осознавали, что когда Эрмек выйдет на пенсию, она будучи всю жизнь трудолюбивым человеком будет скучать дома. И пять лет назад, сыновья собрали средства и решили обрадовать мать, купив ей живности. Они и не думали, что Эрмек сможет не только обеспечивать себя продуктами питания, но даже сможет зарабатывать существенные деньги. Дети потратили шестьдесят тысяч сом (USD 1,400) на покупку коров. Теперь же Эрмек, продаёт молоко и зарабатывает 7,400 сомов (USD 170) в месяц. Это оказалось довольно прибыльным делом и у Эрмек появилось желание расширить свой так называемый бизнес. Эрмек обратилась за кредитом и намеревается вложить кредитные средства на закупку корма для скота на зимний период.  В скором времени Эрмек собирается женить младшего сына.

Партнёры Эрмек по группе: Вера, Валентина и Венера.

Вере шестьдесят один год. Вера также является вдовой. Она – мать троих детей. Дети живут отдельно. Старший и младший сыновья работают в России, средняя дочь в Бишкеке. Вера имеет своё хозяйство: корова, куры, индюки. Вере нужен кредит для покупки коровы.

Валентине шестьдесят два года, вдова. Единственный сын находится в России, работает водителем. Валентина на пенсии. Она получает пенсию в размере двух тысяч шести ста сомов. Валентина решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы вложить деньги на перекрытие крыши дома. 

Венере сорок восемь лет. Муж Венеры занимается сельским хозяйством. Венера давеча помогала мужу. Теперь вместе с ним собирается заняться перепродажей крупно – рогатого скота. Ей нужен кредит, чтобы купить двух бычков.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Ermek I. is the leader of this group. Mrs. I. is 60 years old. She is a widow and the mother of three children. Mrs. I. can be proud of the way she and her late husband raised their three sons. All three have chosen their paths in life and are working hard in their respective professions. Mrs. I.'s oldest son moved to Russia and became a soldier. He is 36 years old and is married. Her middle son is 31. He is also married and works in a tax office. Her youngest son is 27. He is single and works as a welder. Mrs. I. lives with her youngest son and takes care of the home and her livestock. Her son always helps her. Mrs. I. keeps dairy cows and sells their milk. She had not done this before, however, her children knew their mother well. As Mrs. I. has been a hardworking person her entire life, her children realized that when she retired, she would be restless just sitting at home. So, five years ago, her sons collected some money and decided to make their mother happy by buying her some cows. At that point, they hadn't imagined that Mrs. I. would be able to earn good money from the animals, in addition to providing food for herself. Her sons spent 60,000 soms (1400 USD) to purchase the cows. Now by selling the milk, Mrs. I. earns 7,400 soms (170 USD) a month. The venture has turned out to be quite profitable and Mrs. I. would now like to expand her small business. She has applied for a loan to purchase feed for the animals during the winter. Soon she is planning to marry off her youngest son. Mrs. I.'s partners in the group are Vera S., Valentina K., and Venera K.. Vera S. is 61 years old and is also a widow. She is the mother of three children. The children do not live with her. Her oldest and youngest children, both sons, work in Russia, and her middle child, a daughter, works in Bishkek. Mrs. S. keeps animals at home - a cow, chickens, and turkeys. She needs a loan to purchase another cow. Valentina K. is 62 and is also a widow. Her only son is in Russia working as a driver. Mrs. K. is retired. She gets a pension of 2600 soms per month. Mrs. K. decided to apply for a loan to repair the roof of her home. Venera K. is 48 years old. Her husband is a farmer. Recently, she has been helping him. Now they are planning to get into business reselling livestock. Mrs. K. needs a loan in order to purchase two calves. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animal feed for the winter period

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena O. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has three adult children. Nena owns and operates a business providing tricycle transport in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,500 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase an additional tricycle. Nena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used purchase an additional tricycle. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional tricycle again

loans.name: Guljan's Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group, Guljan, is forty-six years old. She has one child and her husband works as a security guard in the Chui electric power plant. He gave Guljan freedom of choice to choose between working and staying at home and Guljan chose to work. Her relatives advised her to engage in farming. Guljan managed to obtain a three-hectare (7.5-acre) piece of land and made a start by investing $50 in buying clover seeds. So, for ten years she has been growing clover. As many people have cattle and need to prepare forage for winter, Guljan quickly started making profits. Now, she trades in clover at the market. Guljan’s work has been a great asset to her family’s budget as, together with her husband, she has been able to buy a house in Tokmok city. Recently, Guljan harvested the clover and now needs some funds for fertilizing and working the land before winter comes. Therefore, she has applied for this loan as she does not have much time to collect a sufficient amount of money. Guljan’s partners are Gulzina, Dinara and Sabyrbek: Gulzina, 23, is married and her husband works at a tannery. Gulzina works on her land: she has one-hectare (2.5 acres) of land and grows hay. She has already harvested and stacked the hay and now is preparing to start selling it. Gulzina hopes to get this loan and invest it in working the land and fertilizing it. Dinara, 43, is divorced. She plans to get engaged in animal husbandry. Her colleagues have advised her to start this occupation as it brings good profits. Dinara has applied for this loan to purchase a calf. Now, she is planning to equip her house with the necessary facilities. Sabyrbek, 46, is a father of four children. His wife works at Kyrgyz Post as a logistics manager. Sabyrbek trades in cattle at “Murok” market and manages to earn $185 a month. Now, he needs to obtain this loan to invest it in purchasing cattle. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To fertilize and plough fallow land before winter comes

loans.name: Remely

texts.en:
Remely C. is from the village of Mayor's Village, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Remely owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Remely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Remely is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Mayor's Village Lapasan, Clarin Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
João Manhiça nasceu em Boane, Província de Maputo, tem 42 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 22, 18,12 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 7ª classe apenas, não foi possível continuar na altura devido a guerra. Vive numa casa própria, com a família e a sua mãe.

Saiu do bairro da Massaca (pertencente ao mesmo distrito) para a vila de Boane no tempo de Guerra. Actualmente trabalha como serralheiro mecânico condutor tarefas que aprendeu na escola de artes e ofícios na Moamba há 18 anos. Tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de 5.000.00mt e poupa algum no banco, depois de todas despesas de casa. 

Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições de crédito, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua irmã, que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 13.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, ferro e barrotes) para fazer a sua casa e uma oficina de trabalho.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo, para poder aceder a mais créditos e finalizar as suas obras.
texts.en:
João Manhiça was born in Boane, Maputo Province, in Mozambique. He is 42 years old, married and the father of four children aged 22, 18, 6 and 6, all of them students. He finished 7th grade but couldn't keep studying because of the war. He lives on his own house with his family and his mother. He works as a millwright and makes 5.000,00MT (U$170) and after covering his household expenses, he still saves some money. This is his first loan and his asking for 13.000,00MT (U$450) in order to buy construction supplies (cement, sand, iron, etc) to build his house and a workshop. He hopes to pay this loan without a problem.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Construction Supplies

loans.name: Florencia Antonio

texts.pt:
Florencia António Z. nasceu na Matola, Província de Maputo, tem 29 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos, de 10 e 3 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez 10ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições por parte dos progenitores. Vive numa casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu da cidade onde vive, é comerciante e dona de seu negocio há mais de 10 anos, trabalha sozinhas das 7h as 16h. Esta actividade aprendeu com a sua mãe que também faz a mesma ha longo tempo. Vende mais a loiça de cozinha, consegue um rendimento diário de cerca de 500mt a 1.000.00mt com os quais sustenta a família e poupa algum com as amigas através do sistema tradicional de poupança (Xitique).

Já teve empréstimos com uma organização internacional da Suiça (Helvetas) e a GGLS, outra instituição de crédito, todos foram para o comércio. Conheceu a Hluvuku através das amigas que a informaram a cerca da mudança de instituição da dona Isaura (oficial de credito da Hluvuku) e preferiu seguir a ela porque trabalharam juntos na antiga instituição.
Este é o seu 4º empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema e no valor de 10.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar mais produtos para o seu negócio (loiça de cozinha, e produtos de mercearia). Os empréstimos passados foram de 4.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro, pretende solicitar mais empréstimos, para a construção de sua residência e fortificar ainda mais o seu negócio
texts.en:
Florencia António Z. was born in Matola, Maputo Province, in Mozambique. She is 29 years old and a single mother of a 10 and a 3 years old, the older one goes to school. She finished 10th grade but couldn't keep studying because of her parent's financial situation. She lives in her own house with her children and does not support anyone else. She owns a business and she's been working on it for 10 years, every day by herself from 7AM to 4PM. She mostly sells kitchen utensils and makes between 500MT and 1.000,00MT a day (U$15 and U$35). With that money she supports her kids and tries to save some. She is asking for a 10.000,00MT loan (U$350) which she'll use to buy more inventory for her business (kitchen utensils and food products). She hopes to pay this loan without a problem so she can ask for another one in the future to finish building her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for reselling

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Even at 25 years old, Glenda M. wants to get her family out of the shadow of poverty. Her partner in doing this is her husband, Roy M., 30 years old.

In providing for the needs of their son, Rhodges Gavin, who is now one year old, her husband is now working as a welder. And to help her husband in providing for their family, Glenda runs two businesses: her variety store and the vending of foods to her neighbors. These activities contribute to the income that they use in sustaining their daily expenses. Glenda hopes that through the revenue from her businesses, she can save for the future needs of their son, especially for his schooling.

Glenda became a member of Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) in 2008 and every loan that she received was used in improving both of her businesses. Now, her 4th loan will be used as additional capital for her variety store. She will buy items that can sell, like sacks of rice, different soft drinks and different groceries. She is sure that after buying all of these, her business will gain more income for their family.

The dream of Glenda is that their child will finish his studies and also another child that they’ll be going to have, given God’s will. Another dream of Glenda’s is to have their own house because right now they are living in the house of her husband’s mother. That is why they’re really working hard to save for all of their dreams.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her variety store

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet A. is from the village of Silanga, Tangub City. She is 34 years old and is single. Juliet owns and operates a fish pond business, selling crabs and fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish and crabs to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish and crabs to sell

loans.name: Comodo Rogerio

texts.pt:
Cómodo N. nasceu em Inhassoro, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 56 anos de idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos de 18,16,14,12 e 4 anos de idade. Todos filhos vão a escola. Fez 9ª classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família no bairro da Matola Província de Maputo, sustenta apenas sua mãe.

Saiu de Inhassoro para Beira, na Província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique a procura de emprego, trabalhou 2 anos como servente de Balcão, mais tarde entrou no serviço militar obrigatório. Completo os 2 anos de vida militar, em 1975 ingressa e é no Ministério do Interior, como polícia de protecção. Aufere um salário mensal de 11.882.59mt e poupa 1.200.00mt por mes na sua conta bancária.

Nunca solicitou empréstimos em outras instituições de crédito, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes da instituição. Este é o 2º crédito no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. O empréstimo passado foi do mesmo valor e também para a mesma actividade.

Compromete se pagar este empréstimo devidamente, para poder aceder a mais créditos no futuro para concluir a sua obra, assim como erguer um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Cómodo N. is from Inhassoro, Inhambe Province, in the southern part of Mozambique. He is 56, married and the father of six children ages 18, 16, 14, 12 and 4. They all go to shcool. He finished 9th grade himself, but couldn't keep studying because of his parents financial difficulties. He lives at his own house with the rest of his family and supports all of them plus his mother. He is a policeman and makes 11.882,00MT (U$410) a month, and saves 1.200,00MT (U$45) every month on hois savings account. This is his second loan in the amount of 20.000,00MT (U$700) which he'll use to buy construction supplies (cement, rocks, iron and others) to finish his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies (cement, rock, sand and others)

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella H. is single. She is now 56 years old and still fighting against the poverty that has been her experience. She has no family but is still working hard for herself and also for others that need her help.

The main source of Estella’s income comes from her variety store that she has run for thirty-one years now. For that long a time she has done everything to make this business grow and continue to run because, aside from the fact that it gives her income to sustain to her daily expenses, it became her partner in entertaining herself through the people that she encounters while selling her items.

When Estella became a member of Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), aside from the capital that she gets from this institution, she also found her second family in the presence of other members. That is why she is enjoying being a part of it. Now, her 11th loan will be used as additional capital for her variety store business. She will buy different groceries and many other items that are needed by her store.

Estella says she is working hard, not only for herself to have a better life but also to help others in their needs. She is just hoping to have a long life so that she can do this.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her variety store

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam M. is 31 years old; she is 3 years older than her husband Joaquin M., who is now working as a welder. They have one daughter, Janna Marie, 5 years old. Aside from the revenue of her husband from being a welder, they also run a fishing business. They decided to start this kind of business because their house is near the sea, so it is very accessible for them. The business has been running for one year and a half and they work hard to make it so that it will run for long years ahead. Also Meriam manages a sewing business that contributes to their income.

When she joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), Meriam used her loan as capital to start the fishing business, but during typhoon Ondoy it was slightly damaged. So her 4th loan will be used again for this business, for its improvement. She will buy the things needed by her business such as various fishnets, accessories for the fishnets, fingerlings (small fish), and it will also be used for payment for a laborer. She is hoping that it will become more productive this time, and later on they can save so that she can buy her own sewing machine.

Meriam wants her child to finish her studies until college; that’s another reason why they want to save. And also she wants to build a new house because like their fishing business, their house was also destroyed by the typhoon.

loans.use: To finance their fishing business

loans.name: Osvaldo Luis

texts.pt:
Osvaldo Luís Gonhele nasceu na cidade da Matola, província de Maputo, tem 26 anos de idade, solteiro e não tem nenhum filho, estudou ate 12ªclasse e estando neste momento a preparar-se para concorrer a admissão no ensino superior. Vive na casa própria e sustenta dois irmãos mais novos que vivem com ele.

Nunca mudou da cidade, sempre viveu na cidade da Matola. É comerciante permanente a 06 anos, faz dez horas diárias e não tem nenhum empregado. Aprendeu a fazer o negócio em Boane com amigos há sete anos. Os seus melhores produtos são a cerveja, refrescos e vinhos, os preços dos mesmos variam consoante a qualidade. O rendimento varia de 8.000,00mt a 10.000,00mt com o qual sustenta a família e poupa algum.

Nunca trabalhou com nenhuma outra instituição de crédito e este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku, o primeiro empréstimo foi de 13.000,00mt também destinado para o negócio. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes da instituição.
Com o presente empréstimo de 20.000,00mt para compra e venda de refrigerantes e outros produtos com o objectivo de investir no negocio, satisfazer a demanda de produtos, neste período de Inverno e aumentar o rendimento.

Pretende continuar a pedir empréstimos na Hluvuku para melhorar a sua residência, por isso compromete-se pagar bem este empréstimo.
texts.en:
Osvaldo Luís Gonhele was born Matola, in the province of Maputo, Mozambique. He is 26 years old, single and has no children. He finished 12th grade and is getting to go to college. He lives in his own house and supports two younger brothers that live with him. He owns his business and has been working 10 hours a day for the past 6 years, with no other employees. His best selling products are beer, refreshments and wines. He makes between $280 and $350 per month, money that he uses to support himself and his brothers, and save. He is asking for $700 in order to invest in his business, and satisfy his customer's demands for new items now that the winter is coming up, improving his profit. He is committed to pay it back on time and in the future hopes to get another loan to make improvements to his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages for selling (soft drinks, beer and wine)

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D. is 35 years old, contented and happily married to a brave and responsible husband, Genaro D.. Genaro is same age as his wife, and in order to provide the needs of his wife and his children, Jolina Mae, 11 years old, and Julia Mariz, 9 years old, he works as a soldier. To help her husband in providing for their family,Julieta runs a fishing business. She decided to start this business because all the resources are since they live in an island village of Sapang in the Philippines, and also because she wants to save for the future of her children.

Both loans that she has received form Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) when she became a member has been used in improving this business. Now, her 3rd loan will be used in buying all the materials for making a fish cage, because their fish cage was damaged during Typhoon Ondoy. She will buy bamboo, fishnets and accessories for fishnets, different fingerlings (small fish) and also gasoline for the boat. She is hoping that with the help of this loan she can rebuild the fish cage that has been damaged and through its revenue they can add another fish cage for more income for them.

As a mother, her first priority in life is their children; she wants them to finish their studies until college. Through their hard work and with help from others like ASHI and Kiva lenders, Julieta knows she can do that.

loans.use: For buying all the materials needed in making a fish cage

loans.name: Eliza Gay

texts.en:
Eliza Gay D. lives in Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She finished secondary education but did not pursue her college studies yet since her two sisters are in college level and their parents cannot afford to finance them all. Therefore, she wants to work and earn so she can continue her studies later.

She is engaged in selling AVON, MSE, and Natasha cosmetics to their village; she offers these products to her friends, neighbors and to the people around their village. The average income she earns per month is Php 3,500 which she uses to acquire her daily needs and save for her future. She wants to sell more products but she has not got much capital. That's why she wants to borrow additional capital from KIVA lenders, amounting to P 5,000 to add to her capital for improving her small business. She believes that she will be able to sell more products and earn more income with the financial assistance of said organization.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Onn Ell Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who are all living in Troeuy Troeng village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Onn E. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members and they each will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Onn E. is a 41-year-old widow and now she is a Khmer cake seller. Since her business is going wE., she wants to expand it. Currently, she does not have enough money to buy more ingredients to make more cakes to sE. to earn more income to support her living conditions. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for making Khmer cakes

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta M. is from the village of Lapasan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Julieta is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a shoe repair business. The main source of income for the business comes from repairing shoes. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials. This will be the second loan taken out by Julieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials

loans.name: Candida Lourenco

texts.pt:
Cândido Lourenço C. nasceu em vilankulos, província de Inhambane, tem 35 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 06 filhos com 18, 15, 13, 10, 08 e 03 anos de idade, os dois primeiros e o ultimo não vão a escola. Fez 5ª classe, parou de estudar por falta de condições financeiras por parte da família. Vive na casa própria na Matola e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem dos filhos.

Saiu de Vilankulos em 1988 com seus pais para o distrito da Matola na província de Maputo para se refugiarem da guerra. Actualmente é comerciante e venda de roupas para mulheres e crianças desde 1999 fazendo 10 horas diárias. Não tem empregado, aprendeu a fazer o negócio com a mãe a mais de 12 anos atrás. O seu rendimento vária de 7.500,00 a 10.000,00mt com o qual consegue poupar algum para melhorar as condições da sua residência.

Nunca trabalhou com nenhuma outra instituição de crédito e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku. Conheceu a Hluvuku através da vizinha que também e cliente da instituição, tendo de seguida aproximado e solicita o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00mt para investir no seu negocio aumentando o volume da mercadoria para responder a procura que e crescente. 

Pretende continuar a pedir empréstimos na Hluvuku, por isso, compromete-se a pagar bem este empréstimo.
texts.en:
Cândido Lourenço was born in Vilankulos, Inhambane Province, in Mozambique. She is 35 years old, single and mother of six children ages 18, 15, 13, 10, 8 and 3, three of them go to school. She finished 5th grade but had to drop school due to her parent's financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her children and doesn't support anyone else besides them. She owns a clothing retail business, selling women's and children's clothes since 1999, and she works 10 hours a day. She learned the business from her mother 12 years ago and has no employees. Her income varies between $250 and $350 per month, and after covering her household expenses she's uses the rest of the money to improve her house. She's asking for a $525 loan in order to invest in her business, buying more inventory to respond to the increasing demand.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Clothing Items for Reselling

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 50 years old, and she is happily married to Alfredo C.. They are blessed with seven children; four of them are girls and three are boys. They live in a village located at Brgy. Murong, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Most of their children did not pursue their college studies due to financial constraints. Although they work hard to earn a living, their income is not enough to cover all their basic expenses.

Farming is the common source of their living; they cultivate their farm, planting rice and some vegetables. Due to financial difficulties, Trinidad engages in rice retailing to help her husband earn income. Since rice is the basic commodity needed in their village, she wants to acquire more of it but she has not got much capital. Trinidad wants to borrow the amount of P 9,000 to be used in acquiring more rice to sell in their village. She believes that she will be able to uplift their living conditions through this financial assistance.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retailing business

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin C. is a responsible father who lives in a village located at Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. His wife is Pacita C. and they are blessed with three children. They aim to uplift their living conditions to give their children a better future. They work hard and help each other to earn a living.

Franklin is a farmer. He tills their farm, planting rice and corn. After planting he uses his tricycle (local three-wheeled transport) to earn additional income while his wife is engaged in selling vegetables in their village. They earn an average income of P 6,000 a month which is used for their basic needs and to finance the schooling of their children.

Due to the high cost of commodities and school expenditures, they want to earn more income to meet their basic needs. Franklin is applying for a loan from KIVA amounting to P 5,000 to be used in the maintenance of his "tricycle" and for the maintenance of his crops. He believes that this will be a great help for the improvement of their standard of living.

loans.use: additional capital for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.pt:
Jeremias N., nasceu em Manjacaze, província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 32 anos de idade, casado e pai de 8 filhos de 11,10,8,7,5,5,1,1 anos de idade, destes 6 vão a escola. Fez somente 4ªclasse porque os pais não dispunham de meios financeiros para dar continuidade. Vive com a família, na casa própria em Mahelane, Distrito de Namaacha, fronteira com a Suazilândia e sustenta sua Mãe enviando algum valor monetário.

Saiu de Manjacaze para Namaacha no tempo da Guerra de destabilização com os seus pais. Iniciou a activdade comercial e de pesca para fazer face a situação difícil de vida que encarava com a família. Trabalha sozinho com a mulher, que tem ajudado quando o marido estiver ausente. Tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt a 5.000.00mt por mês e poupa algum através de sistema de poupança tradicional (Xitique).

Nunca solicitou empréstimos em outras instituições de crédito, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o 2º empréstimo com a Hluvuku, no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos de mercearia e refrigerantes (cerveja, refrescos, vinhos e outros). O empréstimo passado foi de 15.500.00mt para a mesma actividade.

O objectivo principal com o empréstimo, é de satisfazer o mercado e diversificar o produto no seu estabelecimento. Compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito para poder aceder a mais empréstimos no futuro para poder construir dependências de aluguer.
texts.en:
Jeremias N. was born in Manjacaze, Gaza province, south of Mozambique. He is 32 years old, married and the father of 8 children ages 11, 10, 8, 7, 5, 5, 1 and 1, six of them go to school. He finished 6th grade but had to drop school because of his parents financial difficulties. He lives with his family in their own house and supports his mother sending her money every month. He owns a store and with the help of his wife he makes between $130 and $170 per month. He is asking for U$525 in order to buy more food products and beverages (beer, wine and soft drinks) to seel at his store. He hopes to diversify his business and increase the sales by adding new products to his store. He plans on paying the loan on time so he can ask for another loan in the future in order to build properties to rent out.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages and food products for reselling

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy resides in the village of Culalabat, Cauayan City with her family. She is married to Jeffrey D., who works as a carpenter in their village, and the couple is blessed with three children: Jerica, two years old, and Cherry Mae, and Jeffrey Jr., both school-aged.

Mercy is engaged in a food retailing business. She has been selling rice cakes for almost a month now in their village. Every afternoon she sells her products. Her daily net income is Php 100, and she wants to access a loan amounting to Php 6,000 from Kiva lenders. She plans to use it to purchase rice cake ingredients and kitchen utensils for her business. According to her, it will be a great help in meeting their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and utensils for her food production business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. sees her children as her inspiration thus she really works hard for their welfare. Furthermore, her husband Mario motivates her to become successful in her business. Their family happily lives at the village of Culalabat, Cauayan City. Marites proudly shared that their family has a bounded and harmonious relationship.

With regard to her business, Marites has been engaged in hog raising for almost three years now. She sells her raised animals every four months and she earns a net income of Php 3,000. She plans to utilize the income for their basic needs as well as for the education of their children. Wanting to purchase feed for her pigs and fertilizer for their rice farm, Marites decided to take out a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to Php 6,000. Marites is very optimistic that lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: Hog feed and pig pen and to purchase some fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros L. is from Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. L. is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. The main source of income for the business comes from selling pigs. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Milagros joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used purchased additional feed for her pigs. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Milagros from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Mrs. Kimleng Kong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of seventeen people and they all live in Troeuy Troeng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kimleng K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Kimleng K. sells rice with food to earn an income. Her husband, Mr. Heng Vichet, is a pig breeder. Since his pig-breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it but he does not have enough money to support his business. Thus, Mrs. Kimleng K. decided to ask for a loan to buy some more piglets to raise. She hopes to increase their income and improve the famiL.’s standard of living with this loan.

Mrs. Kimleng K. is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for her husband to raise

loans.name: Olinda Benjamim

texts.pt:
Olinda Benjamim M. nasceu em Maputo, capital de Moçambique, tem 33 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 4 filhos de 13,10,04 anos e 1 de 5 meses de idade, destes 2 vão a escola. Fez 9ª classe, parou devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com a família, não sustenta ninguém para alem da empregada que vive com eles vindo da Província de Inhambane. 

Nunca mudou da cidade, nasceu, cresceu e ainda vive na cidade de Maputo. E comerciante e trabalha por encomenda há 02 anos. Não tem empregado, aprendeu a fazer o negócio com a sua amiga e o seu rendimento vária de 5.000,00mt a 6.000,00mt com os quais sustenta a família e consegue poupar algum fazendo xitique. 

Nunca trabalhou com nenhuma outra instituição de crédito e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000,00mt, com o qual pretende comprar blocos e cimento para a sua obra. Conheceu a Hluvuku através do seu pai que também e cliente da instituição.

Compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros financiamentos para poder concluir e mobilar a sua residência.
texts.en:
Olinda Benjamim M. was born in Maputo, Mozambique's capital. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of four children ages 13, 10, 4 and 5 months old, two of them attend school. She finished 9th grade but had to drop it due to an unexpected pregnancy. She lives in her house with her family and doesn't support anyone else besides her children and a maid that live with them. She's a saleswoman and has been doing it for the past 2 years with no other employees. She makes between U$170 and U$210 per month. She is asking for a U$700 loan in order to buy construction supplies to finish building her house. She hopes to pay this in a reasonable time so she can ask for another loan in order to finish the house and buy furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies (Cement, Rock, Sand, others)

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine B. is from the village of Batangan , Valencia Bukidnon. She is 26 years old and single. To make a living, Geraldine owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Geraldine has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Geraldine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldine is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Geraldine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is popular as “Remy” in her village located at Brgy. Murong, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is happily married to Angelito A. and they are gifted with two children. They aim to uplift their standard of living to give their children a better future.

Her husband cultivates their farm lot by planting rice and some vegetables while Remy manages their small general store in their village. She sells different groceries and soft drinks which she acquires from Bagabag Public Market.

She wants to improve her store to earn a higher income but her capital is not enough. Therefore she would like to borrow 10,000 PHP from KIVA lenders to acquire additional items for her store.

She is thankful if her loan is granted because it will give her the opportunity to improve her small business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie F. is from the village of Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 37 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children.

To make a living, Lanie raises livestock. Her main source of income comes from selling pigs to the local community. Lanie has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lanie joined GDMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lanie successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Lanie is requesting her second loan from GDMPC for 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase feed for the pigs.

She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs she sells.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20201070020) is a 46 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn nhóm 01 (1).

T. is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, T. operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from selling animal feed and farm-related products in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4200 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, T. joined SEDA to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. successfully repaid a previous loan of 5152 VND from SEDA which she used to expand her business. She is now requesting her 4th loan from SEDA, for 7392 VND, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. T. plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to her house.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group

1. Nguyễn K. C. (20201070021) is a 38 year-old male who is requesting a 5152 VND loan to support his business raising livestock.

2. Nguyễn V. B. (20201070022) is a 42 year-old male who is requesting a 5152 VND loan to support his service-based business.

3. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201070023) is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 5152 VND loan to support her recycling services business.

4. Nguyễn Thị M. (20201070024) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 5152 VND loan to support her service-based business.

5. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201070025) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 5152 VND loan to support her service-based business.

6. Nghiêm Thị L. (20201070026) is a 48 year-old female who is requesting a 5152 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20201070020) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trung Bạn nhóm 01 (1). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm thức ăn gia súc & có liên quan đến nông trại trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 4.200.000 VND. Vào 2007, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn K. C. (20201070021) là 38 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn V. B. (20201070022) là 42 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 3. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201070023) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế. 4. Nguyễn Thị M. (20201070024) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 5. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201070025) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 6. Nghiêm Thị L. (20201070026) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a store-owner in the village of Villa Marcos, Ramon, Isabela. She is married to Bernaldo, a farmer. The couple is blessed with five children: Nardelita, 30 years old; Marites, 24 years old; Marry Rose, 18 years old; Bernaldo Jr., 15 years old and the youngest is Mary Grace, 12 years old. Her family has a harmonious relationship with each other.

Fely is in need of additional funds in the amount of PHP 5,000. She hopes that the KIVA lenders will grant her request so that she can further expand her business and buy more groceries for her store. She would like to have stocks of products so that she could minimize her fare in going to and from the market. She hopes that her loan request will be profitable so that she could supply the needs of her family.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more stock of products for her store.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva B. is from the village of  Batangan, Valencia City. She is 26 years old. Eva is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Eva is requesting a  loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This  will be the 1st loan taken out by Eva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema T. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a business where she sells second hand clothes in the Kitunda district in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business goods wholesale from Mnazi Mmoja city shopping center and sells it retail to customers. She is married and her three children are in primary school. She has been running the business for three years at Kitunda and the business income is used to meet her family's daily demands. She needs a loan of TZS 800,000 to expand the business further.

loans.use: Expanding the business.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (20201070027) is a 39 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  N. is the leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn nhóm 09 (9).

N. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, N. works providing construction services to local community members.  N. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,800,000 VND a month from these activities.

N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 3,808,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by N. from SEDA.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20201070028) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Hà Thị B. (20201070029) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20201070030) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201070031) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Keo Village Bank Group

texts.en: A village bank loan which consists of fourteen people is located in Troeuy Troeng village in Kandal province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sokha K. is the village bank president. She is a dessert seller and is also a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more general products to resell to earn more income and improve her business. Her husband, Mr. Chhuon Bunthoen, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sokha K. is 44 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more general products to resell to earn more income and improve her business.

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe C. is from the village of  Batangan , Valencia Bukidnon. She is 25 years old. Mariafe is married and has 3 school-aged children. Mariafe owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Mariafe has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mariafe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Mariafe is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mariafe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou V., 23 years of age, sells mung beans and fish in her village, earning a net income of Php1,700 a month. Because that income is not sufficient for the needs of her family, she is requesting a loan of Php8,000 from Kiva lenders to buy more mung beans and fish so as to increase her income.

Marilou is married to Romeo, and they are blessed with a two-year-old child. The family resides in Culalabat, Cauayan City, a rural area. This entrepreneur aspires to uplift their living conditions for the welfare of their child, and now saves little by little for his education.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vegetable and fish vending business

loans.name: Hadjah Nakakande 's Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is 42 years-old and married with seven children aged between 12 and 22 years. All her children go to school. She resides and owns a four room house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Hadjah takes care of additional family members. The family gets three meals a day.

Hadjah has a stall in Kawempe and works seven days a week. She incurs transport costs to and from shopping in Kalerwe market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She sells to all categories of people and on average she receives 30 customers a day. Hadjah has been in this business for over four years, with Kiva partner MCDT for eight years and this will be her fourteenth loan. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises, school fees for her children and food for the family. Hadjah wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business grow and to begin selling only wholesale.

loans.use: To buy bunches of bananas.

loans.name: 11.1.1 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
H. Ngô Thị is a 55 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa. H. is the group leader of a six member group loan offered by Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 11.1.1 Nam Ngạn (02.11.1.1).

H. is widowed and has two adult children. H. owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dried goods in the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month.

In 2009, H. joined Kiva partner the Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her second loan from Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Lại Thị H. is a 40 year-old woman requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.

2. Nguyễn Thị C. is a 32 year-old woman requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3. Hoàng Thị C. is a 51 year-old woman requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

4. Hoàng Thị L. is a 43 year-old woman requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

5. Ngô Thị L. (6) is a 60 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.

About Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh H. Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh H. province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
